loans.name: Ganbaatar

texts.en:
Ganbaatar is 32 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a ger, a traditional nomadic yurt, in Zavhan province, Mongolia. His wife helps him run their family business of organic dairy products production and sales. His three children, all aged under seven, go to a local primary school and kindergarten respectively.

Ganbaatar started his family business of organic dairy products sales and production in 2008 with his wife. He also purchases large amounts of organic dairy products from other herders and stores them until winter, close to Lunar New Year, when the price goes up to the highest and he resells to local residents. He is now requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of organic dairy products from herders and sell to local residents at his stall. He is a hardworking, modest and friendly man.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of organic dairy products from herders and sell to local residents at his stall

loans.name: Yellow Group

texts.en:
Mariam is in her late twenties and married with three children in school.  She has been a food vendor for four years now.  She works from 5 a.m. to midnight daily, sells chips late at night, and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Mariam's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to buy a fair stock of food and has paid back her loan successfully.  She is happy with the loan.  She used the profit to pay school fees, buy a dressing table and cover household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy a good stock of food to sell to more people and to buy a sack of Irish potatoes and cooking oil.  She dreams of opening a big food cafe.

Mariam will share this loan with the other member of her loan group, Yellow. They will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a good stock of food, including Irish potatoes and cooking oil to sell to more people

loans.name: Bolor-Erdene

texts.en: Bolor-Erdene, 21 years old, lives with her husband in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been rendering taxi service to local people since 2011. Using her previous loan, she has purchased furniture such as a sofa and closet. Now she is requesting a loan of 1,600,000 MNT to buy a vacuum cleaner and washing machine. This will greatly increase the comfort of living in the ger. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who dreams about studying at a university and building her own house.

loans.use: to buy a vacuum cleaner and washing machine

loans.name: Gansuh

texts.en:
Gansuh is 36 years old and lives with his wife and son in their ger, a traditional nomadic yurt, in Zavhan province, Mongolia. His wife Uuganbayar has just started a clothes retail business in a rental stall at the local market. His son Osohbayar is three and goes to a local kindergarten.

Gansuh works as an inter province part-time driver at a transportation service company. He also helps his wife to run their family business of clothes retail during his off-duty time. His wife used to work as a saleswoman and has experience in the business. Gansuh is now requesting a loan of 1,200,000 MNT to pay his rental fee for six months to ensure his business stability. The Gansuhs are a hardworking and happy family.

loans.use: to pay his rental fee for six months to ensure his business stability

loans.name: Fe Ruina

texts.en:
To make a living, Fe Ruina operates a general store and also provides entertainment like video-k in their village. She has been engaged in this business for many years and she earns a good living. 

Fe Ruina had successfully repaid her previous loans from GDMPC, which she used in the business. She took a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She hopes to expand her business using the profit she earns from this loan and to be able to send her children to school and finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: La señora Martha, es una humilde trabajadora que se desempeña como conserje en un colegio público, es soltera actualmente tiene a su cargo a su hija menor. Martha solicita el crédito para instalación de puertas y mejorar el piso de los cuartos, así ir mejorando el entorno de su vivienda.
texts.en: Martha is a hard-working and humble woman who works as a caretaker at a local school.  She is single and has a young daughter who depends on her.  Martha is asking for a loan to put in doors and improve the floor where the bedrooms are.  In this way, she can improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy two wooden doors, sand, cement and tiles.

loans.name: Rahat

texts.en:
Rahat is 39 years old and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children.

Rahat owns a beauty parlor; she is an expert in makeover services. Most of her clients belong to the neighborhood and her clients appreciate her services a lot. With the passage of time her beauty products have been diminishing and this time she wants to buy more beauty products for her beauty salon. 
Therefore, Rahat requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so she would be able to buy beauty products for makeover services such as facial cream, bleach cream, nail polish, hair color, lotion etc.

Rahat wants to establish a parlor in the main market in town to enhance her income in the future. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for makeover services.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 26-year-old married man. He has one 1-year-old child whom he supports. 

He was introduced to Kadet Ltd. by a Kadet officer. He has had a stationery shop in Timboni for one-and-a-half years. In his business, he earns a monthly income of 7,250 KES. He is taking his first loan of 15,000 KES which he intends to use to add stock to his business by buying ink, printing papers, and books. Patrick will use the anticipated profit to expand his business by making it a wholesale shop. 

His hopes and dreams for his future business and family are to open another business and to educate his child.

loans.use: to buy ink, printing papers, and books to sell.

loans.name: Alcides

texts.es:
Alcides tiene36 años de edad, vive junto a sus hijos y esposa en el Caserío Piedra Grande, del distrito de Pomahuaca, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El cuenta con un taller propio de carpintería, ubicado en su propio domicilio, donde se dedica a la fabricación de puertas, ventanas, sillas, mesas, cuenta con clientela considerable por el buen trabajo que realiza, también se dedican a la agricultura cultivando pan llevar como son maíz, yuca para su consumo.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de materia prima de su trabajo, adornos y maderas y de esta manera atender a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Alcides is 36 years old, and he lives with his children and his wife in Caserío Piedra Grande, in the Pomahuaca district. His village works in farming, trade and livestock, situated two hours from the city of Jaén, which is part of the Cajamarca Region, in the northern highlands of Peru.

He has his own carpentry business, situated in his own home, where he works making doors, windows, chairs, and tables. He has many customers, due to the good work that he does. They also farm, growing staple food crops such as corn and yucca, which they eat.

He is asking for a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles to buy raw materials for his work, such as ornaments and wood, and thus serve his customers.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for his work, such as wood and metal ornaments.

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.es:
Leoncio es un señor de 42 años de edad, tiene 7 hijos de los cuales  5 hombres son hombres  y 2 mujeres, vive junto a ellos en Caserío Monte Mercedes, Sololá.
El es agricultor, dedicado al cultivo de  papa, cebolla, maíz y frijol. Esta labor la realiza en la comunidad donde vive; a través de  esta actividad obtiene ingresos aceptables que le ayudan al sostenimiento de su familia. Lleva más de 25 años realizando esta labor con la ayuda de sus hijos más jóvenes quienes lo apoyan en todo el trabajo que requieren estos cultivos.
El quiere mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia por lo cual está solicitando un préstamo de Q 5,500.00 para compra de piso cerámico 
Su sueño más grande es contar con una casa completa y de buena calidad para que sus hijos tengan un lugar digno para vivir.
texts.en:
Leoncio, 42, has five sons and two daughters.  He lives with them in Caserio Monte Mercedes, Solola. 

He is a farmer and he grows potatoes, onions, corn and beans.  He does this work in his own community and earns enough money to support his family.  He has been working this way for more than 25 years, and his younger sons help him whenever necessary.

He wants to improve the standard of living of his family and therefore he is asking for a loan of 5,500 quetzals to buy floor tiles.

His ultimate dream is to have a finished, good quality house so that his children have a dignified place to live in.

loans.use: to buy floor tiles.

loans.name: Maria Antonieta

texts.es:
Maria Antonieta agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado, ella desea seguir participando en este proyecto porque le ayuda a incrementar el capital del negocio y también se siente motivada para continuar trabajando en  su negocio ella continua con la venta de cosméticos y participando con el banco comunal “Virgen de Chanca”. 

Maria Antonieta en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para continuar comprando mercadería como por ejemplo perfumes, colonias, aretes, cremas, pinta labios y otras cosas más.
texts.en:
Maria Antonieta would like to thank the investors for the loan and is happy for the support she has received so far. She wishes to continue participating in this project, because it helps her to increase her business capital, and she also feels motivated to continue working in her business. She continues to sell cosmetics and participates with the community bank "Virgen de Chanca" (Chanca Virgin).

This time Maria Antonieta needs a loan to continue to buy merchandise such as perfume, cologne, earrings, creams, lipsticks and various other items.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics such as perfumes, colognes, earrings, creams, lipsticks etc...

loans.name: Miriam Cristina

texts.es: Miriam es una mujer emprendedora de 47 años, soltera, con dos hijos, su negocio es derivado del maíz como pinol, pinolillo, tamales rellenos, desde hace 10 años, lleva 9 ciclos obteniendo crédito en la institución. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de maíz, canela, clavo de olor, leña, maíz, cacao, dulce, azúcar, molida.
texts.en:
Miriam, 47, is an enterprising woman. She is single and has two children. She makes corn-based food, such as pinol [used for breading], pinolillo [a traditional drink in Nicaragua] and filled tamales. She has had this business for ten years and this is her ninth cycle with the institution.

Miriam is requesting a loan to buy corn, cinnamon, cloves, firewood, cocoa, sweetener and grind sugar.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as corn, cloves, cocoa, sugar and firewood.

loans.name: Ermalyn

texts.en:
Ermalyn is proud to say that she started her business because of ASKI. She sells small meals and snack food such as fish balls, hotdogs, and cold juice from an ambulant cart. 

She is married to a rice farmer and has two children. Ermalyn's husband manages their rice field and also drives their ambulant cart. She requests a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy fish balls, hotdogs, and  ingredients to make sauces for her business. 

Ermalyn wishes to have another business as an additional source of income.

loans.use: to buy fish balls, hotdogs, and ingredients to make sauces for her business.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel tiene 31 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y sus padres en el distrito de Zaña una comunidad que se encuentra cerca al valle del río Jequetepeque, lo que le ha permitido desarrollarse mediante la agricultura, su población también se dedica al comercio y ganadería a una hora con veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica al comercio de artículos de primera necesidad, su esposo brinda servicios musicales en una conocida orquesta local son una familia unida, Raquel ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de ropa y regalos para su negocio y de esta manera ofrecerlo a sus clientes, generándole ingresos para contribuir con su familia.
texts.en:
Rachel is 31 years old and lives together with her husband and her parents in the district of Zaña. This is a community that is near the Jequetepeque river valley, which has allowed it to develop through agriculture, with its population also involved in trade and livestock. It is one hour and twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo, in northern Peru.
Rachel has a business selling essential day-to-day items. Her husband provides music services as part of a well-known local orchestra. They are a close family. Raquel has requested a loan of 1000 Nuevos Soles in order to buy clothes and gifts for her business, in order to offer them to her customers, generating income to help her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes and gifts for her business.

loans.name: Twizigire Group

texts.fr:
Apollinaire fait partie du groupe  Twizigire  et habite à  Gitega. C’est une veuve de   35 ans.  

Il  fait le commerce de banane et de chevres depuis 10 ans. 

Il  est à son troisième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter   une grande quantité de bananes et beaucoup de chèvres  à  revendre  pour gagner  plus.
texts.en:
Apollinaire, age 35, is a widow who lives in Gitega. She's a member of Twizigire Group.

For the past ten years, she's been selling bananas and goats. She's seeking her third loan from Kiva's partner, Turame.

She will use her Kiva loan to bolster her working capital and buy a large quantity of bananas and lots of goats to resell, in order to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy bananas and goats

loans.name: Cresenciano

texts.es:
Cresenciano tiene 49 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el Caserío Chaupe una zona rural del distrito de Querocotillo, es una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Cutervo que se encuentra en la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura cultivando maíz desde hace 15 años, cuenta con clientela considerable, ha solcitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para su cultivo de maíz y pago de mano de obra para el mantenimiento del mismo y de esta manera tener una buena producción para ofrece a sus clientes, lo que le generara mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Cresenciano is 49 years old and lives with his wife in Caserío Chaupe, a rural village in the district of Querocotillo. It is a community that is involved in agriculture, commerce and livestock, located around two hours from the city of Cutervo, which is found in the Cajamarca region in the northern highlands of Peru.

He has worked in agriculture, growing corn, for the past 15 years. He has a substantial clientele and is requesting a loan of 2000 Nuevos Soles through our field partner Edpyme Alternativa in order to buy fertilizer to help grow his corn crop and to pay for labour for crop maintenance. This will help him to have a good crop yield to offer to his clients, which will generate greater income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to help grow his corn crop and to pay for labour for crop maintenance.

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude lives in Kakamega. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya and is famous for having the only tropical rain forest in the country. Most farmers in Kakamega grow maize, but sugarcane, papaya, bananas and tea are also popular crops. The variety of crops grown in the region, as well as the abundance of vegetation in the old growth forest, make Kakamega particularly attractive for beekeeping.

Getrude is married and has four children. Her husband is a teacher and she farms. They have farmed for twelve years. Getrude is excited about beekeeping for additional income and also because it will be a source of honey for medicinal use.

This is Getrude’s first loan with Honey Care. She plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to expand her farming projects. Getrude’s hope for the future is to educate her children and have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en: Perlita is 29 years old and has one child. She lives in a rural community and buys and sells used TV sets and VCD players. She aims to make her business viable in order to increase her income and meet daily needs. Having inadequate capital, she asks for a loan of 13,000.00 PHP to buy additional  TV sets and VCD players to sell. She is patient and is determined to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional TV sets and VCD players to sell

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe  BENKADI de l’association  MIIRIYA sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  35 ans et 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des familles traditionnelles à   OUAYERMA I, un des quartiers de la 3ème région administrative du Mali (SIKASSO).
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités de commerce. 
Elles sont à leur première  prêt avec l’institution et sont à leur début de collaboration.
Les spéculations à vendre sont les  pagnes wax, farines, condiments etc.  Mme   AMINATA 1ère  personne à gauche de la photo compte acheter avec son prêt des pagnes wax. Elle s’approvisionne sur place et effectue ses ventes au comptant en détail et à crédit à une clientèle constituée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 20 000 francs CFA par mois.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The four members of the Benkadi subgroup of Miiriya are married women with an average age of 35 years and an average of 4 children each. They all live in traditional extended families in Ouayerma I, one of the neighborhoods of the third administrative region of Mali. The women are partnering with the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso in order to better run their businesses.

The women are on their first loan with the organization and at the beginning of their partnership. They sell wax "pagne" (the traditional colorful cloth of western Africa), flour, spices, etc. 

Aminata, the first woman pictured on the far left of the photo, plans to use her loan to purchase wax "pagne" cloth. She stocks up in the area and makes her retail sales for cash and credit to a customer base made up of both men and women. She hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA. This will allow her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase "pagne" cloth

loans.name: Choeun's Group

texts.en:
Choeun is 48 years old and a citizen from Battambang province’s Moung Russey district. She is a mother of nine children and supports four children that are either too young for school or are in school. For the sake of her dependent children, she grows rice and works for others to earn a decent income. She has had this business for a long time. 

Choeun is a third-time borrower and her joint fellow group member is a second-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has successfully repaid her previous loans which has enabled her to improve her living conditions and keep her children in school. 

As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay the harvesting fee. She believes that the yield will double that of previous times and  she can earn a good income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to pay the harvesting fee.

loans.name: Deolinda

texts.en:
Deolinda is 40 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living as a coconut farmer in the Philippines. Deolinda wishes to borrow 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy coconut seedlings and other farming supplies.

Deolinda has grown coconut for 5 years and also earns additional income from growing vegetables.

She works tirelessly to attain her dream which is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy coconut seedlings and other farming supplies.

loans.name: Disterio

texts.en:
Disterio lives in Kakamega. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya, close to the Ugandan border. It contains the only tropical rain forest in Kenya, and the variety of the flora in the region makes it well suited for beekeeping. It has one of the highest rural population densities in the world (in some areas, close to 600 people per square kilometer), which may contribute to the region's high poverty rate.

Disterio is married and has twenty one children. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have farmed for twenty seven years and currently grow sugar cane, maize, rice and sweet potatoes. Disterio is excited about beekeeping because it easy to manage.

This is Disterio’s first loan with Honey Care. He plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to educate his children to a higher level. Disterio’s hope for the future is to be financially stable and build a comfortable house for his family.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Dúo Bucaro Group

texts.es:
Dúo Bucaro
La señora Rosa Francisca es madre de 3 hijos es propietaria de la venta de cosméticos ubicada en el búcaro zona 12. La venta de cosméticos que ella administra tiene 15 años de tenerla cuando ella empezó a administrarla era muy pequeña pero con la ayuda de Dios ella le ha dado una buena administración y ha logrado creceR aun más. Testifica ella que le beneficia porque vende al mayor y a sus clientes le puede dar un mejor servicio. ella tiene sueños y metas muy grandes ella quiere que su negocio sé de, a conocer mucho más en los mercados y brindarle una mejor educación a sus hijos, esperando que por medio de ustedes ella pueda logra sus metas.
texts.en:
Dúo Bucaro
Mrs. Rosa Francisca is a mother of 3 children and is the proprietor of a stall selling cosmetics in the búcaro zone 12. The cosmetics shop that she administers is 15 years old. When she began to manage the stall it was very small but with God's help she has managed it well and has succeeded in growing the business even more. She testifies that it benefits her because she sells wholesale and can give her clients a better service. She has great dreams and goals. She wants her business to be known, particularly in the markets and she wants to provide a better education for her children. She hopes that through you she can achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is from Relocation Site Olingan Dipolog City. She is a 57-year-old widow with two children. 

Josephine began her membership with PMPC in 2006 because of the benefits available to the members. She is a member in good standing and repays her obligation in a timely manner. Josephine asks for financial assistance of 30,000.00 PHP to purchase materials to repair her house. Josephine dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life.

loans.use: to purchase materials to repair her house.

loans.name: Chérifatou

texts.fr: Âgée de 30ans, et n'ayant pas d'enfants en charge, madame Chérifatou a commencé son activité génératrice de revenus depuis 2006. Elle revend des ustensiles de cuisine(gobelets, fourchettes,verres à boire...). Pour améliorer le niveau de son commerce, elle fait une première demande à WAGES pour acheter des marchandises. Elle souhaite à l'avenir ouvrir une boutique pour exposer ses marchandises et se lancer plus tard dans la vie maritale.
texts.en:
Chérifatou is 30 years old and has no children in her care. She began her business in 2006; she resells kitchen utensils (cups, forks, drinking glasses, etc.) 

In order to raise the level of her business, Chérifatou is requesting a first loan from WAGES to purchase merchandise. She hopes in the future to open a shop to display her merchandise and later to experience married life.

loans.use: to purchase kitchen utensils

loans.name: Saint Jean Baptiste Group

texts.fr:
Mme DELPHINE est responsable du groupe SAINT JEAN BAPTISTE.  Elle se porte très bien. Marié, elle est mère 05enfants. Le plus âgé 15ans et le moins âgé 06mois. 03 vont à l’école.
Mme fait la transformation (prépare et vend du dolo) depuis 08ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Bendatoega. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.
Elle veut s’acheter 03 sacs de mil et 04 charettes de bois de chauffe.
Mme veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Elle ambitionne étendre les limites de son activité et aider à scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Delphine is the representative of the Saint Jean Baptiste group. She carries herself very well. She is married and the mother of 5 children, the oldest of whom is 15 and the youngest of whom is 6 months old. Three of her children attend school. 

Delphine has been in the business of preparing and selling dolo (millet beer) for 8 years. She stocks up at a market in Bendatoega. Her customers are both men and women. Delphine would like to purchase 3 bags of millet and 4 pallets of charcoal. She plans to reinvest her profits in her business. Delphine's goal is to expand her business and to help educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase 3 bags of millet and 4 pallets of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her son's school fee.

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Dennis lives in Kakamega. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya, close to the Ugandan border. It contains the only tropical rain forest in Kenya, and the variety of the flora in the region makes it well suited for beekeeping. It has one of the highest rural population densities in the world (in some areas, close to 600 people per square kilometer), which may contribute to the region's high poverty rates.

Dennis is married and has three children. His wife is a business woman and he farms. They have farmed for five years and currently grow bananas, maize, beans and vegetables. Dennis is looking forward to beekeeping as it is easy to manage and does not require much of his time.

This is Dennis’ first loan with Honey Care. He plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to buy more beehives. Dennis’ hope for the future is to have his children graduate from university so that they can get good jobs.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Lesly Patricia

texts.es:
Lesly es una joven de 28 años de edad quien es ama de casa y agricultora, madre de 3 hijos el primero cursa la primaria, el segundo en educación preescolar y el ultimo recién nacido. Su compañero de hogar es maestro de educación primaria en el cargo de director en una escuela del área rural mismo que al salir de sus actividades estudiantiles se dirige al campo donde apoya a su pareja en las diferentes actividades que son llevadas a cabo para el mantenimiento del café. Desde hace más de 9 años ella trabaja dicha actividad mismo tiempo que tiene de estar junto a su pareja ya que quien le enseño a trabajar fue el mismo. Como otro medio de ingreso que tiene Lesly son los servicios secretariales fotocopias, digitalización en computadoras y servicio de Internet a los estudiantes.
Sus planes para el negocio de servicios secretariales comprar 3 computadoras mas ya que la demanda de los servicios que ella da con el Internet no se da abasto ya que en la actualidad solo tiene 2 computadoras. Para con su negocio de café lograr una excelente cosecha para el próximo año ya que la roya afecto parte de sus cultivos y en la actualidad junto a su pareja quieren re construir con una nueva plantación.
Por lo que hoy en día ella ha solicitado financiamiento para la compra de fertilizantes, abono, foliares, pago de mano de obra para la limpieza y la recolección de la parte de la cosecha que pudo salvar ya que su ingresos también dependen de este rubro para apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios y con las diferentes necesidades básicas como la alimentación, vestimenta y medicina con muchas restricciones.
texts.en:
Lesly, 28, is a young woman. She works as a housewife and in agriculture. She has three children: the oldest one goes to primary school, the second one to preschool and the third one is a newborn. Her partner is a primary school teacher and the director of a rural school. Once he finishes working he helps her to take care of their coffee plantations.

Lesly has been working for more than nine years in agriculture. It was her partner who taught her and they have been together all this time. She receives an additional income from copying and scanning documents, and from providing internet access to students. She plans to buy three additional computers, since the demand is high and she cannot cope with it only with two.

Regarding her coffee plantations, she hopes to improve her harvest next year, since some of her plantations had roya [a fungus that causes coffee rust] last year. She is working together with her partner to replant them. This is why she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, compost, foliar sprays and to pay for the labor needed to clean the plantations and pick what she could save from getting ruined. Her income depends on this. She uses it to pay for her children’s education and for the family’s food, medicines and clothes, but the budget is tight.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such and pay for labor for her coffee plantations.

loans.name: Sergio Rodrigo

texts.es:
Sergio tiene 28 años de edad estado civil Soltero vive con sus abuelos no tiene hijos. Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.
La ventanilla se llama SAN NICOLAS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Nicolás, perteneciente a la parroquia Ricaurte cantón Urdaneta, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Sergio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.
El crédito solicito para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos y mejorar el estilo de vida. Su sueño es seguir en la agricultura y cumplir con los proyectos que se propone.
Le gusta hacer deporte, y mirar la televisión.
texts.en:
Sergio is 28 years old and single. He lives with his grandparents and has no children. He lives in Ventanas canton, De los Ríos province. He is a member of communal bank San Nicolas, in the village of San Nicolas, which is located in a community called Ricaurte, in the Urdaneta canton. Their activities are mainly related to agriculture and livestock.

Sergio works in agriculture. He has been growing corn and rice for some years now. He buys his supplies in Ventanas and sells his produce at Ventanas’s marketplace. He is requesting a loan to buy compost and fertilizers for his rice and corn plantations. The loan helped him to increase his income and improve his quality of life. His dream is to continue working in agriculture and reach the goals he sets.

He likes to play sports and watch television.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for his rice and corn plantations.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is a 58-year-old woman and lives in the village of Sergieti, in Martvili district. She lives with her husband, George, who is temporarily unemployed. Marine graduated from pedagogical college, but in the region there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make a living. 

Her family is involved in agricultural activities and generates approximately 400 GEL (Georgian Laris) monthly. They have three cows, 400 units of nuts and 0.8 hectares of agricultural land. Marine and her husband work hard on family-owned agricultural land, but as the family has only seasonal income, she decided to set up a grain mill and grind grain. 

She is seeking credit from local financial institutions. The start up program, that is, the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. Her application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 3,300 GEL for purchasing a mill. She will grind grain for her family's needs and for rural residents. The new business initiative will give Marine the chance to have financial stability and increase her monthly income.

loans.use: to set up a grain mill and grind grain.

loans.name: Eng

texts.en:
Eng is a 41-year-old resident from Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province. She has four dependent children; two are preschoolers and two are school-aged. 

Rice and cassava farming are her family's main source of income for daily expenses. Eng is a second-cycle borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her previous loan and its positive impact has enabled her to improve her living conditions. For this cycle, she requests a loan of 2,500,000 KHR to buy fertilizer to grow cassava. She believes that she can triple the yield from previous years.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her cassava

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent lives in Kakamega. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya and is famous for its rain forest. Many farmers in the area grow maize, sugar cane and bananas, with maize being the primary crop. The density of the old growth trees in the Kakamega forest, and the variety of crops grown in the area, make this an excellent area for beekeeping.

Vincent is married and has twenty children. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have farmed for forty years and currently grow trees, maize, and soy beans. They also raise poultry. Vincent is excited about beekeeping because it will earn him extra income and it will  provide him with honey for medicinal use.

This is Vincent’s first loan with Honey Care. He plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to buy a dairy cow. Vincent’s hope for the future is for his children to be well educated.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Huseyn

texts.ru:
Хусейн имеет высшее юридическое образование. Он работает адвокатом в своем районе Кубадиён. Хусейну 50 лет. Он женат, является отцом четверых детей. Трое из его детей учатся в школе, четвертый еще маленький.
  Последние 4 года Хусейн одновременно занимается растениеводством. Он имеет 0, 16 га приусадебного участка земли и выращивает там все виды овощей и зелень. Хусейн совмещает свою работу с растениеводством. Он после работы, а также в выходные дни работает на грядке. Ему нравится заниматься посевом. Он получает энергию от такой работы. Хусейн не только получает доход с деятельности, но и обеспечивает семью свежими и экологически чистыми овощами и зеленью. В данный момент Хусейн готовит землю к очередному посеву. Чтобы купить семена овощей и минеральных удобрений, ему не хватило немного средств. Поэтому он обратился за кредитом.
texts.en:
Huseyn has a law degree. He works as a lawyer in his region of Qubadiyon. Huseyn is 50 years old. He is married and is a father of four children. Three of his children go to school and the fourth one is still little.

Huseyn has been also doing field crop cultivation for the last four years. He has a 0.16 hectares of land where he grows all kinds of vegetables and greens. Huseyn combines his work with agriculture. After work and also during the weekends he works on the field. He likes to sow and gets energy from this type of work. Huseyn does not only get income from this business, but also provides his family with fresh and ecologically clean vegetables and greens. At this time Huseyn is preparing the land for the next sowing. He does not have enough money to buy seeds of vegetables and mineral fertilizer and that's why he has come to ask for a loan.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Sarorn's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Sarorn is a mother in late 40s and currently supports two children (of five) school-aged children. 

Her cassava farming and pig-raising business are the main source of income to cover the daily cost of living for her family. She has joined a group of four to borrow 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy pig feed. She hopes that she can raise healthy pigs and get a good sell price.

loans.use: to buy pig feed.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph lives in Kakamega. Kakamega is located in Western Kenya and is famous for the Kakamega Forest, the only tropical rain forest in Kenya. It is a very good location for beekeeping due to the old growth trees in the forest and concentration of farms in the area, which provide bees with a variety of forage.

Joseph is married and has seventeen children. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have farmed for thirty years and grow maize, beans, vegetables, passion fruits and trees. Joseph is excited about beekeeping because it will be a source of income for his family.

This is Joseph’s first loan with Honey Care. He intends to use the proceeds from his beehives to educate his children and buy a cow. Joseph’s hope for the future is to own a Pick-up and to have enough income to take good care of his family.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Kimsreang's Group

texts.en:
Kimsreang is a 29-year-old widow. She supports one preschooler and one school-aged child.  Her primary source of income is growing cassava and rice.  She also works for others to supplement her income. She can earn up to 27,200 KHR per day. 

With VisionFund (Kiva’ partner), she is in the fifth cycle and her joint borrower is in the fourth cycle.  She successfully repaid her previous loan which she used to stabilize her living. For this cycle, she is a leader in her group of two. She will spend her entire loan portion to pay the plowing fee and labor cost for her crops.  She will also buy insecticide and potash. She believes that she will get a good yield and be able to earn more income to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to pay the plowing fee and labor costs for her crops, and buy insecticide and  potash.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 47 years old and married with six children.

Teresita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requests a 27,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like snack foods, canned goods, soap, shampoo, and noodles.

Teresita has previously borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF. She has run the general store for 18 years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

Teresita aspires to save enough money to buy land.

loans.use: to purchse items to sell like snack foods, canned goods, soap, shampoo, and noodles.

loans.name: Seang's Group

texts.en:
Seang is a local farmer who grows rice and cassava to cover the daily cost of living. This business generates 34,000 KHR per day. 

She is the breadwinner of her family consisting of one child. 

This is the first loan for Seang’s group (composed of two) with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). They each seek 500,000 KHR. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy potash for her cassava. She does hope that she can get a better yield from this year's crop.

loans.use: To buy potash for her cassava

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell vegetable business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional vegetables. Lily has been in this business for 5 years. She earns more income from food vending.

Lily has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can have her own stall in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Tajikhan

texts.ru: Тажикан 55 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 дочерей. У Тажикан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Тажикан занимается животноводством, стартовав 30 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Тажикан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, а также имеет земельный надел размером 1,50 ГА, на которой выращивает: рис, кукурузу и хлопок. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Тажикан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку бычков для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Тажикан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины. а также намерена приготовить приданное для своих дочерей.
texts.en: Tajikhan is 55 years old and is raising five daughters with her husband.  She has a high school education and she raises livestock as the main source of income for her family.  She started this business 30 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 5,000 som KGS.  Thanks to her hard work, Tajikhan now has one dairy cow and a 1.5 hectare plot of land on which she grows rice, corn and cotton.  Her monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS).  With the goal of developing her business further, Tajikhan turned to the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for a loan to buy bulls to fatten up and sell on for a profit at the local market.  She plans to use the income from this to further increase her head of livestock, and she intends to prepare items for her daughters' dowries.

loans.use: to buy steers for fattening and resale

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis lives in kakamega. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya and is famous for having the only tropical rain forest in the country. Most farmers in Kakamega grow maize, but sugarcane, papaya, bananas and tea are also popular crops. The variety of crops grown in the region, as well as the abundance of vegetation in the old growth forest, make Kakamega particularly attractive for beekeeping.

Francis is married and has eleven children. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have farmed for thirty five years and grow maize, sugar cane and bananas. Francis is looking forward to beekeeping because it is not an expensive venture.

This is Francis’ first loan with Honey Care. He intends to use the proceeds from his beehives to buy food for his family and to educate his children. Francis’ hope for the future is to have his children get good jobs after schooling and that his family will live a happy life.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Dinara

texts.ru: Динаре 39 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Динары - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Динара занимается животноводством, стартовав 18 лет назад, с покупки скота на 20,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Динары, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 1 теленок. Ежемесячный доход составляет 13,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Динара обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку бычков для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Динара планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Dinara is 39 years old and she is raising two children with her husband.  She has a high school education and she raises livestock as the main source of income for her family.  She started this business 18 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 20,000 som KGS.  Thanks to her hard work, Dinara now has three dairy cows and one calf on her farm.  Her monthly income is 13,000 som (KGS).  With the goal of developing her business further, Dinara has turned to the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for a loan to buy bulls so she can increase her head of livestock.  She plans to use the income from this to further increase her head of livestock and to save up for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy steers

loans.name: Arapatkhan

texts.ru: Арапатхан 53 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. У Арапатхан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Арапатхан занимается животноводством, стартовав 34 года назад, с покупки скота на 3,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Арапатхан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, а также имеет земельный надел размером 1,17 ГА, на которой выращивает хлопок, кукурузу, ячмень. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Арапатхан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку бычков для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Арапатхан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и намерена собрать средства на проведение свадебного торжества для сына.
texts.en: Arapatkhan is 53 years old and she is married with five daughters.  She has a high school education and she raises livestock as the main source of income for her family.  She started this business 34 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 3,000 som KGS.  Thanks to her hard work, her farm now has two dairy cows as well as a 1.17 hectare plot of land on which she grows cotton, corn and barley.  Her monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS).  With the goal of developing her business further, Arapatkhan has turned to the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" so she can buy bulls to fatten up and sell on for a profit at the local market.  She plans to use the income from this to further increase her head of livestock, as well as to save up money for her son's wedding.

loans.use: to buy steers for fattening and resale

loans.name: Rocelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Rocelyn works hard to support her family. She has a buy and sell fruit business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from food vending.  Rocelyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of fruits to sell.

Rocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can buy land.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruit to sell.

loans.name: Jypargul

texts.ru: Жыпаргул 39 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Жыпаргул - среднее образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Жыпаргул занимается полеводством, стартовав 13 лет назад, с 6,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Жыпаргул, на сегодняшний день имеется:2 дойные коровы, 13 овец, а также 1,05 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает перец, арбузы, дыни для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жыпаргул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку семян перца, а также удобрений и ядохимикатов для обработки земли. Доходы от кредита Жыпаргул планирует вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового дополнительного помещения для скота.
texts.en: Jypargul is 39 years old and she is married with four children.  She has a high school education and she raises livestock as the main source of income for her family, a business she started 13 years ago with 6,000 som KGS.  Thanks to her hard work, her farm now has two dairy cows, 13 sheep and a 1.05 hectare plot of land on which she grows annual crops of peppers, watermelon, and honeydew for her family's consumption and for resale.  Her monthly income is 5,000 som (KGS).  With the goal of developing her business further, Jypargul has turned to the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for a loan to buy pepper seeds, fertilizer and pesticides to for her agricultural work.  She plans to use the income from this to further increase her head of livestock and she wants to save up money to build a new pen for her livestock.

loans.use: to buy pepper seeds, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Lutfiniso

texts.ru:
Лутфинисо добрая, общительная женщина. Ей 39 лет. Замужем. Имеет троих детей. Дети уже взрослые мамины помощники. Старший сын Лутфинисо уехал в Россию на заработки, чтобы материально помочь родителям. Муж Лутфинисо Ориф работает в центре района таксистом,а летом  подрабатывает штукатуром. Сама Лутфинисо торгует на рынке. Она продает промышленные товары . На сегодняшней день у нее очень много клиентов,а когда то Луфтинисо все начинала с нуля. 
Благодаря организации МДО "Арванд" она расширила свой бизнес. Вот уже третий год подряд она сотрудничает с организацией, берет деньги в кредит для товарооборота. Лутфинисо в очередной раз подала заявку на кредит, на полученные деньги она с другого города привезет товары. Луфтинисо очень благодарна МДО "Арванд" за оказанную поддержку и за доверия!
texts.en: Lutfiniso is a kind and sociable woman.  She is 39 years old and she is married with three children, who all grew up helping their mother.  Her eldest son is a migrant worker in Russia and he sends money home to help his parents.  Lutfiniso's husband, Ofir, works in the center of their region as a taxi driver and in the summer he works as a plasterer.  Lutfiniso herself works in the market selling industrial goods.  She has many clients today, but she once started with none.  Thanks to the organization "Arvand," she has been able to expand her business.  This is Lutfiniso's third time working with Arvand, borrowing money for her business.  She has once again asked for a loan, and on receiving the funds will get her goods from another city.  Lutfiniso is very grateful to Arvand for their support and confidence.

loans.use: to buy industrial goods

loans.name: Tecklah

texts.en:
Tecklah lives in Kinondo, a small town in Kwale County. Kwale County is located on the Kenyan coast, and is the southernmost Kenyan county. Though some of the towns along the beach see benefits from tourism, the majority of people living inland are farmers, and the region's inconsistent rains can make agricultural yields unpredictable. Beekeeping is a relatively new activity in the area, but many farmers here are enthusiastic at the prospect of owning their own hives.

Tecklah is married and has one child. Her husband is a teacher while she undertakes farming. They are currently growing pineapples on their farm. Tecklah is excited about beekeeping as it will be a good source of honey for medicinal use.

This is Tecklah’s first loan with Honey Care. She is interested in working with Honey Care because they are prompt in giving information and updates. She plans to use the income generated from her beehives to build a farm house. Tecklah’s hope for the future is to buy an irrigation system to irrigate her land.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Savin's Group

texts.en: Savin is 49 years old and married. She is a resident of Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district where she does her cassava farming and rice cropping. Long involved in her current business, Savin is able earn to around 41,000 KHR per day. With VisionFund (Kiva's field partner), Savin  is requesting 500,000 KHR and her co-borrower is requesting 1,000,000 KHR; both of them are making a first-time loan. As a leader, Savin will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her crop. She strongly believes that she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her crop.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam lives in Kidzumbani, a small town in Kwale County. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast, and borders Tanzania to the south. Inconsistent rainfalls make farming difficult and contribute to the area's high poverty rates. Despite the unreliable rainfall, bees in the region have two excellent sources of food: wild mangrove forest and local passion fruit plantations. Beekeeping is relatively new to the area, but many farmers are very interested in owning hives.

Miriam is married and has one child. Both she and her husband are farmers. They are currently growing a Casurina tree plantation in their farm. Miriam is excited about beekeeping as it is a good source of honey for domestic use. 

This is Miriam’s first loan with Honey Care. She is interested in working with Honey Care because they have very professional service. She intends to use the proceeds generated from her beekeeping to pay for her college fees. Miriam’s hope for the future is to establish a commercial apiary.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Jehova Es Mi Guerrero Group

texts.es: El grupo lo forman tres socias muy trabajadoras comerciantes una de ellas es Claudia tiene la edad de 40 años, acompañada, con dos hijos bajo su responsabilidad, su negocio es una pulpería y venta de ropa desde hace 9 años. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de pacas de ropa, talladores, quintal de arroz, quintal de azúcar,  bidón de aceite, pollo, cajilla de gaseosas, golosinas. Angélica tiene 23 años su negocio es la venta de plástico, Justa de 61 años su negocio es la venta de nacatamales.
texts.en: The group is made up of three very hardworking shopkeepers.  One of them is 40-year-old Claudia who has a partner and two dependent children.  She has run her grocery shop and sold clothing for 9 years.  She is applying for the loan to buy bales of clothing, size labels, 100lbs of rice, 100lbs of sugar, a can of oil, chickens, cans of soft drinks and sweets.  Angélica, who is 23, sells plastic goods and Justa, who is 61, sells tamales (a traditional meat dish).

loans.use: to buy bales of clothing, size labels, 100lbs of rice, 100lbs of sugar, a can of oil, chickens, cans of soft drinks and sweets

loans.name: Kangni

texts.fr: Kangni est célibataire. Il est âgé de 32ans et a appris comme métier la soudure. En 2009, après sa formation, il a ouvert son atelier dans lequel il se fait aidé par un apprenti. Pour l'avancement de son métier, il sollicite un premier crédit pour acheter des matériaux pour  fabrication des portes métalliques. Il espère ouvrir une boutique d'alimentation générale et agrandir son activité.
texts.en: Kangni is unmarried. He is 32 years old and trained to be a welder. In 2009, after his training, he opened his workshop, where he is helped by an apprentice. To advance his career, he is seeking his first loan to buy materials to make metallic doors. He hopes to open a general food store and expand his business.

loans.use: To buy materials to make metallic doors

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Norma works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from buying and selling sea cucumber.  Norma is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Norma has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita is 58 years old, a vendor and a simple citizen in the village. She earns PHP 300 daily and it goes for meals and school expenses. She is happy with her income but aspires to increase it so she can improve her profits too. Nenita is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy soft drinks, eggs, bread, and canned goods to sell. She hopes to keep extending good products and services to all her customers and gain good profits for her family’s welfare.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, eggs, bread, and canned goods to sell.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul lives in Kidzumbani, a small town in Kwale County. Kwale County is located on the Kenyan coast near the border of Tanzania. While beekeeping has not historically been a major activity in the region, the mangrove swamps closer to the coast and large passion fruit farms inland provide bees with robust sources of nectar. Though most farmers in the area are new to beekeeping, many are very enthusiastic about keeping bees.

Paul is married and has one child. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for six years now and they currently have a tree plantation on their farm. Paul is excited about beekeeping as it is a good source of income which requires little input.

This is Paul’s first loan with Honey Care. Paul is interested in working with Honey Care as it will be a beneficial partnership. Paul intends to use the proceeds from his beehives to enroll for training in specialized driving. Paul’s hope for the future is to establish a commercial apiary.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth lives in a small town in Kwale County. Kwale County is located on the Kenyan coast near the border of Tanzania. While beekeeping has not historically been a major activity in the region, the mangrove swamps closer to the coast and large passion fruit farms inland provide bees with robust sources of nectar. Honey Care has offered farmers in the area a chance to purchase year-old beehives that have been repaired and re-waxed, and many individuals opt to buy these cheaper hives instead of new ones.

Ruth is single and has no children. She is a farmer and has been farming for about five years now. She currently has a tree plantation on her farm which is very good for beekeeping. Ruth is looking forward to beekeeping as it will be a good source of honey for medicinal use.

This is Ruth’s first loan with Honey Care. She plans to use the proceeds generated from her beehives to pay for her college fees. Ruth’s hope for the future is to expand her beekeeping project.

loans.use: to buy refurbished beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Zawadi Group

texts.fr: La cliente Shamamba est une commerçante depuis 6 ans, vice présidente et membré d’un groupe d’affaires «Zawadi», âgée de 46 ans, mariée et mère de 9 enfants qui 8, étudient et 1 encore gosse. Elle est vendeuse des Fretins (petits poissons). Elle étale sa marchandise tout au long de la route dans un quartier animé. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter ½ sac de fretins(petits poissons). Son conjoint s’occupe de travaux de champs. Elle avait commencé ses business avec de fonds reçu de son mari après récolte agricole. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien, qu’elle apporte aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancables. Il sied de signaler certaines clientes portent leur bébés.
texts.en: The client, Shamamba, has been a merchant for 6 years, and is a member and vice president of the "Zawadi" business group. She is 46 years old, married, and has nine children, eight of whom are in school and one still a child. She sells small fish fry. She displays her merchandise along the road in a busy part of town. She is seeking a loan with Hekima to expand her business. She is going to buy half a bag of fish fry. Her husband works in the fields. She began her business with funds from her husband after the agricultural harvest. In the future, she hopes to educate and feed her children. She is grateful to Hekima for its support of female entrepreneurs outside the traditional banking system. It should be noted that certain clients in the photo are carrying their babies.

loans.use: To buy half a bag of fish fry

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
Allan lives in Kidzumbani, a small town in Kwale County. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast, near Tanzania. Inconsistent rains, especially recently, have made farming difficult, and the poverty rates in the county are above the Kenyan average. Beekeeping is somewhat new to Kwale, but the passion fruit farms and mangrove forests throughout the area provide excellent sources of nectar for bee colonies. Many farmers in the area have expressed excitement at the prospect of owning their own hives, and having a second source of income from their honey to help care for their families.

Allan is married but has no children. Both he and his wife are farmers. They currently have a tree plantation on their farm, as well as dairy cows such as the one pictured with him above. Allan is looking forward to beekeeping as it is a good source of income that requires little input. 

This is Allan’s first loan with Honey Care. He is interested in working with Honey Care as they offer very good training. Allan intends to use the proceeds from his beehives to build a poultry house. Allan’s hope for the future is to expand his beekeeping project.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Thy is a 56-year-old woman from a small village of Bakan district, Pursat province. She is married and has been blessed with six children. Four of them are engaged in the farming and construction industry while the remaining two still depend on her income and are going to school. Thy and her husband are farmers. They have been farming rice as the main crop to augment their income to meet the needs of the family.

Currently, Thy’s family doesn’t have a safe latrine for use at home, so she wants to improve sanitation for her family. That’s why she is asking for a loan to build a latrine and buy its accessories. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Thy is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a latrine and buy its accessories.

loans.name: Bayarbat

texts.en:
Mr. Bayarbat, 27 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his wife have been selling furniture to local people since 2008. He brings furniture from China at a relatively low price and later sells them to local people at reasonable price. Also when households replace their old furniture, he buys, fixes them and later sells them for profit. 

Mr. Bayarbat is now he requesting a loan of 2,400,000 MNT to buy furniture such as closets, drawers, sofas and tables from China. Just before White Moon, a Mongolian national holiday, demand for furniture and other goods increases, thus opening great opportunities for his business. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy furniture.

loans.name: Amigas De Huancane Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMIGAS DE HUANCANE” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Nicolasa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de queso, venta de api, venta de leche, venta de pan, venta de ganado.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Nicolasa es integrante, ella indica que hace tres ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de queso y leche; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres, ya que el mismo fue un negocio familiar, posterior a tener su matrimonio decide emprender su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ganado vacuno) que adquirirá de las comunidades del departamento de La Paz y posteriormente a la crianza lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal association “AMIGAS DE HUANCANE” will be starting its third cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Copacabana centre. It is made up of eight members and is run by a board of directors of which Nicolasa is the President. The businesses which the members of the communal association run are varied and among them are: selling cheese, selling "Api" [a hot drink made from purple corn], selling milk, selling bread and selling cattle.
 
The loan they will take out will benefit small businesswomen of which Nicolasa is a member. She says she joined Pro Mujer three cycles ago after being invited by a promoter from the institution who went to visit her in her home. Currently she has a business selling cheese and milk and she says she learnt the business from her parents as it was the family business. After getting married she decided to start up her own business.

The loan she will take out is to increase capital to buy cattle, which she will buy from the communities in the la Paz department. After raising the cattle she will sell them at her sales outlet. This kind of work allows her to generate income to maintain her family, since she is married and has a son. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she likes the savings which the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Gaffur

texts.ru:
Гаффур проживает в районе Спитамен. Ему 49 лет. Он очень добрый человек. Любит природу, животных. С ранних лет помогал родителям в выхаживание скотов. Со временем он стал более серьезно увлекаться скотами. Повзрослев Гаффор твердо решил заняться животноводством, т.е купли продажей скатов. На сегодняшней день у Гаффура дела идут хорошо, бизнес  потихоньку развивается. 
Гаффур хотел бы еще приобрести  несколько мелко рогатых скатов для откармливания на зиму, а к весне продать их по дороже. Но Гаффуру  не хватает денежных средств и он обратился в МДО "Арванд" за кредитом. Он очень благодарен МДО "Арванд" за содействие и поддержку.
texts.en:
Gaffur lives in the Spitamen region and he is 49 years old.  He is a very decent man.  He loves nature and animals.  Starting in his early childhood, he helped his parents raise cattle.  Over time, he became more and more interested in cattle.  When he grew up, Gaffur firmly decided to go into the cattle business, i.e. buying and selling cattle.  Today, Gaffur's business is going well and is developing slowly but surely.

Gaffur would like to buy several more goats and sheep, which he will fatten over the winter and sell for a better price in the spring.  However, Gaffur doesn't have the financial means to buy the cattle, so he has applied to MDO Arvand for a loan.  He is very thankful to MDO Arvand for its cooperation and support.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Zuhrojon

texts.ru: Зухрожон общительная добрая женщина. Ей 46 лет. Имеет двоих детей. Она вдова, несколько лет назад её муж умер. Сейчас сама Зухрожон воспитывает двоих детей, они еще маленькие ходят в школу. Зухрожон трудолюбивый человек, очень любит своих детей ради них она трудиться ночами.  Зухрожон раньше работала на поле, иногда ходила убирать дома. Потом она решила торговать на рынке. На рынке взяла место в аренду и начала там продавать  овощи. Её дела пошли гладко. В первые она брала деньги в кредит с МДО "Арванд" для развитие своего бизнеса. Зухрожон  понемножку откладывала деньги для ремонта дома, но ей не хватило тех накопленных денег. Поэтому она снова обратилась за кредитом в "Арванд", чтобы до первых снегов закончить ремонт в доме.Она на полученный кредит планирует купить строительные материалы.  Зухрожон очень рада что "Арванд" оказывает свою помощь клиентам, которые с надеждой приходят в эту организацию.
texts.en:
Zuhrojon is a kind and out-going woman.  She is 46 years old and has two children.  She is a widow, her husband having died several years ago.  Now Zuhrojon alone raises her children who are still young and go to school.  Zuhrojon is a hardworking woman and loves her children deeply.  For their sake she works nights.  Zuhrojon used to work in farming, and sometimes cleaned houses.  Later she decided to go into the sales business at the market, so she rented a stall and started selling vegetables.  Her business took off smoothly.   She has previously taken out a loan from MDO Arvand for business development.

Bit by bit Zuhrojon has saved up money for home repairs, but her savings aren't enough.  So, she has again applied to MDO Arvand for a loan so that she can finish her home repairs before the first snows.  She plans to use the loan to buy building materials.  MDO Arvand's clients come to them with their hopes and dreams and Zuhrojon is very glad that they are given help.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch is 63 years old and married. She is a villager from Takeo province and makes a living via rice farming and a pig raising, which returns her almost US$5 per day. As a first time borrower with VisionFund, a Kiva partner, she is seeking an education loan in order to cover the school fees for her daughter who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree in midwifery. She does believe that her daughter will get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to cover the school fees for her daughter.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy new bundles of fishing nets for her business.

Melanie has been in this business for four years. She earns more income from buying-and-selling fish.

Melanie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy new bundles of fishing nets.

loans.name: Upole Group

texts.fr: Madame Mateso est conseillère dans un groupe de crédit Upole. Femme entrepreneur à l'âge de 51 ans est mère de 11 enfants tous scolarisés. Son conjoint est un agriculteur. La cliente est une vendeuse des Mais depuis plus de 20ans. Le nouveau prêt va lui servir à l’achat de 30 sacs de mais. Son vouloir est  d’étendre son entreprise.  Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutient aux femmes rurales et à la culture de l’épargne.
texts.en: Ms Mateso is a member of the Upole credit group. An entrepreneur, aged 51, she is the mother of 11 children, all of whom attended school. Her husband is a farmer. The client has been selling maize for the past 20 years. The new loan will allow her to purchase 30 new bags of maize, in order to help her grow her business. She is thankful to Hekima for the support they to provide women living in rural areas regarding access to credit and savings.

loans.use: 30 bags of maize

loans.name: Larha'ansima Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nzigire est  trésorière  du groupe d’affaire Larha’ansima. Commerçante expérimentée, elle est mère de 6 enfants tous scolarisés et est mariée a un homme sans travail. Le nouveau crédit va lui servir d’acheter divers produits en denrées alimentaires (tomates, arachides, huile de palme, oignons,etc). Elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie de tout cœur Hekima et prie Dieu de le bénir.
texts.en: Nzigire is the treasurer of the Larha’ansima group. An experienced shopkeeper, she is the mother of six children, all of whom attend school, and is married to a man who does not work. The new loan will enable her to purchase diverse food products and consumables (tomatoes, peanuts, palm oil, onions, etc). She hopes to grow her business and continue educating and feeding her children. She is very thankful to Hekima for its support and prays to God to bless the organization.

loans.use: purchase diverse food items and consumables (tomatoes, peanuts, palm oil, onions, etc)

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
For the last one year Alice has been running her business of selling clothes in Nakuru. She has applied for her second loan of Kshs. 30,000 from VisionFund Kenya to enable her to buy more stocks of clothes to sell to her customers.

Her monthly income right now is KES. 20,000 and she hopes to use profits realized from her expanded business to  educate her child and to pay back her loan to VisionFund Kenya.


She is 39 years old, single and blessed with one child aged seven years old. She hopes to be a successful business lady

loans.use: To buy more stocks of clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Safari Group

texts.en:
Asha, who is in her early 30s, is single with one son who goes to school.  She has been running a grocery store since 2010.  She works from 4 pm to mid-night daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Asha's sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy grocery inventory and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees, paid rent for the grocery store, and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy grocery drinks and meet customers' demand.  She dreams of  opening a bigger place for the grocery store.  

Asha will share this loan with her loan group "Safari" which has eight members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy grocery drinks to meet customers' demand.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 51 years old and widowed with nine children.

Elvira works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, soap, etc.

Elvira has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from buying and selling dried fish.

Elvira aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, soap, etc

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru: Шахноза молодая девушка лет тридцати. Замужем. Мать троих очаровательных детей. Муж Шахнозы уехал в Россию на заработки. Он там работает разнорабочим. Как бы тяжело ему не приходилось работать в чужих  далеких странах, он с терпением работает ради благополучие семьи. Шахноза тоже не сидит сложа руки. Она тоже вкладывает усилия в их семейный бюджет. Шахноза занимается торговлей. Она продает на рынке конфеты и разные сладости. Стаж работы у Шахнозы более шести лет. Она свой бизнес начинала с маленькой лавочки. Со временем Шахноза расширила  свое место и увеличила ассортимент продуктов. С наступлением Новогодних праздников как обычно товары реализуются быстро. Чтобы умножить товарооборот Шахноза в очередной раз обратилась в МДО "Арванд" за кредитом. Она выражает свою благодарность за партнерство и поддержку.
texts.en:
Shahnoza is a young woman at about 30 years old.  She is married and the mother of three charming children.  Shahnoza's husband moved to Russia to work as a laborer.   No matter how hard it is for him to work far away in foreign lands, he works patiently for the good of his family.  Shahnoza also doesn't just sit around.  She also invests her efforts into the family budget.   Shahnoza is in the sales business.  She sells candies and various sweets at the market.  She has more than six years of experience in this field.  She started her business in a tiny stall and as time has gone by, she has expanded her stall and has widened her inventory.

As usual with the beginning of the New Year holidays, goods sell quickly.  In order to increase her turnover, Shahnoza has again applied to MDO Arvand for a loan.  She would like to express her gratefulness for their partnership and support.

loans.use: to buy sweets

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace works hard to support her family. Grace is married and has a dried fish making business in the Philippines.

Grace requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to make dried fish. She has been in this business for 7 years now.

In the future, Grace would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris lives in Mangwei, a small town in Kwale County. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast and borders Tanzania to the south. Inconsistent rainfall makes farming difficult and contributes to the area's high poverty rates. Despite the unreliable rainfall, bees in the region have two excellent sources of food, from wild mangrove forests and local passion fruit plantations. Beekeeping is relatively new to the area, but many farmers are very interested in owning hives.

Damaris is married and has four children. Her husband is a caterer. Both she and her husband have been farming for nine years now. They currently have a tree plantation in their farm. Damaris is excited about bee keeping as it will be a good source of income.

This is Damaris’ first loan with Honey Care. She intends to use the proceeds generated from her beehives to build a family house. Damaris’ hope for the future is to establish a commercial apiary.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Kassim

texts.en:
Kassim lives in a small town in Kwale County. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast and is the southernmost Kenyan county. Though some of the towns along the beach see benefits from tourism, the majority of people living inland are farmers, and the region's inconsistent rains can make agricultural yields unpredictable. Honey Care has offered farmers in the area a chance to purchase year-old beehives that have been repaired and re-waxed, and many individuals opted to buy these cheaper hives instead of new ones.

Kassim is single and has no children. He is a farmer and has been farming for six years now. He is currently growing maize and mangoes in his farm. Kassim is excited about beekeeping as it will be a source of honey for domestic use.

This is Kassim’s first loan with Honey Care. He intends to use the proceeds from his beehives to buy a motorcycle. Kassim’s hope for the future is to establish a commercial apiary.

loans.use: to buy apiary materials and refurbished beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Milkah

texts.en:
Milkah lives in Magodi, a small town in Kwale County. Kwale County is located on the Kenyan coast, and borders Tanzania to the south. Inconsistent rainfalls make farming difficult and contribute to the area's high poverty rates. Despite the unreliable rainfall, bees in the region have two excellent sources of food: the wild mangrove forest and the local passion fruit plantations. Honey Care has offered farmers in the area a chance to purchase year-old beehives that have been repaired and re-waxed, and many individuals opted to buy these cheaper hives instead of new ones.
