The loan is to buy feed and medicines for the pigs. María has been in the communal bank for 2 years and she likes it because of the support she gets from the loans. Her dream is to provide the best for her son.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for pigs.

loans.name: Elodie Teclaire

texts.fr: Elodie est une femme de 31 ans, célibataire et mère de 2 enfants.elle possède et gère une boutique de vente de boisson hygiénique dans un quartier de la ville depuis 3 ans. elle sollicite un crédit pour renforcer son stock de marchandises en achetant des boissons afin de satisfaire sa clientèle grandissante et augmenter son chiffre d'affaire.les bénéfices générés vont être réinjectés dans son capital et subviendront aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en: Elodie is a 31-year-old woman who is unmarried and the mother of two. She owns and has been running a shop selling bottled beverages in a district in the city for three years. She is requesting a loan to bolster her stock of merchandise by purchasing some beverages to satisfy her growing customer base and to increase her sales. The profits generated are going to be reinvested as capital and used to meet family needs.

loans.use: to purchase bottled beverages to sell in her shop

loans.name: Iderbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Iderbaatar is 35 years old and lives with his wife in a Ger, a traditional nomadic yurt, in Zavhan province, Mongolia. His wife, Otgonbayar, is 30 and helps her husband to run their family business of manufacturing traditional leather boots and shoes at home.
 
Iderbaatar started their leather shoes and boots manufacturing business at home in 2008. They have expanded their operation and productivity over the years, and last year, they started building their own house from their profit. They are planning on finishing the house next year from their business profit. 

Iderbaatar purchases leather from Ulaanbaatar and makes boots and shoes by order. He is now requesting a loan of 500,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase materials and inventories to meet the orders on time.

loans.use: to purchase materials and inventories to manufacture leather shoes and boots at home

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a single lady, 33 years old.

She has been in business for six years now and her monthly income is KES 40,000.

Mercy has borrowed the loan to purchase more stock and expand the current business. This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of goods.

loans.name: Elish

texts.en:
Elish is a glasses maker. He is 56 years old, has been married for 23 years and has two children. His elder son is married and his little son studies at college. Elish’s wife is a housewife. They are IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from their native land, Agdam city, and now live in the Baku region. 

It's noted that Elish prepares spectacles. Today, he wants to increase his business, and for this reason Elish needs a loan amount of 2,300 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). Therefore, he has applied to Komak company. With this loan, Elish wants to buy a new apparatus which will be useful in his work. He says thankful to the Kiva organization and lenders for help.

loans.use: to buy a new apparatus that will be helpful for making spectacles

loans.name: Yinger Marilin

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito De Colorado se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Yinger, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 17, 14 y 8 años de edad, los mayores estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es mecánico automotriz.
Doña Yinger como buena esposa que es realiza el crédito para ella y para que su esposo lo utilice en su trabajo, él tiene un taller de mecánica automotriz en su casa lugar en el cual ella también vende ciertos repuestos como aceites, líquidos de frenos, llantas entre otras cosas, ella  les vende a los clientes que a diario asisten al taller de su esposo el cual es muy concurrido ya que su marido tiene mucha experiencia arreglando automotores, el lleva más de 17 años con el taller el cual es la forma de como él se gana la vida y el sustento de la familia.
Este crédito es para comprar llantas, aceites y repuestos. Lleva 8 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten financiar su negocio. Su sueño es que  sus hijos  sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The communal bank Grupo De Crédito De Colorado meets once a fortnight in Colorado, in the Montecristo canton. The area is known for its rich precolonial culture and for its handicrafts which are renowned both nationally and internationally. It is the home of the famous Panama straw hats.

This is where Yinger lives. She is 37 years old and is married. They have three children aged 17,14 and 8; the older ones are at college and the youngest is at primary school. Yinger's husband is a car mechanic. 

As a good wife, Yinger is taking out the loan for herself and for her husband to use in his work. He has a car repair workshop at their home where she also sells some spares such as oil, brake fluid, tyres and other items. She sells these on a daily basis to customers who visit her husband's workshop, which is very busy. He has a lot of experience repairing cars and has had the workshop for more than 17 years. This is how he earns a living and provides for the family. 

The loan is to buy tyres, oil and spares. Yinger has been in the communal bank for 8 years and she likes it because the loans help her to finance her business. Her dream is for her children to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy tyres, oil and spare parts.

loans.name: Merha May

texts.en:
Merha May is married and operates a general store in their village to make a living. She has been in this business for five years and she earns from this.

She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy additional grocery goods to sell. She needs additional stocks to offer in order to gain more profit. 

In the future, she wants to improve her business and provide her family a better living.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Francisco Vicente

texts.es: Francisco agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado, ella desea seguir participando en este proyecto porque le ayuda a incrementar el capital del negocio y también se siente motivada para continuar trabajando en  su negocio, ella continúa con el negocio de crianza de pollos. Ya son tres años que tiene el negocio y le va muy bien pero siempre necesita capital para comprar mercadería entonces una vecina le invitó a participar del banco comunal “Virgen de Chanca” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más pollos.
texts.en:
Francisco is grateful to the lenders for the loan.  He feels happy with the offered support. 

He hopes to continue working with this project because it has helped him to grow his business capital and to feel motivated in working to improve his business.  He had had this business raising chickens for three years, and it is going well despite the fact that he always needs capital in order to buy supplies.  Because of this, a neighbor invited him to participate in the "Virgen de Chanca" communal bank.

At this time, he is requesting a loan to buy more chickens.

loans.use: to buy more chickens.

loans.name: Amjad

texts.en:
Amjad is a 38-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and four kids (two sons and two daughters) in a very simple house in the city. Amjad works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low salary that is the only source of income for his family. He appears in this photo.

Amjad is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to buy a water purification machine for his home. He will use his loan to provide clean water for his family. In the future, Amjad would like to buy all the needed stuff for his home to improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for his home

loans.name: Christelle Nadine

texts.fr: Christelle est une femme de 28 ans, célibataire et mère de 4 enfant dont deux vont à l'école. elle possède et gère une boutique de vente de crédit de communication et de prestation de photocopie dans un quartier de la ville depuis 7 ans. elle sollicite un crédit pour renforcer son stock de crédit de communication et acheter une phtocopieuse afin de satisfaire sa clientèle grandissante et augmenter son chiffre d'affaire. les bénéfices générés de cette opération vont lui permettre d'agrandir son bureau de photocopie en ouvrant un cybercafé d'une part et d'autre part subviendront aux besoins de sa famille (éducation, nutrition, logement, santé).
texts.en: Christelle is a 28-year-old woman who is unmarried and the mother of four, of whom two are in school. She owns and has been running a shop selling communication credits (phone minutes) and photocopy services in a district in the city for seven years. She is requesting a loan to bolster her stock of communication credits and to purchase a photocopier, so as to satisfy her growing customer base and to increase her sales. The profits generated from this operation are going to enable her to expand her photocopy office by opening a cybercafé, as well as to meet family needs (education, food, housing, healthcare).

loans.use: to purchase communication credits (phone minutes) and a photocopier

loans.name: Wajasiriamali   Grp   Mwanza Group

texts.en:
Magreth is in her mid-40s and widowed with four children who are still in school. For the past ten years, she has been selling ripe bananas. Magreth works from eight in the morning until two in the afternoon and is able to make a good monthly profit. She is the leader of a loan group called “Wajasiriamali – Mza,” that is comprised of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loan.

Magreth will use her portion of the group loan to buy bananas to sell to more people. This will be her third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loans to buy more bananas and she has successfully repaid her loans. Magreth used the profit from her loans to pay school fees, cover household expenses, and save in the bank. In the future, she dreams of opening her own company of selling food.

loans.use: to buy bananas to sell to more people

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn runs a sari sari (variety) store in her community where she sells groceries to earn a living. She also cooks banana cue (deep-fried bananas) to earn additional income. 

Jocelyn is requesting a loan from GDMPC to purchase raw ingredients to cook. In the future, she wants to improve her business and provide a better living for her family.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel tiene 70 años de edad, vive junto a su hija en el distrito de Cayalti, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de cuyes, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, es una madre que se esfuerza en la labor que realiza, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para arreglos de los corrales donde cría a sus animales y de esta manera darle una mejor distribución que contribuirá para una mejor producción de sus animales.
texts.en:
Isabel is 70 years old and lives with her daughter in the district of Cayalti, where people make a living in agriculture, trade, and livestock.  The district is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo, on the northern coast of Peru.

She makes a living raising and selling guinea pigs.  Her business is located in her home.  She is the type of mother that applies herself completely to the work that she does.  

She is requesting a loan for 1,000 nuevos soles in order to fix up the pens where she raises and breeds her animals.  In doing this, she will give them a better living space that will contribute to greater production.

loans.use: to fix up the pens where she raises her animals.

loans.name: Diana's Group

texts.en:
Diana's Group is made up of two married women who, on average, are 36-years-old and have two children. They live in nuclear families with their husbands and children in the Teshie neighborhood of the city of Accra. These women know one another through the neighborhood, friendship, and business ties. In order to strengthen their financial means to better conduct their business, they joined micro finance institution ID-Ghana and are on their fourth loan.

This group of women sells drinks and bread. Diana sells drinks and with her loan, she plans to purchase various types of drinks from Accra's wholesalers. She sells her wares at home, at retail prices for cash, not on credit. Diana is expecting to see an average weekly profit of GHS 150, which will be reinvested in the businesses and will repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy and sell drinks to her customers.

loans.name: Sevak

texts.en:
Sevak is from Norapat village of the Armavir region. It has already been 10 years that Sevak has been involved in furniture making. In the basement of his house, Sevak makes different types of furniture (bed, sofa, chairs, desks, etc).
 
He works hard to satisfy his clients' needs, and due to his attentive and hard work, he has a number of customers from the whole region. Now, because of the coming holidays, the number of orders has increased, and with his current materials, Sevak isn't able to complete them. He is asking for this loan to be able to purchase materials and tools needed for his work. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

Sevak will be very grateful to Kiva lenders for the support.

loans.use: to pay for materials and tools for making furniture

loans.name: Sandra Edith

texts.es:
Sandra tiene 31 años de edad estado civil Unión libre vive con el esposo  y con sus hijos de 15, 13 11 y 8 años, Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.
La ventanilla se llama ASOCIACIÓN MONTUBIOS VENTANILLA NORTE se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Ventanilla Norte, perteneciente al cantón ventanas, se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Sandra se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.
El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es comprar una casita .
Le gusta trabajar y  planchar.
texts.en:
Sandra is 31 years old and in a common-law marriage. She lives with her husband and their sons, who are 15, 13, 11, and 8 years old. She lives in the Ventanas canton, in the Los Ríos province. The communal bank is called "Asociacion Montubios Ventanilla Norte", and is located in the Ventanilla Norte province, in the Ventanas canton. Its residents work in agriculture and livestock.

Sandra makes a living in agriculture and has grown corn and rice for many years. She makes her purchases in Ventanas and sells them in the same market.

She is requesting a loan to purchase manure, urea, and liquid fertilizers for her corn and rice crops. The loan will help her to increase her profits for her family's use and to invest. Her dream is to purchase a home. She likes to work and iron.

loans.use: to purchase supplies like manure, urea, and liquid fertilizer.

loans.name: Avtandil

texts.en:
Avtandil is 56 years old and married with two sons who are students. He lives with his family in Batumi district. Avtandil’s wife works as in a cafe and earns 400 GEL monthly. Avtandil works as an electrician in both a substation and for private customers. He works really hard to cover all of his family’s monthly costs, but it's too hard to pay the university fees for his two sons and secure money for other family expenses. 

Avtandil is requesting a 1,000 USD loan to buy an aquarium and grow fish to sell to restaurants at a good price. His loan is part of a startup program that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo that enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. Avtandil’s new business initiative will give him the chance to have financial stability and grow his monthly income.

loans.use: to buy an aquarium to grow fish to sell

loans.name: Julia Sandra

texts.es: Doña Julia tiene 51 años de edad, originaria de la ciudad de Boaco. Casada y madre de tres hijos ya independientes. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de comida (de manera ambulante). Inicio este negocio vendiendo lácteos y rosquillas de forma ambulante a los cinco años de edad. Luego, tuvo otro negocio de pulpería; es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora, toda su vida ha sido muy dependiente, dedicada con mucho sacrificio a la comercialización. Su meta es obtener más clientes y ver crecer su negocio de comideria. Solicita el crédito para comprar: carne de res, carne de pollo, aceite, arroz, verduras; entre otro, con el fin de ofrecer diferentes platillos a sus clientes. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que obtendrá mejores ventas  e incrementar sus ganancias para invertir en la compra de productos. Su plan futuro es ser una comerciante mayorista.
texts.en:
Julia, 51, is from the city of Boaco.  She's married and the mother of three adult children.

Julia's a merchant by trade and she works selling food as a street vendor.  She started this business with dairy products and "rosquillas" [ring-shaped cookie] when she was five years old. Then she had another business, a grocery store.

Julia's an enterprising and determined woman.  Her whole life she has been very dependent and, with great sacrifice, dedicated to sales.  Her goal is to acquire more customers and see her food business grow.

Julia's requesting the loan to buy beef, chicken, oil, rice, vegetables, and other ingredients so she can offer her customers a variety of dishes.  She thinks the loan will be a big help to her because she'll have better sales and increase her earnings to invest in buying products.

Her plan for the future is to be a wholesale merchant.

loans.use: to buy beef, chicken, oil, rice, vegetables, and other food

loans.name: Tanveer

texts.en:
Tanveer is 45-year-old, married woman (shown sitting in the rickshaw in the photo) and the mother of four children. The man shown in the photo is Tanveer’s husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Tanveer has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees), for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Tanveer is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Asifa

texts.en:
Asifa is 25 years old and a married woman. She has been in the beauty-parlor business since four years ago. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Through her best effort providing services, she has become very famous in her street. 

In order to meet the increasing demand from her customers, she is interested in buying more varieties of cosmetic products for the parlor. But because of having low cash in hand, she contacted Kashf Foundation to apply for her third loan. She needs a loan of 40,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to buy hair-care products, skin products and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities. She is hopeful to cater to more customers time after time. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy hair-care products, skin products and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities.

loans.name: Noor

texts.en:
Noor is a 44-year-old married woman; she has been running a business of animal sales and purchase for many years. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and sells them near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries). 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation; currently, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR (Pakistnai rupees) to purchase two more calves. She is in her third loan cycle with good repayment history.  She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Kleo

texts.en:
Kleo needs your financial help to startup a livestock activity: he wants to buy a dairy cow to start. The amount of loan he is requesting is 300,000 Albanian Lek. He also works in the family’s agricultural business, taking care of the apple and cherry orchard plantation.  

Kleo is a 22-year-old single man and the younger of two brothers. His brother works and lives in Greece and their father passed away long ago. As such, he holds the burden of the family, financial and otherwise. With his mother they try hard to make it. Kleo is a very talented young man also; he plays musical instruments. 

Kleo has been photographed in front of the small building that, hopefully, soon will be the stable for the animals.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en: Rukhsana is an energetic 49-year-old lady who has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of 50,000 PKR from the Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her seventh loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors, as well as packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha used the money to buy spare parts and her business is doing well after the loan.

She has applied for another loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable her to boost her secondary business of M-PESA (mobile phone-based money transfer).

Her two businesses run concurrently and she is optimistic that both will do better after the loan. She hopes to expand her business in the near future and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to boost her money transfer business.

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en:
Nawal is a 48-year-old married woman from Nablus city. She is a mother for two sons and two daughters. Nawal's husband is a worker with an unstable income. 

Nawal started her own project one year ago, which is raising sheep. It is a good business and earns a good income. Nawal can help her husband in part of the family expenses. 

Nawal took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more sheep for her farm. By taking this loan, Nawal will be able to improve the farm's productivity and also the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more sheep for her farm.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 26-year-old single young man from Rafah city. He lives with his family in a small, simple house. Mahmoud was working as a teacher in a local school, but he was getting a very low wage. He decided to open his own business, which is an education center. Mahmoud would like start programs for tuition-based lessons for school students.
 
Mahmoud took a $500 USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to prepare his center and buy all the needed furniture like chairs and chalkboards. By taking this loan, Mahmoud will be able to start his business and make his dreams come true. 

Mahmoud  appears in the photo.

loans.use: to prepare his center and buy all the needed furniture like chairs and chalkboards.

loans.name: Taghreed

texts.en:
Taghreed was born in 1968. She is married and has two sons and one daughter. One of her sons is working at a governmental entity, and the other one is a personal driver. Her husband has a water tank. 

Taghreed has been trying her best to support her husband in improving their living conditions by running her mini-market at home since two years ago. She started her project selling a small quantity of food products and found it profitable. Now, she decided to expand it by opening another room where she can store her products, but she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To open a new room to store her mini-market products

loans.name: Hummaira

texts.en:
Hummaira is a 27-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother three children. Her husband, an expert shoe and jacket manufacturer of many years' experience, sews shoes and jackets made of leather and rexene with a machine. He had been making shoes at home, but now has a shop to promote his business widely. 

Because he does not have the money to buy raw materials for his enterprise, Hummaira has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so her husband can purchase what he needs. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy rexine, leather, threads, glue etc. for sewing jackets and shoes.

loans.name: Azhar

texts.en:
Azhar is a 37-year-old divorced woman from Rafah city. She lives with her family and her two kids (a son and a daughter) in a very simple house in the city. Azhar is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her brother appears in the photo. She works as an employee in the public sector where she gets a low salary that is the only source of income for her family. 

Azhar is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help her buy a water purification machine for her home. She will use her loan to provide clean water for her family. In the future, Azhar would like to buy all the needed stuff for her home to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for her home

loans.name: Virgilda

texts.en:
To make a living, Virgilda operates a business venture, raising pigs for sale. She has been doing this for more than six years and she earns well from this. She had successfully repaid her previous loan which she used to buy piglets. She always find ways to augment their living. 

Recently, Virgilda took a new loan to buy feed to boost her hogs. In the future, she plans to make improvements to her house and also improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Merriam

texts.en:
Merriam is married, with seven children. She is 45 years old and lives in Estrella, Sinacaban, Philippines.

Merriam is a farmer and she grows coconut crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested a loan to redeem her coconut land from her cousin.

Merriam has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for one year. In the future, Merriam hopes to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to redeem her coconut land from her cousin.

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.en:
Nargiza is married and has five children. For the past 12 years, she has operated her own animal husbandry business. Nargiza is a person who always tries to earn money and provide a better life to her children. She is an experienced businesswoman. 

Nargiza is requesting a 4,000 TJS loan to buy cattle and increase the number of animals she has to sell. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Jinypher

texts.en:
Jinypher is a student at La Salle University in Ozamiz City where she is working on her bachelor’s degree in education. She has received a previous loan GDMPC to cover her school expenses last year.

Jinypher is requesting a loan to pay her school tuition and other expenses this semester. She hopes to finish her studies this year and find a stable job to have a better future.

loans.use: to pay school tuition and other expenses

loans.name: Vouch

texts.en:
Vouch is a resident from Prey Chhor district in the Kampong Cham province. She is 52 years old and a married mother blessed with six children, two of whom are in school. The main source of her income is from a rice and pepper plantation; whereas her extra job working for others for a fee is the supplementary source of income for her family. 

She has been involved in the current business for more than 10 years, and currently she is able to earn up to $10 per day. Vouch is a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she is applying for her first loan in order to buy fertilizer for her crop. She hopes she will gain a good yield with a high selling price so that she can set aside some money to buy cows for raising.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her pepper business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Clerah

texts.en:
Clerah, a married mother of two children who go to school, lives in her own house that has both electricity and piped water. She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. 

With the loan she is requesting, Clerah wants to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, tea leaves and wheat flour for resale and to pay school fees for her children. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, tea leaves and wheat flour for resale and pay her children's school fees

loans.name: Arnn

texts.en:
Arnn is single and an entrepreneur who manages his own banana farm for a living. He has been doing this for more than two years and is able to support his parents. Arnn joined GDMPC recently.

Arnn is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer such as manure. In the future, he plans to expand his farm to improve his returns.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Maria tiene 34 años de edad de estado civil Unión Libre tiene cuatro hijos vive con el esposo y con los hijos en el Recinto Desvió De los Amarillo perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla PEQUEÑOS AGRICULTORES se encuentra ubicada el  recinto Desvió de los Amarillos, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Maria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y la crianza de animales de corral como pollos. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas y un bomba para fumigar para evitar las plagas y enfermedades, además alimento para los animales balanceados de engorde y crianza de los animales de corral. 

Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

El sueño es seguir sembrando para mejorar la economia de la familia, le gusta mucho bailar en las fiestas.
texts.en:
Maria is thirty-four years old and is in a common-law marriage.  She has four children.  She lives with her husband and children in the community of Desvió de los Amarillo, which belongs to the canton of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos.

She belongs to the Pequeños Agricultores ("Small Farmers") communal bank, which is also located in the community of Desvió de los Amarillo in the canton of Ventanas. The bank is dedicated to agriculture and livestock.

Maria makes a living in agriculture, sowing corn and raising farm animals, such as chickens.  With this loan, she will be able to buy supplies like: fertilizers, manure, insecticides, and a pump spray to protect against infestation and disease.  She will also buy feed for fattening the animals.  She will make her purchases in the city of Ventanas.

Her dream is to continue sowing seeds in order to improve her family's economic situation.  She enjoys dancing at her community celebrations.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure, insecticide, and a pump spray to protect against infestation and disease.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a junior college dropout and lives in Kakata Town, the capital City of Margibi County. She is married and has four children, all who are presently in school and living at home. 

Esther has been operating a shop where she sells baking, shortbread, meat-peas, corn bread, etc. She has done this for the past ten years having learned this way of selling from her friends.

She is requesting a loan for her business to purchase more flour, butter, sugar, oil, meat, gasoline, etc. Her plans are to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more flour, butter, sugar, oil, meat, gasoline, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Ume  Kalsoum

texts.en: Ume Kalsoum is a 35-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She has been running a business selling milk with her husband for many years. She has one cow, whose milk she sells to people in her area. She also sells animals on seasonal basis to generate extra income. Ume Kalsoum has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her fifth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR, which will allow her to purchase two more calves. Ume Kalsoum is hopeful that this loan will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en:
Zareena is a 40-year-old, married woman and the mother of six children. She has been running a business selling clothes for many years. She purchases a variety of clothes from the main city and then sells them to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality clothes in her community. 

Zareena requested a loan of PKR 45,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different clothes for the winter season, taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through greater sales. 

She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different clothes for the winter season.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 42-year-old married woman who has been in business selling milk for many years. She has five buffaloes and one cow and sells their milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to allow her to lead a decent life. 

Naseem is the mother of two children and is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. She has improved her business to meet day-to-day expenses. She has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase one more cow. She is in her sixth loan cycle with Kashf Foundation and is happily running her business through support of it. She hopes to increase the production capacity of milk, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Aun

texts.en:
Aun is a 50-year-old married mother of four living in Romeas Haek district of Svay Rieng province. Farming rice has been the family's major source of income for nearly 30 years. Two of her children are married and the remaining two attend school. Aun wants to give her children a better future, and that is why she and her husband are working very hard in order to educate them in university after they graduate from high school. 

This year one of her children, who completed high school, wants to continue his education in the faculty of social sciences and humanities. He is going to choose philosophy as his major, aiming to become a high school teacher after graduation. Due to the family’s financial constraints, Aun is experiencing difficulties in paying her son’s education fees, so she is requesting a loan of USD250 to add to her existing money in order to pay for his enrollment fees. 

Aun is very happy and thankful for the loans available via  programs like Kiva that allow poor students to pursue higher education, and contribute to the future development of Cambodia.

loans.use: to pay for her son's enrollment fees.

loans.name: Maria Luna

texts.en:
Maria Luna is 42 years old, married, and has nine children. She lives in Estrella, Sinacaban, Philippines. Maria Luna is a farmer and raises carabao, which she has been doing for 10 years. 

Maria Luna is requesting a loan from PMPC, which she will use to purchase additional carabao for her business. In the future, she hopes to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase carabao for her business

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a third-time borrower applying for a loan of UGX 3,000,000. He is a married man with five children who lives in the suburbs of the city. 

Michael is a fishmonger. This business has enabled him to buy a piece of land, build on it, and take care of his wife and all his children’s needs. His house was built 15 years ago and is now in a sorry state because of the water-logged area it was built upon. 

Because of this situation, Michael applied for a loan of UGX 3,000,000 to have both the interior and exterior of the house renovated. Michael’s future plan is to see his house have a new look and also to educate all his children to university level.

loans.use: to renovate his house.

loans.name: Osama

texts.en:
Osama is 38 years old and married, from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and three sons in a very simple house in the city. 

Osama is a worker in the construction field, where he gets a low and not stable salary. This is the only source of income to the family. 

Osama would like to buy all the needed stuff for his home to improve the family's living conditions. Osama took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank for his home. 

By taking this loan, Osama will be able to provide hot water in the winter using cheap energy for his family.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank for his home.

loans.name: Veverly

texts.en:
Veverly had a loan for 10,000 PHP, which she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and for their personal, household, and business expenditures. She also has a re-loading station for additional  income.
 
Veverly is requesting another loan for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. 

Veverly hopes that her business will last long and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Mushegh

texts.en:
Mushegh is from Jermuk town of the Vayots Dzor region, where he lives with his mother, wife, and two children.

Mushegh has been involved in manufacturing business for five years. Particularly he makes different furniture products and sells them to locals. 

Mushegh is the only breadwinner of the family, because his mother is retired, and his wife takes care of their little children. So, Mushegh feels very responsible to gather enough income for covering his family's basic needs. 

By applying for this loan Mushegh asks a loan to be able to purchase tools and equipment that he needs for completing the current orders that he received. 

He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

This loan will be huge support for Mushegh as he will be able to continue the service that he provides and will be able to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to pay for tools and equipment for furniture making

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank for his home

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel, a sus 28 años de edad, se dedica a atender su propio negocio, un punto de venta de pollo congelado y carnes frías, aprendió el oficio cuando trabajó durante 3 años como empleada en una distribuidora de carnes y luego realizó un curso técnico de alimentos con el que complementó sus conocimientos y, con el ánimo de generar ingresos de manera independiente tomó la iniciativa de montar su propio punto de venta desde febrero del 2012, allí cuenta con el apoyo de un empleado directo y trabaja todos los días desde las primeras horas de la mañana; así genera los recursos necesarios para solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar a su familia económicamente.
Actualmente solicita el crédito con el fin de comprar surtido al por mayor (pollo entero y despresado, carnes frías de diversas marcas, huevos, lácteos, entre otros); esto le permitirá abastecerse para solventar la demanda que se incrementa en el último mes del año, mejorando su nivel de rentabilidad y ganancias.
Maribel sueña con seguir acreditando y fortaleciendo su negocio para que perdure en el tiempo y le garantice una estabilidad económica favorable para tener una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Maribel is twenty-eight years old.  She makes a living at her own business selling frozen chicken and cold meats.  She learned this trade during her three years working as an employee at a meat distributor.  She later took a technical food course that complemented her knowledge and, with the desire to earn income as an independent businesswoman, began her own business in February 2012.  She has the support of an employee and works every day beginning in the early morning hours.  In this way, she is able to generate the necessary resources to cover her personal expenses and to economically support her family.

She is requesting a loan that she hopes to use to buy products wholesale.  She will buy entire chickens, chicken pieces, different types of cold meats, eggs, milk products, and other items.  This will allow her to meet the demand that always grows in the last month of the year, and to increase her profitability and earnings. 

Maribel dreams of continuing to strengthen her business so that it endures and provides her with a favorable source of economic stability, giving her a better quality of life and well-being.

loans.use: to buy products wholesale, including: whole chickens, chicken pieces, different types of cold meats, eggs, milk products, and other items.

loans.name: Rukiya

texts.en:
Rukiya is 33 years old and married, the mother of six children.
 
She has been doing business selling cloths in her community for the past two years. She buys cloths of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the wholesale market and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business.

Rukiya is requesting a loan of PKR 40,000 from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. 

She expects boost in her earnings with her loan, and she plans to spend the part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Ann Jai Guru Self Help Group

texts.en:
The Ann Jai Guru Self Help Group consists of 13 members from a small village of Balugaon, Odisha, India. All the members of this group are female. They are engaged in different business activities for the elimination of poverty. Three of the women have very low incomes, but this helps them to want to struggle harder to get ahead.

One person who deserves to be highlighted is Saraju (in the picture the lady seated first from right in a yellow sari), who works selling vegetables. Through her job, she works to support her family and also to improve her business and continue growing. She is a very determined person who wants to continue growing. She is seeking part of this loan in order to be able to invest it in the purchase of vegetables like tomatoes, onions, green peppers, potatoes and other vegetables so that she can continue with her sales.

The group is very grateful for this opportunity for growth that it is receiving.

loans.use: To purchase tomatoes, onions, green peppers, potatoes and other vegetables so that she can continue with her sales.

loans.name: Levani

texts.en:
Levani is a 25-year-old young man who lives with his mother and two brothers, who are students, in the Tbilisi district. His family’s only source of income is leasing a flat and a commercial space, which provides 1,000 GEL monthly. Levani has high school education but he hasn’t found a job yet. He greatly desires to become involved in a trading business. Levani lacks access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit to start a business, as these institutions require a stable income and business experience.  

Levani is requesting a 3,000 USD loan to purchase a stock of merchandise to open a frozen food store. His loan will be through the Start Up program, created by Kiva and Credo. Levani thinks that his business will be profitable as it is in great location and the only business of its kind in the area. After his store has opened, his family will have a stable income that will enable them to cover everyday costs as well as expand the business in the future. With support of the Start Up program, Levani will get an opportunity to be involved in his own business.

loans.use: to open a frozen food store

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida, 31 years old, is married and has four children. She has been running a business selling animals for many years. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, raises them and sells them around the time of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslims countries). 

Shahida has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation. She is currently requesting a loan of PKR 50,000 to purchase two more calves. She is in her 5th loan cycle and has a good repayment history. Shahida hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Hameedan

texts.en:
Hameedan is a 47-year-old married woman who has run a hand embroidery business for many years. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the household expenses. 

Hameedan wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 50,000. She intends to use this loan to purchase reels of threads in different colors, packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. She would then be able to cater to more customers consistently. Hameedan is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and dreams of providing a better standard of living for her family through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to purchase threads, beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Aysha

texts.en:
Aysha is a 57-year-old, married woman and the mother of three children. She has been successfully running a small general store, with her son, in her community. She has five years of experience in this field and she makes enough money to contribute to the family's income. She is motivated to provide her family with good-quality food, clothing, and health. 

Aysha wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits, and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and she dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits, and beverages.

loans.name: José Abrahan

texts.es:
José de 70 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado,  está casado;  la esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, ellos han procreado 10 hijos en este matrimonio de los cuales uno de ellos ya falleció y 7 de ellos ya están en hogares apartes pero dos de ellos viven con él que le ayudan en la  agricultura,  en la casa de don José vive también dos nietos por lo tanto solo dos hijos y la esposa y dos nietos dependen de él.

José se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 8  años de edad, este trabajo se lo enseño un hermano, ya que el papá los dejo cuando tenía dos años de edad,  el trabajo le queda a una distancia de 15 minutos y él viaja a pie, solo a esto se dedica con la ayuda de los hijos que le ayudan a trabajar y lo hace un horario de las 6 de la mañana hasta las doce del mediodía. 

El préstamo solicitado lo necesitara,  para comprar una ternera que los vecinos le venden , ya que el conoce la ternera y esta con embarazada y él quiere quedase  con esa ternera; pero lo demás lo necesitara para sacar las cosechas  de trabajo, ya que paga la máquina que le desgrane el maíz y también paga un carretero para que  se lo lleve para la casa.

 Esto mejorara porque,  sacare más luego los granos para el lugar de donde los cultive y así los tendra en casa para poder tenerlos, ya seguro en la casa ya que he sacado una parte y le falta mas también tiene que buscar quien le destuse el maíz y es ahí donde invertiré el dinero y así tener el ingreso y pagar las deudas que uno tiene para hacer la milpa.

Los sueños que tiene es que siempre Dios le preste vida,  para seguir cultivando la tierra y tener como llevar el sostén de la casa,  ya que esta cosecha que ahorita tiene  es con el sudor de su frente y es así como quiero seguir ganando y poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
José is 70 and was in school up to grade 4. He is married; his wife is a housewife. They have ten children, one of whom has passed away and seven of whom live on their own. Two of their children live with them and help with the farming. Two of José's grandchildren also live with him. Only two of his children, his wife, and two grandchildren depend on him.

José has worked in agriculture since he was 8 years old. A brother taught him this work, because their father left when he was two years old. His work is fifteen minutes away and he travels on foot. This is his only work, and his children help him. He works from 6 am to 2:00 pm.

He will need this loan for the purchase of a calf from his neighbours. He knows the calf, and it is pregnant. He wants the calf. He needs the rest of the loan for the harvest, to pay for the corn de-grainer and to transport the crops to his home.

This will help him because he will be able to harvest more grains; he has already harvested some but wants to harvest more. He needs to find a buyer for the corn. He will invest the money in this in order to have an income and repay his debts from the corn.

His dreams are for God to always give him live so that he can continue cultivating the land and providing his family's daily bread. His harvest is obtained from the sweat of his brow, and this is how he wants to continue making a living and providing for his family.

loans.use: to buy a calf.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a divorced woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years, Mariam has operated a retail shop business and a charcoal-selling business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 30,000 loan, Mariam wants to purchase maize flour, charcoal, rice, beans, and cooking oil for her business. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, charcoal, rice, beans, and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Carmen Adelaida

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito De Colorado se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Carmen, tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aún viven con ella. Su esposo ya no trabaja pues sufrió un accidente y no puede trabajar.
Doña Carmen  para poder sacar a su familia adelante hace un tiempo atrás instalo un pequeño local en su casa en el cual vende helados, colas, bocadillos y otras golosinas,  este negocio lo puso para aprovechar que su casa está frente a un colegio y por lo general los chicos gustan de todos estos productos y sus ventas están aseguradas, con el crédito anterior ella también compro ciertos útiles escolares con lo cual mejoro su negocio y sus ingresos, ella cada día trata de comprar más productos que le sirvan para mejorar sus ingresos por el bien de su familia. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar, cuadernos, esferos, dulces, golosinas, helados, entre otras cosas que también vende. Está en el Grupo De Crédito hace 6 años y le gusta porque con los créditos cada día mejora su negocio. Su sueño es seguir aumentando su negocio.
texts.en:
The Grupo De Crédito De Colorado (Colorado’s Communal Bank) is a Communal Bank that meets every fortnight in Colorado, in the Montecristi Canton a place known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts that are famous both nationally and internationally; here is where the famous straw hats come from.
Here is where Carmen lives. She is 56 years old, she is married and she has six children, who are all adults; two of them still live with her. Her husband is unemployed because he has had an accidents and is unable to work.
In order to provide for her family, a few years ago Carmen set up a small store in her house, where she sells ice-creams, sodas, sandwiches and other snacks. She decided for this activity because her house is in front of a school and her business is secure because kids generally love all of her products. She used her previous loan to buy school supplies as well, and thanks to this both her activity and her income have improved. She tries to buy more products every day, in order to increase her earning for her family’s wellbeing.
The loan she is requesting will be used to buy notebooks, pens, snacks, sweets, ice-creams and other articles that she sells. She has been a member of Grupo De Crédito for 6 years, and she likes it because thanks to the loans she makes her activity grow on a daily basis. Her dream is to keep on improving her activity.

loans.use: To buy notebooks, pens, snacks, sweets and ice-creams.

loans.name: Nanis

texts.en: Nanis appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She is requesting for a loan of ksh. 20,000 to purchase hair extensions, hair treatment, and shampoos for her business. She also wants to use funds to pay school fees for her child. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase hair extensions, hair treatment, and shampoos for her business.

loans.name: Maimuna

texts.en:
Maimuna is a second-time borrower, applying for a loan of UGX 3,000,000 to boost her business working capital. She is a married woman, with three children. They rent a double-roomed house in one of the slums of the city. Her husband is lame due to an accident that he had two years ago and now Maimuna is the bread-winner of the family since her husband cannot walk and work anymore.   

Maimuna is engaged in the selling of charcoal in her area of residence. Because all of her family expenses are being borne by her, she has seen working capital deteriorate gradually and now she needs to boost it by applying for a loan. She hopes this will boost her sales and profit.

Her future plans are making sure she continues to take care of her family and seeing that her business just keeps on expanding.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: José René

texts.es:
José de 40 años de edad estudió hasta tercer grado, dejó la escuela debido a la pobreza en la que vivía su familia y su papá le dijo que mejor aprendiera a trabajar, está acompañado y su pareja le ayuda a cuidar el ganado, tiene un hijo de 19 años de edad que vive con él y ya finalizó el bachillerato, nadie mas vive con ellos. 


José  se dedica al comercio de ganado desde hace 10 años, pues fue la necesidad la que lo llevó a aprender el trabajo y un día se encontró con unos amigos y lo invitaron a negociar ganado, además se dedica a la agricultura. Su día comienza a las 5:00 AM donde primero ordeña las vacas que tiene, luego las lleva al potrero que se encuentra a 25 minutos de su casa, regresa a casa a las 8:00 AM para salir a los caseríos y cantones aledaños a buscar ganado para su negocio. Su familia se involucra en el trabajo.


El préstamo será utilizado, en la compra de 6 toretes para repasto pues tiene el rastrojo de la cosecha y quiere aprovechar ese pasto. El préstamo mejorará su negocio, pues a veces le toca que quedarles debiendo a sus clientes y ahora espera poder cancelarles todo.

Sus sueños, primero terminar su casa que ya está comenzada, después comprar un vehículo grande para su negocio, también le gustaría lograr tener unas 20 vacas lecheras y con la ganancia espera pagar el crédito, además desea ahorrar para cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
José, age 40, was in school until third grade. He left school because of his family's poverty; his father said it was better for him to learn to work. He has a partner, and she helps him to care for the livestock. He has one child, age 19, who lives with them and has finished college. No one else lives with them.

José has worked in livestock for ten years. Necessity brought him to learn this work. One day, he met some friends who invited him to trade in livestock. He also works in agriculture. His day starts at 5:00 am. First, he cares for his cows. Later, he takes them to the pasture which is located 25 minutes from his home. He returns home at 8:00 am in order to get out to the far away hamlets and villages to find livestock for his business. His family is also involved in the work.

This loan will be used for the purchase of six young bulls for grazing. He has stubble left over from the harvest and he wants to take advantage of this grazing. This loan will improve his business; sometimes he has to leave debts with his clients, and now he wants to cancel them all.

His dreams, first, are to be able to finish his home which he has already started. Later, he wants to buy a large vehicle for his business. He would also like to have 20 dairy cows. With his income he hopes to repay the loan. He also wants to save up to reach his dreams.

loans.use: to buy six young bulls for grazing.

loans.name: Zamiq

texts.en:
Zamiq is a 30-year-old married man who is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. 

Zamiq is a farmer and raises seasonal fruits and vegetables. He has six years of experience in this field, which makes him an experienced and skilled person in this field.
 
Zamiq usually sells his crop to the market vendors in his area. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthful. His monthly income is 100 AZN. Raising crops takes a lot of strength, in addition to working in the open air. This is very hard work, and that's why his  wife is helping him in this business. 

He needs additional money to invest in seeds and fertilizers. This will allow him to improve the quality of products he raises and increase his monthly turnover. For this purpose, he has applied for 2,000 AZN. This is going to be his first loan.

loans.use: to invest in seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy various food products such as oil, sodas and others for resale.

loans.name: Himed

texts.en:
Himed is a 51-year-old married man from Rafah. He lives with his wife and six kids, one son and five daughters, in a very simple house in the city. Himed works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low salary. This is the only source of income for the family. 

Himed took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank for his home. By taking this loan, Himed will be able to provide hot water in the winter using cheap energy. This will improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank for his home.

loans.name: Gulnar

texts.en:
Gulnar is a 26-year-old married woman. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) who lives with her family in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Gulnar is a farmer who raises seasonal fruits and vegetables. She has 6 years of experience in this field, which makes her an experienced and skilled farmer. 

Gulnar usually sells her crop to the market vendors in her area. People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy. Gulnar's monthly income is 100 AZN. Raising crops takes a lot of strength, in addition to working in the open air. This is very hard work, and that's why her  mother-in-law helps her. 

Gulnar needs additional money to invest in seeds and fertilizers. This will allow her to improve the quality of her products and increase her monthly turnover. She has applied for a loan of 2,000 AZN, which will be her first loan.

loans.use: to invest in seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Muqabil

texts.en:
Muqabil is 26 years old. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and he lives with his parents in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. 

He is a farmer and he has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last four years. During these years, Muqabil gained enough skills and experience to run the business. He chose this crop business because it is profitable and fresh fruits and vegetables are in high demand. He usually sells his crop in the central bazaar. His monthly income is AZN 100.

As these products are in high demand, Muqabil wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose, he applied for a loan of AZN 2,000. He will buy new garden tools, seeds, and fertilizer. This is going to be his first credit.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 32-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and three children, two sons and one daughter, in a very simple house in the city. Mohammad works as an employee in the public sector, earning a low salary, which is the family's only source of income. Mohammad would like to buy all the needed household items to improve the family's living conditions. 

Mohammad took out a USD loan from FATEN to help him to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank for his home. By taking out this loan, Mohammad will be able to provide hot water in the winter, using cheap energy, for his family.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank for his home.

loans.name: Kaffo

texts.en: This is 64-year-old Kaffo.  He is married and has six children who are 38, 31, 27, 25, 22 and 20 years old.  He has two additional dependents who live with him as his sales assistants.  In 1970, Kafo established his used clothing business. He began his business just to generate funds to settle his domestic bills. His business is located at the city centre and his main customers are all classes of customers. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 500,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan of Le 3,000,000. Kaffo has already received and successfully repaid two loans and now requires a new loan in order to buy bundles of used clothing for Le 3,000,000. He hopes that this loan will increase his stock level and his profit. In the future, Kaffo plans to complete the construction of his house and to educate his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy used clothes to sell

loans.name: Na'eem

texts.en:
Na’eem is 40 years old; he lives with his wife and three sons in Nablus. He is a construction worker.	

Na’eem is asking Ryada for this loan to buy flagstones to pave his house and to extend the plumbing. He hopes that this loan will improve his housing conditions and make life more comfortable for him and his family. He is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to buy flagstones to pave his house and to extend the plumbing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank for his home

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en: To make a living, Jimmy operates a service based business providing transportation in their village. He has been doing this more than four years, earning well for the family needs. He had successfully repaid his previous loan used for accessories and tires. Recently, he took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to repair the vehicle. Jimmy is hopeful and determined of improving the business for a better living of the family in the future.

loans.use: to repair the vehicle used for his transportation business

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en: Marlon is 29 years old, married, with one child. According to him, farming has been his primary source of income. He has been involved in this kind of business for 12 years. Having this kind of business requires determination and initiative. Despite of the uncertain nature of farming, Marlon still hopes for continuous growth of his farming business. Marlon is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy seeds, pesticides and fertilizers, which could be of great help in the development of his crops. He is hoping that his requested loan will be granted for him to obtain abundant crops and income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, pesticides and fertilizers for farming

loans.name: Carmen Ester

texts.es:
Carmen  tiene 54 años de edad de estado civil Unión Libre tiene 8 hijos vive con el esposo y con los hijos que aun son solteros en el Recinto Desvió De los Amarillo perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla PEQUEÑOS AGRICULTORES se encuentra ubicada el  recinto Desvió de los Amarillos, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Carmen  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y la crianza de animales de corral como pollos y cerdos. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades, además alimento para los animales balanceados. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

El sueño es seguir trabajando para tener dinero para viajar a Galapagos, le gusta mucho trabajar en el campo.
texts.en:
Carmen, 54, is in a common-law relationship and has eight children. She lives with her husband and the children, who are still single, in the Desvió de los Amarillos precinct in Ventanas canton, Los Ríos province. She belongs to the Pequeños Agricultores Communal Bank in the Desvió de los Amarillos precinct, Ventanas canton, where people work in agriculture and livestock.

Carmen makes a living in agriculture by growing corn and raising barnyard animals such as chickens and pigs. With the loan she'll be able to buy supplies like fertilizer, manure, and insecticide to avoid pests and disease, and balanced animal feed.

She makes her purchases in the city of Ventanas.

Her dream is to continue working in order to have money to travel to the Galapagos.  She really likes working in the fields.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, and insecticide to avoid pests and disease.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: Doña Maria es originaria de la ciudad de Granada. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de comida, el cual ha logrado tener un negocio muy rentable. Esta agradecida con Kiva y MiCredito ya que tiene un negocio prospero, y muy surtido con su platillos. Solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar: cebollas, chiltomas, arroz, aceite, verduras, frijoles, entre otros con el fin de brindar platillos que más demanda su clientela. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que obtendrá mejores ventas y buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria is a native of the city of Granada.  She is a merchant and makes a living selling food that she prepares, which has become a very profitable business.  She is grateful for Kiva and MiCredito since she now has a prosperous business that is well-stocked with her food.  

She is requesting a new loan in order to buy onions, peppers, rice, oil, vegetables, beans, and other items so that she may offer those dishes that her clients like the most.  She thinks that this loan will be very helpful in permitting her to sell more meals and earn greater profits.

loans.use: to buy onions, peppers, rice, oil, vegetables, beans, and other items.

loans.name: Sifrose's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of six group leader farmers in Kakamega North District, with Sifrose selected as the Kiva representative. Sifrose has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with her hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to her and the 61 other individual farmers represented in this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.							

Sifrose is a reliable member of the community; she is married with six children. Sifrose is 47 years old and has been working as a farmer for the last three years to support her family. In addition to this, Sifrose is very active in her community and is involved in the women's group. She described her harvest last year as excellent. She hopes as a One Acre Fund farmer she is able to join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers that have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program!							

The 2013 Long Rains season will be Sifrose’s first season with One Acre Fund. She joined this year in order to get the best seed prices, get new farming methods and get fertilizer and hybrid seeds. As an active member in her community, Sifrose also volunteered her time to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she is an active community member who wants to help more farmers and wants to spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers. Sifrose plans on using future profits from the harvest to send her children to school and invest in a business. She believes that her life will improve by working with One Acre Fund because she has more farm training and will be able to feed the family.		

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya. The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers. Sifrose and her group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.		

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize, millet, and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more tissue (soft absorbent paper), soap, milk, sugar, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Maa Kanaka Durga Self Help Group

texts.en:
In 2010, eight women from a village in Odisha stepped out and formed a group having the name Maa Kanaka Durga Self Help Group. They help each other and share their problems and solve them among themselves. They celebrate their festivals together in their village.
  
One of the women from this group is Rina (the lady standing second from right in the back row). She is the leader of the group, and she has six goats. She purchases the goat kids from the market and takes care of them. She provides vaccine and fodder to them when required. She sells them for meat to the local butcher shops when they grow. It takes eight to nine months for her to raise and sell them. She goes out in the morning to leave the goats for grazing in the fields and returns by noon. Then she cooks for her family.  She resumes taking care of her goats by feeding them at home. Her husband assists her in selling and maintaining these goats. In this way she is earning to improve her cash flow, which is not sufficient to manage her daily activities.
	
She wants to enlarge her business, so she wants to purchase 10 more goats. In this way she can earn a good amount after all expenditures in her business. 

She and her group members have requested a loan of 120,000 INR for her group so that they can all earn more and improve their families' cash flow.

loans.use: To purchase ten more goats and their fodder and vaccine.

loans.name: Neome

texts.en:
Neome is 33 years old and lives in Long Town with her husband and three children, who are between the ages of 7 months and 15 years old; two are in school. 

She runs a shop where she sells stout, beer, soft drinks, mineral water and many others beverages. Her business is the major source of income for her home and children. She started this business by selling from a market table in her community. She is requesting a loan to buy more beverages. Her plans are to expand her business even more and, in the future, to see her children out of high school and attending college.

loans.use: to buy more stout, beer, soft drinks, mineral water and many others beverages for her business.

loans.name: Weremisha's Group

texts.en:
Weremisha is a member of this group in Kakamega North District. He is pictured here in a group of five One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 62 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. Weremisha has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised. He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving inputs for ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.						

Weremisha is 55 years old and has been a farmer for 30. Weremisha works as a farmer to provide for his 14 children. The community and other farmers know Weremisha as friendly and an experienced farmer. Other than farming, he is also involved in his community, such as with the men's group and prayer group. Weremisha described his harvest last year as not with One Acre Fund, but hopes he can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in his group.							

He first joined One Acre Fund in 2013 and will continue working with One Acre Fund in order to get fertilizer and hybrid seeds and earn enough to feed his family. As an active member in his community, Weremisha also chose to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers. Weremisha plans on using future profits from the harvest to send his children to school.  

Weremisha and his group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.							

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To provide Kenyan farmers with increased access to hybrid seed and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter lives in Mwachande, a small town in Kwale County. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast, near Tanzania. Inconsistent rains, especially recently, have made farming difficult, and the poverty rates in the county are above the Kenyan average. Beekeeping is somewhat new to Kwale, but the passion fruit farms and mangrove forests throughout the area provide excellent sources of nectar for bee colonies. Many farmers  in the area have expressed excitement at the prospect of owning their own hives, and having a second source of income from their honey to help care for their families.  

Peter is married and has three children. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for 14 years and they currently have a tree plantation on their farm. Peter is excited about beekeeping as it complements his tree plantation.  

This is Peter’s first loan with Honey Care. He is interested in working with Honey Care because they are prompt in service. He plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to fence his farm. Peter’s hope for the future is to build a demo farm.

loans.use: to buy honey for honey production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fashion clothes, shoes, belts, rubber bowls, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali lives in Matuga, a small town in Kwale County. Kwale County is located on the Kenyan coast and is the southernmost Kenyan county. Though some of the towns along the beach see benefits from tourism, the majority of people living inland are farmers, and the region's inconsistent rains can make agricultural yields unpredictable.
