Beekeeping is a relatively new activity in the area, but many farmers here are enthusiastic at the prospect of owning their own hives.

Ali is married and has five children. His wife runs a business trading passion fruits. Both Ali and his wife have been farming for 17 years now. They are currently growing maize on their farm.

This is Ali’s first loan with Honey Care. He is interested in working with Honey Care because of its dedication to service. He plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to buy mason tools. Ali’s hope for the future is to expand his beekeeping project.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is a 48-year-old married woman who has run a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at reasonable prices and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Kousar makes enough to provide for her family. 

To fully stock her store, she has requested a loan of PKR 50,000, which she will use to buy stocks of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. Kousar would then be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Sandra Isabel

texts.es:
Sandra Isabel tiene 31 años de edad, vive junto a sus hijos en el distrito de Oyotun, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de animales de corral patos, pollos, cuyes, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y una segunda parte para arreglo de sus habitaciones y de esta manera tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sandra Isabel is 31 years old, and lives with her children in the Oyotun district.  Oyotun's population works in agriculture, commerce and animal breeding.  It is located two hours away from the Chiclayo province which belongs to the Lambayeque region on Peru's northern coast.

She works selling barnyard animals like ducks, chickens and guinea pigs.  Her business is located in the rear part of her house.  She has requested a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles to purchase balanced feed to fatten her animals as well as to repair the bedrooms in her home, allowing her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: purchase balanced feed and repair the bedrooms in her home.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 28 años de edad estado civil unión libre, vive con su esposa y su hijo de 5 años. Vive en el  Cantón Mocache provincia de los Ríos.

La ventanilla se llama Juntos Triunfaremos se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Jhon F. Kennedy 2, perteneciente al cantón Mocache cerca de Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Jorge se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos y mejorar el estilo de vida de la familia. Su sueño es obtener buenas ganancias y poder comprar un terreno.

Le gusta ser responsable y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Jorge is 28 years old and lives in a common-law marriage with his wife and their five year old son.  He lives in the Mocache canton in the Los Ríos Province.  The Juntos Triunfaremos communal bank is located in the John F. Kennedy 2 precinct in the Mocache canton near Ventanas.  It's members work in agriculture and livestock breeding.  Jorge has worked in agriculture for the past few years, planting corn and rice.  He purchases his products in Ventanas and he sells his in the same market.

The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase manure and fertilizer for his corn and rice crops.  The loan will help him to increase his earnings and improve his family's living conditions.  His dream is to earn a good income and be able to purchase a plot of land.  He likes being responsible and playing sports.

loans.use: purchase agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothing inventories to sell at the local market

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
This is Rose. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to add more stock in her vegetable stall. She has been in this business for years now, and it keeps on growing. 

She would like to apply for a loan, this time for 25,000 Kshs, to buy more stock of onions, tomatoes and vegetables. She would also use funds to pay school fees for her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy more stock of onions,tomatoes and vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Santos Ernesto

texts.es:
Santos de 51 años de edad, solo estudio hasta segundo grado, ya que desgraciadamente la escuela estaba demasiado retirada, aproximadamente a tres kilómetros de su casa, lo cual dificultaba que su madre pudiera recorrer todo ese trayecto dos veces al día, junto con él. Hoy Santos está casado, su esposa se dedica trabajar como ama de casa, tienen cuatro hijos de 23, 22, 18 y 12 años de edad, de los cuales dos estudian, los otros han terminado su educación básica.


Desde los quince años Santos trabajaba como jornalero, en las haciendas donde se cultiva Café, ahí realizaba labores como desombrar, podar, ahoyar, abonar y cortar el producto. De su padre aprendió el oficio de aserrar madera, a la edad de los veinte años. Actualmente, Santos es aserrador de madera y cultiva 14,000 metros cuadrados de terreno, en donde produce Maíz y Frijol.  En estas actividades recibe la ayuda de sus hijos, quienes reconocen el trabajo que su padre realiza, para que en su hogar no falte la alimentación diaria. El lugar donde cultivan esta aproximadamente a un kilómetro de su casa y lo recorren a pie, todos los días, de 6:00 am a 12:00 pm.


El préstamo será utilizado, para comprar insumos agrícolas, para realizar un cultivo asociado de 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y frijol. Con lo cual se está ayudando a que Santos continúe realizando una de las labores que conoce y que más le gusta, la cual es hacer producir la tierra, así asegurar la alimentación de su familia. 


Santos ha tenido la ilusión de tener un terreno donde producir,  así no estar con la incertidumbre cada año, si las tierras donde siembra, se las alquilaran. Es por eso, que junto a sus hijos todos los años, hacen lo posible para ver logrado ese sueño. Además, le gustaría mejorar la vivienda donde viven, a la cual le hacen falta muchos retoques. También está dispuesto a ayudarles a sus hijas, para que continúen estudiando y logren terminar la educación media.
texts.en:
Santos is 51 years old. He only studied up to Grade 2. Unfortunately the school was too far from his home, about 3 kilometres, which made it difficult for his mother to walk there twice a day with him. Today Santos is married. His wife takes care of the house. They have four children aged 23, 22, 18 and 12. Two of them study and the other two have finished their basic education.

Since he was 15 years old Santos has been working as day labor on coffee plantations. He does work like cleaning, pruning, digging holes, spreading fertilizer and harvesting. His father taught him how to saw wood when he was 20. Today Santos is a wood sawyer and cultivates 14,000 square meters of land producing corn and beans. He has the help of his children doing this so that in his house they don't lack food.  The fields where they work are about one kilometre from their house and they walk there every day, working from 6 am until noon.

The loan will be used to buy agricultural inputs to grow a companion crop of 14,000 square metres of corn and beans. This will help Santos continue to do what he likes best, which is to make the earth produce. This will ensure that his family can eat.

Santos has a dream of owning land to grow on, so as not to be uncertain each year if the land they grow on will be for rent. So each year together with his children, they do what is possible to achieve this dream. Also he would like to make improvements on the house they live in, it needs a lot of TLC. He also wants to help his children so that they continue studying and manage to finish their High School studies.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to grow 14,000 square meters of corn and beans as companion crops.

loans.name: Mzia

texts.en: Mzia is a 57-year-old widow, from Kaspi district. She lives with her son, who is currently unemployed. The only source of family's income is Mzia's job, working as a baker at a private company. She generates 300 GEL per month. The family needs another source of income to meet all basic needs and pay daily costs. So, Mzia decided to start a clothing business with the loan but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. She received the credit in the framework of joint initiative of Kiva and Credo - Start-up Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. With the loan of 600 USD, she will purchase clothing at wholesale price and sell them in her community door-to-door. Her regular customers will be her coworkers and neighbors. Mzia plans to sell wide assortment and well-priced clothing for men, women and children. The Start Up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased. She thanks Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: To purchase stock of clothing for her new business

loans.name: Umarawati Devi

texts.en:
Umarawati Devi is a 44-year-old, married woman with two sons and one daughter, who lives in Kalaiya -7, Bara district of Nepal. 

For the past ten years, she has been operating a general shop in which she sells food items, groceries, and general goods in her locality. She has good entrepreneurial skill and customer relations which has helped her to expand her customer base. 

Due to the ever-increasing demand for goods, Umarawati Devi wants the loan, in the amount of NPR 50,000 (Nepalese rupees), to buy stocks of inventory of food items and grocery items to meet the customer demand. 

In the future, she plans to expand her business and to give her children a good education.

loans.use: to pay for stocks of inventory of food items and groceries to meet the increasing customer demand.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha is 33 years old. She lives simply with her husband Ernesto and three children. To make a living, Editha has owned and operated a retail business for six years. She usually sells personal products. This time, Editha wants to improve her business as well as their living situation. So, she is seeking additional capital of PHP 15,000  to purchase more clothes, shoes, cologne, lotion and cosmetic products to sell. She's hoping that her desired loan will be granted, so that she can further improve her retail business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes and personal product items to sell

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
Teófilo tiene 50 años de edad, vive en el Caserío Playa Azul, una zona rural del distrito de Pucará, una comunidad que se caracteriza por su clima caluroso, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la construcción de corrales para animales menores, y los vende en el mercado de la zona, ha solicitado un préstamo de 5 00 nuevos soles para la compra de materiales para la construcción de sus corrales y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Teófilo is 50 years old, and lives in the village of Playa Azul, a rural area in the Pucará district.  It is a community known for its warm climate.  It is located two hours from the city of Jaén, which belongs to the Cajamarca region in Perú's northern sierra.  

He works building pens for small animals and selling them in the local market.  He has requested a loan of 500 nuevos soles to purchase materials for building pens, which will allow him to increase his earnings for his family.

loans.use: purchase materials to build pens.

loans.name: Zuleyxa

texts.en:
Zuleyxa is 47, a married woman with two children .She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and she lives with her family in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement.  She moved from the city of Fuzuli and now lives in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. 

Zuleyxa couldn’t get a higher education and, because of that, she decided to start her own business. For that she chose farming. She is growing fruits and vegetables in her own yard. Her husband  helps her, too. 

She wants to expand her business. The amount of products she sells is not enough to cover the high demand. She would like to grow more fruits and vegetables to increase her turnover as well as to improve the living conditions of her family. For this purpose, she has applied for a AZN 2,000 loan to buy farming supplies. This will be her first loan.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Joanna Camille

texts.en: Due to lack of job opportunities, Joanna Camille engages in cooking and selling meals and snacks in her community. She is 25 years old and has only one child. She aims to strengthen her business and increase her income in order to help her husband in satisfying their necessities. Due to insufficient capital, she is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy chicken, pork, fish, vegetables and other ingredients to cook and sell in her food stall. She is hoping that someday she will further improve the business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy chicken, pork, fish, vegetables and other ingredients to cook and sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva is a farmer from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is a married woman and the mother of four young children. Eva earns a living through her hog raising business. As of now, Eva needs a loan. She is requesting a loan to buy additional piglets to raise. With this, she will be able to improve her business and augment her income.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank for her home

loans.name: Nayila

texts.en:
Nayila is a 54-year-old married woman. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) who lives with her family in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Nayila and her husband are raising 5 children and both of them work hard to meet their needs. To cover their expenses, they are engaged in breeding livestock (cows and hens) and cultivating apricots, apples, pears and walnuts. 

At present, it is very difficult for the family to fully cover their needs. Therefore, Nayila  wants to increase their livestock a little bit. She needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to purchase two steers and forage for them. Nayila and her husband rely on the good will of lenders and will be thankful to them for helping them sustain their lives.

loans.use: to purchase two steers and forage for them.

loans.name: Parvizjon

texts.ru: Парвизчон умный молодой человек из столицы Таджикистана. Он родился в семье рабочего. Его родители всегда мечтали, чтобы он получил высшее образование. Он в средней школе учился отлично. Парвизчон осуществил мечту своих родителей. Он поступил в Национальный Университет Таджикистана. Данное время он является студентом 2 курса экономического факультета. Парвизчон один из лучших студентов. Он должен оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Парвизчон запрашивает займ на сумму 700 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Parvizjon is an intelligent young man from the capital of Tajikistan. He was born into a working-class family, but his parents have always dreamed of his getting a higher education. Parvizjon graduated high school with excellent marks, and realized his parents' dreams by enrolling in Tajik National University. 

He is now in his second year in the economics department and one of the top students. Parvizjon does not have the money to pay his next tuition bill. He is requesting a loan of US$700 to cover his tuition fees. Parvizjon awaits your kindness and hopes for your generosity.

loans.use: To pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Tunzala

texts.en:
Tunzala is a 26-year-old married woman. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Together with her husband she is bringing up three children. Tunzala is a happy mother. 

As a main source of income for her family, Tunzala raises livestock, having started this two years ago. Thanks to the hard work of Tunzala and her husband, the homestead currently has one heifer, five sheep, and ten goats. 

Tunzala also has a small garden with apple and plum trees. In the autumn after collecting the crop, she prepares jam and compotes for her family. The remaining portion of fruit and berries are sold. Her monthly income consists of 200 AZN. 

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Tunzala turned to Aqroinvest CU and Partners for a loan 2000 AZN to buy more sheep. She hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy sheep to increase the livestock headcount

loans.name: Gladness

texts.en:
Gladness is married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Nodar

texts.en: Nodar is a 64-year-old experienced farmer, from the village Uchkhiti. He lives with his wife, son and daughter-in-law. His son is a driver and monthly generates 400 GEL; his daughter-in-law is a teacher at the local school. Nodar and his wife are intensively engaged in agricultural activity. In particular, they have a milk-cow, produce cheese and sell it to the local market. Also Nodar takes has a vegetables and nuts garden; its products are also sold locally. He is really hard-working man, with great desire to do his best for the family's welfare and generate more income. So, Nodar requested a loan of 4000 GEL to purchase a mini-bus and start working on a special mini-bus line towards to the local school. He will transfer children from the various stations of the village and take them to the school. Nodar will have stable income with the help of this new activity and will be grateful to all Kiva lenders for assistance.

loans.use: To purchase a mini-bus for a transportation business.

loans.name: Sulema

texts.es: Sulema agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado, ella quiere continuar participando en este proyecto porque le ayuda a incrementar el capital del negocio y también se siente motivada para continuar trabajando en  su negocio, ella continúa en el banco comunal “Virgen de Chanca” y con la crianza de animales menores como chanchos, ovejas y venta de comida. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, fideos, aceite y otras cosas más.
texts.en:
Sulema is grateful to the lenders for the loan and is pleased with the help that has been offered.  She wants to continue to participate in this project because it helps her increase her business capital and she is motivated to continue working in her business.  

She is still with the "Virgen de Chanca" communal bank and still raises small animals like pigs and sheep, and sells food.  At this time she needs the loan to buy merchandise like sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, noodles, oil, and other things.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, noodles, oil, and other things.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Doña Luz Marina es originaria de la ciudad de Managua, casada y madre de cuatro hijos ya independientes. De 44 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Inicio su negocio hace tres años, con la venta de pocos productos, luego con la ayuda de sus familiares el negocio fue creciendo y logro salir adelante. Solicita el crédito para comprar productos tales como: Arroz, Frijoles, Azúcar, Aceite, Gaseosas entre otros. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá ofrecer más productos a su clientela. Su plan futuro es mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is a native of the city of Managua. She is a 44-year old married mother of four children who are now independent.  She works in retail, and has a small grocery store.  She began this business three years ago selling a few products.  Later, with the help of her family, her business began to grow and she was able to get ahead.

She is requesting a loan to purchase products such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, soda and others.  She believes that the loan will be very helpful as she will be able to offer more products to her customers.  Her plan for the future is to improve the infrastructure of her business.

loans.use: purchase products like rice, beans, sugar, oil, soda and others.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel  agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado, ella quiere continuar participando en este proyecto porque le ayuda a incrementar el capital del negocio y también se siente motivada para continuar trabajando en  su negocio, ella continua con la venta de frutas y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar manzanas y duraznos.
texts.en: Maribel  is grateful to the lenders for this loan and is happy for the offered support. She wants to continue participating in this project because it helps her increase the capital of her business and makes her feel motivated to do her business. She continues to sell fruit and this time she needs a loan to buy apples and peaches.

loans.use: to buy apples and peaches.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fodder for his farm cattle for the winter period

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María Elena tiene 45 años de edad, vive junto a sus familiares en el distrito de Tumán, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica al comercio de comida preparada y crianza de animales menores para negocio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de una cocina industrial y ollas nuevas para negocio y de esta manera generar ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Elena is 45 years old. She lives with her family in the district of Tumán, 45 minutes from Chiclayo on the North Coast of Peru. The people here work in agriculture, commerce and raising livestock.

María Elena works making meals and raising small animals as a business. She is requesting a loan of 1,500 PEN to buy an industrial stove and new pots for her business and in this way generate revenues for a higher quality of living.

loans.use: to buy an industrial stove and pots for her business.

loans.name: Syuzanna

texts.en:
Syuzanna lives in Goris with her parents. For two years she has been involved in selling clothing and accessories. Syuzanna purchases items from nearby retail markets and sells them in her town. Due to her hard work, Syuzanna gained a good number of customers.

Now, the number of orders has increased because of the coming holidays, and Syuzanna isn't able to satisfy current demand. She requests this loan to be able to purchase more stock to sell to her clients.

Syuzanna has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The start-up loan program provides business loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit. The loan will greatly assist this young lady to increase sales and earn a higher income for her parents.

loans.use: to pay for clothing to sell.

loans.name: Luz Yane

texts.es:
Luz Yane tiene 27 años de edad, vive junto a esposo en el distrito de Cayalti, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de comida preparada, que lo ofrece en su propio domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles, para la compra de vajilla platos, cubiertos, para ampliar su negocio y poder atender a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Luz Yane, age 27, lives with her husband in the Cayalti distric.  The population there works in agriculture, commerce, and with livestock.  It is two hours from the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru.

She sells prepared food at her house.  She has requested a loan for 2,000 soles to buy dishes, plates, and cutlery in order to expand her business and tend to her customers.

loans.use: to buy dishes for her business.

loans.name: George's Group

texts.en:
George's group is located in the Chwele District. He is pictured here in a group of 9 One Acre Fund group leader farmers. The group leaders represent a total of 98 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. George has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised. He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.

George is a reliable member of the community. He is married with four children. George is 39 years old and has been working as a farmer for the last 19 years to support his family. In addition to this, George is very active in his community and is involved in the men's group, savings group, prayer group and burial committee. He described his harvest last year as "good". He hopes to continue working with One Acre Fund and to continue enjoying the success he is having with the One Acre Fund farm packages. 

George first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2010 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. George joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, learn new farming methods, purchase fertilizer and hybrid seeds, and earn enough to feed his family and send his children to school. He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he likes being a leader, and as an active community member, he wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers. George plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school, repair the home, save for the future and invest in a business. He notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. George’s own life was improved because he has more profits from harvest, has more farm training, has more farm group support, and was able to save money and feed the family.   

George and his group needs a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.

loans.name: Alexander S.

texts.en:
Alexander is 36 years old and lives in the Kakata area. He is married and has seven children who live at home and attend school. 

For the past 10 years he has been involved in the sales of rice by the bag. He started this business by working in a rubber plantation, and learned this from friends. What he likes about this business is that he makes new friends every day. His biggest challenge is changing of USD to Liberian dollars.

He has requested this loan to purchase more rice to grow his business. In the future he wants to improve his stock.

loans.use: to purchase more rice to grow his business.

loans.name: Mardia

texts.en:
Mardia, 37 years old, lives in Logan Town. She and her fiancé, who works for the government, live together and have 3 children between the ages of 9 and 20, all attending school.

For the past four years, Mardia has been operating a shop selling cement. She sometimes experiences losses due to price fluctuations. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cement for her business. Mardia hopes to extend her business to other counties and to send her children to college in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more cement for her business

loans.name: Jorge David

texts.es: Jorge es originario de la ciudad de Boaco, casado y padre de un hijo. De 35 años de edad. Se dedica a la reparación y mantenimiento de celular. Negocio que inicio hace cuatro años como trabajador de soldadura, tiempo  después trabajo como ayudante en reparación de celulares. Hoy en día, cuenta con su propio negocio y muy rentable. Su meta es comprarse una vivienda. Solicita el crédito para comprar cargadores, memorias, carcazas, protectores, baterías, entre otros, con el fin de cumplir y brindar  a sus clientes un buen servicio. Estima que el crédito le ayudara ya que podrá resolver con las solicitudes de sus clientes, lo que le generara mejores ganancias. su plan futuro es tener su propio local y no estar alquilando y seguir trabajando para obtener más ingresos.
texts.en:
Jorge is from the city of Boaco.  He is 35 years old, married, and has one child.  He repairs and performs maintenance on cell phones.  He started the business four years ago as a soldering worker.  After that he worked as an assistant repairing cell phones.  He now has his own business, and it is very profitable.  His goal is to buy a house.

He is requesting the loan to buy chargers, memory cards, casings, protectors, and batteries, among others.  He will do this in order to carry out his work and provide his customers with good service.  

He feels that the loan will help him because he will be able to fill his customers’ requests.  This will generate greater earnings for him.  His plan for the future is to have his own place and to not be renting.  He also plans to continue working in order to get more income.

loans.use: to buy chargers, memory cards, casings, protectors, and batteries, among others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement for his business.

loans.name: Chalotte's Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of two women who have different trades. The featured borrower is Charlotte, 44, who is married and has three children aged 19, 11 and 5. Charlotte sells women's clothing and jeans. 

This is the group's eighth loan cycle with the institution. Charlotte will use her portion of the loan to buy women's clothing and jeans at wholesale because she has a lot of orders from her customers. Charlotte will use the profits to keep improving her business. Her goal is to be able to stock a variety of products so that she has a lot of sales and can also have her own store where she can make more money. Charlotte is grateful for this opportunity to be presented with a loan since this business is the only way that she is able to maintain her family and to pay for her children's education.

The group will need a total amount of GHS 3,000 to improve their businesses.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing and jeans wholesale

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra is 46 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She has been doing a business of selling milk with the help of her husband for many years. With the passage of time her sales increased and also her income. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. 

Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. 

She has some savings and has applied for a loan of PKR 50,000 to purchase another buffalo. She is in her fifth loan cycle with Kashf Foundation and has shown good repayment behavior. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Ruth Group

texts.en:
“I have completed a six-year partnership with WSDS and it has been wonderful,” says Tinneichong, who is the secretary for Ruth Group and also the featured borrower. She is pictured with her hand raised on the extreme left. The group resides in a village that is about 40 kms from Imphal town.

At the beginning of the loans, she started off her business by selling meat in the market, but she gradually changed her business into selling rice. She did that because meat cannot be stored for days, which used to be a huge loss for business. She sells imported and local rice in the town market and sometimes she takes rice to the neighbouring villages and sells it. She also takes orders for rice and accordingly arranges it and makes an income from customers. Rice is a staple food for the state and it is not difficult to sell it. 

With the Kiva loan, she will purchase rice from farmers and store it. Harvesting season has just ended and it is the right time to buy rice as the rate is low compared to other seasons. The profit will be more and she will have more chances to earn money in the future when the price of rice is high. She thanks Kiva for the support and for giving her financial support when she really needed it. She will always remain grateful for the work that Kiva has done. She says, “Thank you, Kiva.”

The rest of the group members are engaged in weaving, vegetable vending. rice selling, etc.

loans.use: To purchase rice stocks while they are cheaper and sell them with good profits.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en: To make a living, Anecita has operated a general store for ten years and she earns well for the family. She had successfully repaid her previous loan used in purchasing additional goods. Anecita always find ways in order to augment their living. She took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase more grocery goods to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en: Alfredo, 49 years of age, is married and blessed with three children. He owns and operates a transportation business, particularly motorcycle transport. He's been in this business for almost twenty-one years and earns a net income of PHP 400 daily. Due to lack of funds in his business, he would like to access a loan amounting to PHP 20,000 to pay for the registration of his motorcycle and repairs and maintenance. He hopes that his loan will be granted so that he will be able to improve his business.

loans.use: To pay for the registration of his motorcycle as well as repairs and maintenance.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis is a 53-year-old lady; she is married and spends her life with her seven children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She is taking a loan for her husband because her husband owns an embroidery shop. He has been selling embroidery raw material for many years. He sells sequins, pearls, thread, precious stones, silk, needles and wooden frames for embroidery. The embroidery materials for bridal dresses are very expensive but the turnover is very high. 

Due to the high cost he is facing a shortage of materials and is unable to purchase expensive raw materials to sell. Therefore, Nargis requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so her husband can overcome his shortage of embroidery materials. With this amount he will buy stocks of thread, fancy cloth, sequins, precious stones and pearls of various colors. Nargis is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for  embroidery for resale in her husband's shop.

loans.name: Imani Group

texts.en:
Gasper, who is in his late 30s, is married with two children who are still in school. He has been running a general store for three years. He works from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Gasper's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to buy items for his general store. He is doing great! He appreciates every one who has supported their group with the loan that he successfully repaid. He used the profit to pay school fees and cover household expenses. 

Gasper will use this loan to buy a good stock of the shop inventory to serve more customers. He dreams of buying a plot of land.

Gasper is part of the seven-member loan group "Imani" who hold each other accountable for repayment.

loans.use: to buy a good stock of the shop inventory to serve more customers.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es: Cirila agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado, ella quiere continuar participando en este proyecto porque le ayuda a incrementar el capital del negocio y también se siente motivada para continuar trabajando en  su negocio, ella continúa con la crianza de animales menores, la ganadería, la agricultura y la venta de comida y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, fideos, aceite, verduras y otras cosas más.
texts.en: Cirila is grateful to the lenders for this loan and is happy with the support offered. She wants to continue participating in this project as it helps her increase her business capital and motivates her to continue working. She continues to raise small animals, cattle, farm and sell meals. At this time she needs a loan to buy merchandise like rice, bags of sugar, pasta, oil, vegetables, etc.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as bags of rice, bags of sugar, pasta, oil and other items.

loans.name: Qapaq Niño De Huaynapata - Coya Group

texts.es:
La socia Bertha pertenece al banco comunal QAPAQ NIÑO DE HUAYNAPATA - COYA,la el banco se encuentra ubicado en el sector de Huaynapata,distrito de Qoya,provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Bertha tiene 27 años de edad y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de frutas, la socia vende diferentes tipos de frutas como plátanos, manzanas papayas entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de frutas como papayas entre otros.
Los demás socios se dedican a la venta de golosinas, crianza de animales menores, transporte, maestro constructor.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Bertha is a member of the communal bank "Qapaq Niño de Huayanpata - Coya." The bank is located in the Huaynapata area of the Coya District, which is located in province of Calca in the region of Cusco. 

Bertha is twenty-seven years old and lives with a partner. She alternates her daily activities with her fruit-selling business. She sells several types of fruit, such as bananas, apples, and papayas, among others. She has had this business for quite some time, and it is going well for her, thanks to the dedication that she puts forth every day. Bertha is responsible and determined; she hopes to continue working to support her family. 

She is applying for this loan to buy papayas as well as other fruits.

The other members work in areas such as soft drink sales, small animal husbandry, and transportation; one member also works as a master builder.

Bertha is grateful for the provided loan, and she is committed to pay her installments.

loans.use: to buy fruit such as bananas, apples, and papayas.

loans.name: César Augusto

texts.es:
César, con 26 años de edad, se ha caracterizado por ser un hombre trabajador y pujante, con una experiencia laboral de 5 años, en los que ha trabajado de manera independiente ya que ha tenido diversos negocios como heladerías y panaderías. Actualmente desea comprar un negocio de comidas rápidas que le ofrecen con toda la dotación y los activos ya instalados, pero requiere pintar,  adecuar el espacio y comprar los insumos al por mayor (panes, carnes frías, salsas, gaseosas, desechables, entre otros), es por ello que se motiva a solicitar el préstamo con el fin de dar inicio a su nuevo proyecto productivo.
Hoy en día, César es empleado de una empresa, por lo que contará con el apoyo de 2 personas tiempo completo y él se encargará del control y administración del negocio, con ello desea generar recursos suficientes para independizarse totalmente y quiere aprovechar la ventaja que tiene, pues el establecimiento lleva aproximadamente 15 meses en funcionamiento, por lo que ya es conocido en el sector y, con la nueva imagen que le dará espera atraer nuevos clientes; lo que para César significaría haber cumplido su reto personal y profesional, logrando tener una estabilidad económica favorable para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
César is 26 years old, and is known to be a hardworking and perseverant man.  He has five years of working experience, and in those five years, he has worked independently as he has had various businesses like ice cream shops and bakeries.  Currently, he wants to purchase a fast food business that they are offering to him with all of the equipment already installed.  However, it is in need of painting and some repairs, as well as the supplies (bread, cold cuts, sauces, sodas, paper products, etc...).  For this reason, he is seeking a loan so that he can begin his new project.  

Currently, César works in a company that has two full-time employees.  He is in charge of monitoring and administering the business, but he wants to earn enough to become fully independent.  He wants to take advantage of the opportunity he has since the restaurant has been in existence for 15 months, and is well known in the area.  With the new image he will give it, he hopes to attract new customers.    For César, achieving financial stability and improving his quality of life, will be the sign that he has reached his personal and professional goals.

loans.use: purchase a fast food restaurant, paint the space, repair the space and purchase supplies in bulk (bread, cold cuts, sauces, soda, paper products, etc...)

loans.name: Gulguna

texts.ru: Гулгуна в ИМОНе кредитуется повторно. Она уже более 25 лет занимается скотоводством. Она покупает скот, откармливает несколько месяцев и перепродает на местном рынке. Гулгуна вдова. Ее муж умер несколько лет назад. Гулгуна живет вместе сыном и его женой. Данное время невестка Гулгуны больна. Ей необходимо лечиться. Однако они не имеют денег для лечения. Гулгуна запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 долларов США для покупки лекарства для лечения невестки. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Gulguna is a repeat borrower at IMON. For 25 years, she has been involved in raising livestock. She buys livestock, fattens them for several months and sells them at the local market.

Gulguna is a widow. Her husband passed away several years ago. Gulguna lives with her son and his wife. At the moment, Gulguna's daughter-in-law is ill. She needs medicine. At the same time, they do not have money for treatment. Gulguna is requesting a loan of US$1,500 to pay for treatment for medicating her daughter-in-law.

loans.use: to buy medicine for treatment

loans.name: Sobira

texts.ru: Собира трудолюбивая женщина, которая живет на северной части Таджикистана вместе со своей семьей. Она трудолюбивая женщина и трудится с раннего утра до позднего вечера. Она имеет свой бизнес. Собира занимается скотоводством. Она покупает скот, откармливает несколько месяцев и продает на местном рынке. Она этим бизнесом занимается уже более 12 лет. Ее муж помогает ей по введению бизнеса. Собира хочет увеличить оборотный капитал и таким образом увеличить доход, так как она нуждается в деньгах. Ее дети уже взрослые, им 17 и 13 лет и они требуют больше благ. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 6000 сомони для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Sobira is a hardworking woman who lives in the northern part of Tajikistan with her family. She works from early morning until late in the evening in her livestock business. She buys cattle, fattens them for a few months and sells them on the local market. She has been in business for more than 12 years. Her husband helps her run her business. 

Sobira wants to increase her working capital and her income, as she needs the money. Her children are already grown. At 17 and 13 years, they have greater needs. Sobira is asking for a loan of 6,000 TJS to buy more cattle. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy cattle to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Esmily

texts.en:
Esmily is married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past four years, she has operated a retail shop and a vegetable business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Seasonality and theft are her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

She is requesting a loan for Kshs 50,000 which she plans to use to buy soap, tomatoes, wheat flour, onions, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans and cooking  oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to buy food items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Sharafkul

texts.ru: Шарафкул добрый человек. Он родился в 1961 году. Шарафкул вместе со своей семьей живет в отдаленном регионе. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Шарафкул имеет высшее образование. Он работает учителем литературы в средней школе своего села. Он всегда старался для того, чтобы его дети получили высшее образование. Его сын учится в университете. Шарафкул не имеет денег, чтобы оплатить за учебный договор. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 4000 сомони для оплаты учебного договора своего сына. Он надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Sharafkul is a kind person. He was born in 1961 and lives with his family in a remote region. He is married and is raising three children. Sharafkul has a college degree and teaches literature at his local high school. 

Sharafkul has always tried to ensure that his children receive higher education, and his son is studying at a university. Sharafkul does not have enough money to pay his son's tuition, so he is requesting a loan of 4000 somoni to cover this cost. He is thankful in advance for your generosity.

loans.use: to pay his son's college tuition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Milton

texts.es: Milton agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contento por el apoyo brindado,él quiere continuar participando en este proyecto porque le ayuda a incrementar el capital del negocio y también se siente motivada para continuar trabajando en  su negocio, él continúa con la venta de un plato de comida especial llamado Pollos a la Brasa entonces en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos como por ejemplo pollos y papas.
texts.en: Milton thanks the Kiva lenders for this loan.  He is happy to be getting this support.  He wants to continue with his plans, because this will help him to increase his business capital.  Also, he is very motivated to continue working in his business.  He continues to sell a special dish called "Pollos a la Brasa" (blackened chicken).  At this time, he needs a loan to buy more supplies, such as chicken and potatoes.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies, such as chicken and potatoes.

loans.name: Ana Ysabel

texts.es:
Ana Ysabel tiene 34 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos, en la zona urbana de Cayaltí, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la actividad de crianza de ganado vacuno y venta de leche, desde hace más de 3 años, es una mujer emprendedora, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 500 nuevos soles para la compra de chala, alfalfa y alimentos balanceados para producción de leche fresca para su ganado vacuno.
texts.en:
Ana Ysabel is 34 years old. She lives with her husband and children in the urban area of Cayaltí, two hours from Chiclayo on the North Coast of Peru. The people here are involved in farming, commerce and raising livestock.

Ana Ysabel has been raising cattle and selling milk for the past three years. She is an enterprising woman. She is requesting a loan of 2,500 PEN to purchase corn husks, alfalfa and balanced feed for the production of fresh milk from her cows.

loans.use: to buy corn husks, alfalfa and balanced feed for her cattle.

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
Luis Enrique tiene 27 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en el distrito de La Matanza una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de pavos,gallinas, patos y cerdos, desde hace 3 años aproximadamente, el mismo que lo realiza en el caserío y ciudades cercanas, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de pavos y cerdos para porsteriormente engordarlos y ofrecerlos a un mejor precio a sus clientes, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Luis Enrique is 27 years old.  He lives with his family in the Matanza district, a community involved in agriculture, commerce and animal husbandry that is located 2 hours from the city of Piura, on the northern coast of Peru.

Luis Enrique has had a business selling turkeys, hens, ducks and pigs for about 3 years.  He carries out the business activities in his settlement and in nearby cities.  He has requested a loan of 2,000 Peruvian soles to buy turkeys and pigs to later fatten and sell at a better price to his customers, so that he can generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy animals for his business

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta lives in Ijevan city, which is in Tavush region. Marieta is not married and she lives alone. 

For many years, she used to work as a nurse at the school, but since 1996, she became engaged in a clothes-trading business. Thanks to her business successes, she built a shop where she works today. Also, she bought a small flat and she has greatly helped and, until now, continues to help and financially support her relatives and friends. 

The merchandise she brings, or she takes some orders from abroad and, sometimes, she brings the clothes from the Yerevan wholesale market in a rented car. She sells a great range of women's clothes and bags and also clothes for children.

Marieta asks a loan of USD 3,000 (US dollars) in order to buy a winter clothes collection.

loans.use: to buy a winter clothes collection to resell during the Christmas and New Year holidays.

loans.name: Yurik

texts.en:
Yurik, like many farmers, again needs Kiva lender’s generous support and reliable partnership. Already once, Yurik is sure the deal with Kiva and its field partner Nor Horizon is rather safe and profitable for his family and farm. 

Yurik lives in the village of Berkaber in Tavush region. He has two sons. The elder one is already married and with his family he lives and works in the Russian Federation. His second son lives with Yurik and his wife and they are all engaged in farming and agriculture. Yurik works at the village administration, but farming for him is first priority since only through its income does his family earn a living. On their nice farm they breed cows, calves, bulls, piglets, beehives, turkeys and chickens. Their orchard is unbelievably rich and pretty; they grow figs, persimmons, pears, apples and cherries. All these goods they manage to sell and also to have for their own use.

Yurik asks for a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a lot of animal fodder for his farm cattle for winter time.

loans.use: to buy a lot of animal fodder for his farm cattle for winter time

loans.name: Yevgenya

texts.en:
Yevgenya is 54 years old. She lives in Vanadzor city in Lori region. Yevgenya has a higher education; she has graduated from Yerevan State University, the faculty of Mathematics. 

For several years after graduation she has worked at her specialty, but now she works at a boarding school as a mentor. As she says despite that at this moment she is not working at her specialty, she does her work with pleasure, and she gives all her maternal love and care to the children. They really need it, since they stay apart from their families during the whole week, as their parents cannot earn enough money to send them to the usual secondary schools. 

Yevgenya’s husband was a policeman, but now he is already retired. They have two sons, and both of them are married. Their elder son with his family lives apart from them. So Yevgenya lives with her husband and her son’s family. 

This year they have a problem which they hope to solve by the help of Kiva’s generous lenders.

She asks a loan of AMD 1,000, 000 in order to settle the heating system in their flat (to buy a heating boiler and batteries), since this year’s winter is extremely cold and severe.

loans.use: to install a heating system in her flat, since this year’s winter is extremely cold and severe

loans.name: Nato

texts.en:
Nato lives in the Bolnisi district. She is 40 years old and lives with her husband, in-laws and one child. Nato trades with linens and household items among community members and earns a monthly income. Moreover, the family owns two commercial spaces in their district that are rented out. 

In order to generate more income, Nato plans to start a small café in one of her commercial spaces. With the startup credit, Nato will set up a fast food café. She will purchase all the needed inventory to begin business. She will sell sandwiches, pies, and fizzy drinks. Nato hopes her business will be profitable and that she will attract many customers since there is no similar café nearby. The profit will be reinvested in the same business and Nato will be able to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to start up a fast food cafe.

loans.name: Armavir

texts.en:
Armavir lives in Goris town with his wife and 19-year-old daughter. Armavir has been providing auto repair service from the small rented garage in Goris town for 10 years. He is a very hardworking man who does his best to satisfy his clients’ needs and also gather a good income for his family.

Currently, because of hard financial conditions, Armavir asks this loan to be able to purchase new tools and materials that he needs for his work and also to renovate the old equipment.

He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important for this hardworking man to be able to continue providing his service and provide better living conditions to his family members.

loans.use: to purchase new tools and materials that he needs for his work and also to renovate the old equipment.

loans.name: Satine

texts.en: Satine is 38 years old and she lives in a really nice city, Dilijan, extremely rich with nature. Satine is married and she has two very clever sons who are of school age. Her elder son has decided to become a doctor in the future and her second son dreams of becoming a painter and he already has a great interest in it. Satine works at the mineral waters factory and her husband is a taxi driver. They work hard in order to provide their sons with good living conditions and also to do some savings which recently helped them to repair their flat, the furnishing of it they are not able to organize without the help of Kiva and its kind lenders. Satine asks for a loan of 160,000 Armenian drams in order to buy furniture for their living room.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her living room

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.ru:
Ахмаду  60 лет.   Он  был не в состоянии учиться в связи с финансовым положением своей семьи, учитывая тот факт, что он только жил с матерью и двумя сестрами, он должен был работать целый день. Его жена домохозяйка, и все его дети уже обзавелись своими семьями.
Ахмад зарабатывает на жизнь в сельском хозяйстве, которое научила его мать, как ухаживать и откармливать скот. С самого раннего возраста он занимался этой деятельностью, работая каждый день. Он также имеет доход от выращивания сельхозкультуры. Каждый день его жена встает рано, чтобы доить своих коров, затем направляет их на пастбище.  Вечером  он  обратно  приводит своих коров, в этом помогают его дети, у которых распределены свои задачи.
Кредит будет использован для покупки коров. В будущем, Ахмад надеется купить больше коров и увеличить свое стадо.
texts.en:
Ahmad is 60 years old. He was unable to go to school because of the financial situation of his family. Given to the fact that he lived only with his mother and two sisters, he had to work all day. His wife is a homemaker, and all his children have already started their own families.

Ahmad earns a living in agriculture, which he learned from his mother, how to care for and fatten livestock. From an early age, he has been involved in this activity, working every day. He also has income from the growing of crops. Every day, his wife gets up early in order to milk the cows, then leads them to pasture. At night, he brings the cows back. His children help with this, by distributing the tasks among them.

The loan will be used to buy cows. In the future, Ahmad needs to buy more cows and to expand his herd.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Ekomefeemo Group

texts.en:
The seven members of the "Ekomefeemo" Group are all women, with an average age around 40-years-old, and with an average of three children. All of them live in extended families in the Teshie district, one of the traditional areas in the town of Teshie-Accra.

This will be the seventh loan cycle for the women from field partner ID-Ghana. The group will use their loan to to buy fish, provisions, clothing, curtains, bed sheets and cosmetics and to enable them to satisfy the needs of their customers.

Mary sells smoked fish, she is standing second from the left and has a sample of the smoked fish placed in the photo. She will use her loan amount of GHS 3000 to buy four cartons of smoked fish so that she can sell to customers. She will resell her products on a retail, cash basis to her customers, who are mostly women. Mary sells her products from home.

Mary expects to earn a monthly average of GHS 250. She will use her earnings to repay her loan with interest and to save for the future.
They need a total amount of GHS 9100 to improve their businesses.

loans.use: to buy four cartons of smoked fish so that she can sell to customers.

loans.name: Regina's Group

texts.en:
These group member are in their early 30s, all married and have, on average, two children each.
 
Regina has been running an egg and plastics business for five years now. She works from 7:00am to 5:00pm daily, and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Regina's first loan from Kiva partner ID-Ghana. She will use the loan amount of GHS 400 to buy more eggs and plastic products to sell to customers. She promises to repay back her loan successfully. She will use the profit to pay school fees and household expenses and to buy more eggs. She dreams of owning a mini-supermarket and having a good lifetime.

Regina will take this loan along with members of her borrowing group which has a total of six members. They will hold each other accountable for repaying back the loan amount of GHS 2,100.

loans.use: to buy more eggs and plastic products to sell to customers.

loans.name: Basheeran

texts.en:
Basheeran is a 51-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with the help of her husband who is also shown in the photo. 

Basheeran has three years of experience in this field. As her husband has maintained many contacts over the years, he is able to assist her by purchasing stock for the store from the market. She is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health.

Basheeran wants to grow her business, so she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy packs of salts, biscuits, sweets and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting to boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, sweets and beverages.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura tiene 71 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Morropon, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, es una comunidad que se caracteriza por la elaboración de plata, ubicado en la Región Pira, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de cerdos desde hace quince años, cuenta con clientela considerable en la zona, es una mujer emprendedora tiene la oportunidad de vender sus cerdos en los caseríos aledaños, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 500 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de los mismos y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Laura, 71, lives in the district of Morropon, where people work in agriculture, commerce, and raising livestock.  The community, known for its silver production, is located in the Piura region on the north coast of Peru.  Laura has been selling pigs for 15 years, and she has a considerable clientele in the area.  She is an enterprising woman, and has the opportunity to sell pigs in neighboring villages.  She has requested a loan of 2,500 PEN to buy nutritious feed to fatten her pigs so she can generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy nutritious feed to fatten her pigs

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is married and the mother of four children. She lives with her family in the town of San Miguel, Bohol, where she has earned a living for more than three years by raising hogs. Her husband is a farmer. She is requesting a loan to buy feed for the pigs. Her goal is to improve her hog-raising business and thereby increase her income and her profits.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs

loans.name: Samui

texts.en: Samui is a 65-year-old woman with 12 children. She runs a business selling goods in her community. She has 3 years of experience in this business. Samui has requested a loan to buy snacks, soft drinks, sugar, salt, flour, onions, and rice. She plans to use her profits to save for her family's daily needs. She has been a member of SPBD since 2008.

loans.use: to buy snacks, soft drinks, sugar, salt, flour, onions, and rice.

loans.name: Bobonazar

texts.ru:
Бобоназару 33 года. Он из района Шахритус. Шахритус один сельских районов Таджикистана, населения, которое сохранила свою тысячелетнюю культуру и обычая. Бобоназар один из тех жителей, который чтить культуру и привычки своего народа. К тому доказательство его верхняя одежда. Он одет в джому ( Джома- это древняя верхняя одежда для мужчин. Она сделана из прессованной ваты). Джому по сей день надевают в поселках, селах и деревнях Республики Таджикистан. Она помогает уберечься от холода, и от жары в теплую погоду.
   Бобоназар как и свои предки занимается земледелием. Такая деятельность передалось ему от его отца. Бобоназар выращивает сельскохозяйственные культуры. Но на данный момент он решился параллельно заняться животноводством. Такая деятельность поможет ему получить больше дохода, и он найдет себе занятия зимой. Но для покупки скотов у Бобоназара недостаточная сумма денег, поэтому он просит Вас помочь. Помогите ему.
texts.en:
Bobonazar is 33 years old. He is from the Shahrituz region. Shahrituz is a rural region of Tajikistan that has preseverd its 1000-year old culture and customs.  Bobonazar is a local who respects the culture and traditions of his people. You can see this by the way he is dressed. He is wearing a “joma” (a traditional men’s robe made of pressed cotton). In villages and hamlets  around Tajikistan, people still wear “joma”. It protects both from the cold and, in warm weather from the heat.

Bobonazar, like the generations before him, is a farmer. He has learned this work from his father. Bobonazar grows produce. But at present he would like also to raise livestock. This will allow him to earn a bigger income and he will be able to spend the winter usefully.  His funds are insufficient to buy livestock, which is why he is turning to you for help. Please help him!

loans.use: to buy cattle and launch his livestock business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita earns a living as a dressmaker. She works with her husband to create all kinds of clothing, including casual wear, jeans and basketball and school uniforms, and earns a good income. She has successfully repaid a previous loan that she used to buy supplies for her business, and is requesting a new loan to buy more supplies, including fabric and thread to use to make curtains. She hopes to have more orders and buy another sewing machine so that she can fill orders faster and in greater numbers.

loans.use: to buy dressmaking materials such as thread and a bobbin case..

loans.name: Soyna

texts.en: Soyna is 31 years old and single with 1 child. She runs a small business selling meat buns in her community, and she has been doing this for 2 years. Sonia has requested a loan to buy flour, onions, soy sauce, cooking oil, a large cooking pot, and chicken. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. Soyna will use her business profit to help her business and her family.

loans.use: to buy flour, onions, soy sauce, cooking oil, a large cooking pot, and chicken.

loans.name: Tofaga

texts.en: Tofaga is a 35-year-old married woman with 7 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro plants and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Tofaga has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, a mist blower, a wheelbarrow, gloves, shovels, a rake, and a bush knife. She has been a member of SBPD since 2009. With her profits, Tofaga hopes to provide for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, a mist blower, a wheelbarrow, gloves, shovels, a rake, and a bush knife.

loans.name: Apiseka

texts.en: Apiseka is 38 years old and married with 6 children. She runs a small business selling BBQ in her community, and she has been doing this for 4 years. Apiseka has requested a loan to buy sausages, chicken, mutton flaps, onions, soy sauce, and salt. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Apiseka will look at improving her business and also will help her family and kids.

loans.use: to buy sausages, chicken, mutton flaps, onions, soy sauce, and salt.

loans.name: Khaticha

texts.ru: Хатича честная и умная женщина. Она разведена и имеет 2 детей. Хатича более 6 лет работает в средней школе своего района уборщицей. Она очень чистоплотная женщина. Хатича старается выполнять свою работу на высшем уровне, чтобы руководство было довольно ее работой. Хатича вместе со своими детьми живет в старом доме. Крыша ее дома нуждается в ремонте. Вовремя дождя, течет с ее крыши дома. Она должна отремонтировать крышу дома, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2500 сомони для покупки шифера. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Khaticha is an honest and intelligent woman. She is divorced and has two children. For more than six years, Khaticha has been working in her local high school as a janitor. She is a very neat and tidy woman. Khaticha strives to fulfill her work at the highest level, so that the administration will be pleased with her work. She lives with her children in an old house, and its roof needs to be repaired. When it rains, the roof leaks. She needs to fix the roof but doesn't have the money. She is requesting a loan of 2500 somoni to buy slate. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy slate to fix her roof

loans.name: Aatasi

texts.en:
Aatasi is a 30-year-old married woman with four children. 

She makes and sells ice cake in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business.

Aatasi needs a loan to buy bags, sugar, plastic bags,cordial flavor, and a cooler. She plans to use her profits to buy more ingredients to improve her business and help her family.

Aatasi has been a member of SPBD since 2013

loans.use: to buy bags, sugar, plastic bags, cordial flavor, and a cooler.

loans.name: Tamikoa

texts.en: Tamikoa is a 45-year-old married woman with 2 children. She makes and sells ice cakes in her community to earn a living. She has 2 years of experience in this business. Tamikoa needs a loan to buy sugar, plastic bags, cordial flavors, and a cooler. She plans to use her profits to buy more ingredients to improve her business and to assist with family matters. Tamikoa has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy sugar, plastic bags, cordial flavors, and a cooler.

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
Antonina is 18 years old, married, and has one child. 

She runs a small business selling meat buns in her community and has been doing this for two years. 

Antonina has requested a loan to buy flour, salts, onion, ginger, soy sauce, garlic, cooking oil and chicken. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Antonina will provide for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy flour, salts, onion, ginger, soy sauce, garlic, cooking oil and chicken.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: Paulina agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado, ella quiere continuar participando en este proyecto porque le ayuda a incrementar el capital del negocio y también se siente motivada para continuar trabajando en  su negocio, ella continua con el negocio de venta de frutas y le va muy bien y ella  entonces en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más frutas como por ejemplo manzanas.
texts.en:
Paulina is grateful to the lenders for the loan.  She is happy about the support that was provided.  She wants to continue participating in this project because it helps her to increase her business capital.  She is also motivated to continue working in her business.

She continues with the business of selling fruit.  It is going very well for her.  She now needs the loan to buy more fruit such as apples.

loans.use: to buy fruit, such as apples.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase wood, sheet metal and tile to improve her house and 100 pounds of silk thread to make hammocks.

loans.name: Poto

texts.en:
Poto is a 33-year-old woman, with no children. She has a small plantation and she grows taros, bananas, and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years.

Poto has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, shovels, gloves, a rake, a wheel barrow, a mist blower, and a bush knife. She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2013. With her profits, Poto hopes to provide good support to her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, shovels, gloves, a rake, a wheel barrow, a mist blower, and a bush knife.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is a 47-year-old young lady with two children. She owns and operates a business venture, selling already-made design dresses such as lavalava and t.shirt. She has two years of experience in this line of business. Betty needs a loan to buy a new sewing machine, needles, threads, fabric material, and paint brushes. She hopes to use her profits to support her family. She joined SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, needles, threads, fabric material, and paint brushes

loans.name: Daniela

texts.en:
Daniela is 57 years old, from the town of Panglao in Bohol. She is married with adult children. She has been raising hogs for three years now. She is asking for a loan to buy new piglets, feed, and supplements. 

She plans to continue investing in hog raising. She hopes to make her business even bigger in order to have better savings for her future needs.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business and have a bigger piggery for increased profits.

loans.use: to buy new piglets, feed, and supplements

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
Rosalia tiene 38 años de edad, vive junto a su hijo en el distrito de Oyotun, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de animales de corral patos, gallinas, cerdos desde hace más de cinco años, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de animales en mayor proporción y alimentos balanceados para engorde de los mismos y de esta manera ofrecerlo a sus clientes a un mejor precio, lo que le generara mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Rosalia is 38 years old.  She lives with her child in the Oyotun district, a community involved in agriculture, commerce and livestock that is located 2 hours from Chiclayo, on the northern coast of Peru.

Rosalia's had a business buying and selling barnyard animals such as ducks, hens, and pigs for more than 5 years.  She has requested a loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles to buy a larger number of animals and nutritionally balanced feed so that she can fatten them. In this way, she can offer her customers a better price, and thus generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy balanced animal feed to fatten her animals, and to buy livestock

loans.name: 3.10.608.03.thiệu Chính Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Huệ is 34 years old and married with two children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

Huệ works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. Huệ has been involved in this business for more than ten years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in the future.

Huệ is the group leader of the 3.10.608.03.Thiệu Chính solidarity group, which consists of four members. In 2011, Huệ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. 

In the future, Huệ hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 58-year-old married woman. Her husband is a carpenter. 

She raises hogs for an income. She usually earns 4,000 PHP a month from her livelihood. 

She is asking for a loan to buy new piglets to raise as well as hog feed to keep them healthy. She hopes to expand her business in the future and also hopes for her family to have an additional thriving business.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: Diana Grabiela

texts.es:
Diana Gabriela tiene 43 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Zaña, una comunidad que está ubicada cerca al valle del rio Jequetepeque lo que le ha permitido desarrollarse mediante la agricultura, su población se dedica al comercio y ganadería a una hora con veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica al comercio de artículos para el hogar, bazar y venta de ropa, es una mujer emprendedora ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mercadería y de esta manera ofrecer a sus clientes para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Diana Grabiela is 43 years old and lives with her family in the Zaña district, a community located near the valley of the Jequetepeque river which has allowed them to develop by means of agriculture.  The population makes a living through commerce and livestock.  It is an hour and twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo, on the northern coast of Perú.

Diana makes a living by selling household goods, housewares, and clothing.  She is an enterprising woman, and has asked for a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles to buy merchandise to offer her customers in order to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock up her business.

loans.name: Amancio

texts.es:
Amancio tiene 36 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Oyotun, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica con la ayuda de su esposa a la crianza y comercialización de animales patos, gallinas, gallos, pollos, cerdos, desde hace más de 10 años de experiencia, ha solcitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de animales en mayor cantidad y alimentos balanceados para ofrecer a sus clientes a un mejor precio, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Amancio is 36 and lives with his wife and children in the district of Oyotun, two hours from the city of Chiclayo on the north coast of Peru.  The people there earn their living in agriculture, business, and livestock.  

With the help of his wife, Amancio has made his living for more than 10 years raising and selling animals including ducks, hens, roosters, chickens [for cooking], and pigs.  He has requested a loan of 1,000 soles to buy animals in large numbers as well as balanced feed.  He'll offer them to his clients for a good price to make more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed to fatten up his young animals.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, 35, is a married woman with two children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Jane has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. 

Jane requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Jane would like to save enough money so she could continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Jessiren

texts.en:
Jessiren is 30 years old, married, and has three children. With two children currently in school, Jessiren works very hard to provide for them.

Jessiren runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, candies, soft drinks, diapers, etc.
 
Jessiren requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, snack foods, candies, soft drinks, diapers, etc. in her general store.
