In the future, Jessiren would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, snack foods, candies, soft drinks, diapers, etc. in her general store.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Joan requested a PHP 5,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more goods to sell in her general store.

Joan has been in this business for four years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 56 years old and married, with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Josefina runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Josefina has been in this business for seven years and she sells a variety of items, such as shampoo, detergent soap, soft drinks, canned goods, and other groceries. 

Josefina would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Juana is 44 years old and has five children who are still in school.

Juana has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to by more fish to sell to her customers.

Juana has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to by more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 32-year-old Fatmata from Waterloo Western rural in Freetown in Sierra Leone. She is married with 2 children. For the past 10 years, Fatmata has operated a retail business. She began her business because she wants to contribute to the support of her children. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 5:30 pm, 6 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and lack of a proper business location.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase more onions for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, Fatmata plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more onions for resale.

loans.name: Nat's Group

texts.en: Originally from a rural village of the Thmor Koul district of the province of Battambang, Nat is a 39-year-old mother of three children. Rice farming has been the only source of her family’s income to make a living. To provide more income, her husband works for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 56,000 KHR per day. Nat is with VisionFund just for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Nat will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Chun

texts.en:
Living in a thatched roof house in a rural village in the district of Ek Phnom, in the province of Battambang, Chun is 50 years old and widowed. She has four children. She earns a living through buying and selling coconuts in her village. With her current business, she is able to earn approximately $36 USD per day to support her family but she can save about $12 each day after daily expenses.

This is the eighth loan for Chun with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She completely paid back the past loans which have helped her better support her family. Now she is applying for another loan to pay for her daughter’s university tuition fees, in the faculty of accounting and finance. She hopes to keep her daughter in school until graduation. 

Note: This is her picture with her daughter.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s university tuition fees

loans.name: Khoern's Group

texts.en:
Khoern is 58 years old and married. She lives with her husband and five children in a rural area located in the district of Moung Russey, Cambodia. She is a rice farmer who has been growing rice for ten years. To increase the family's income, her husband works for others for a fee and raises pigs. She is able to earn about 23,000 KHR per day. 

This is the second loan for Khoern with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now leading her group of five to ask for a loan, Khoern who is the leader, will use her portion to spend on harvesting rice and use a portion of it to spend on buying pig feed. She hopes to make more income from her current business so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, flour, and sugar to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish and palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Kashym

texts.ru: Кашым 62 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Кашым - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Кашым занимается животноводством, стартовав 23 года назад, с покупки скота на 8,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Кашым, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь, 1 бычок, 20 овец, 1 теленок. Ежемесячный доход составляет 11,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кашым обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Кашым планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Kashym is 62 years old, is married, and is raising three children with her husband. Kashym has a secondary education, and her main income for the family is animal husbandry, which she started 23 years ago with 8,000 KGS worth of cattle. Thanks to her hard work, Kashym now has two dairy cows, one horse, one bulll, 20 sheep, and one calf. Her monthly income is 11,000 KGS. 

In order to grow her business, Kashym has applied for a loan from Bai Tushum and Partners. She plans to buy a cow and increase the size of her flock. Kashym will use the income generated from this loan to obtain additional cattle, and plans to save enough money for home renovations.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Ama's Group

texts.en:
Ama's Group is made up of two women who are 38 years old on average and have three children between them. They live in nuclear families with their husbands and children in the Teshie neighbourhood of the city of Accra. 

These women know one another through their neighbourhood, friendship, and business ties. In order to strengthen their financial means to better conduct their businesses, they joined the micro finance institution ID-Ghana and are on their eighth loan cycle.

This group of women sells maize and plastic products. Ama sells corn dough and with her loan she plans to purchase two bags of maize from the wholesale market. She sells her wares in the market and at home for cash and credit to a group of customers that is largely made up of women. 

Ama expects to see an average monthly profit of 100 GHS, which will be used to repay the loan and reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy two bags of maize and make corn dough to sell to customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase the tools needed for his tractor to cultivate and harvest the land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more food products and other various materials for her food shop.

loans.name: Alphonce

texts.en:
Alphonce lives in Kakamega. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya and is famous for its rain forest. Many farmers in the area grow maize, sugar cane and bananas, with maize being the primary crop. The density of the old growth trees in the Kakamega forest and the variety of crops grown in the area make this an excellent area for beekeeping.

Alphonce is married and has seven children. His wife is a housewife, while he works in the farming industry. He has been farming for two years and he is currently growing vegetables and trees. He also maintains poultry. Alphonce is excited about beekeeping because it would help him earn some extra income and provide him with honey for medicinal use.

This would be Alphonce’s first loan through Honey Care. He would like to use the loan proceeds to buy beehives. He intends to use the income generated form his beehives to pay for his children's school fees. Alphonce’s hope for the future is to live a happy and comfortable life after his children have completed their education.

loans.use: to produce honey by purchasing beehives.

loans.name: Maa Ambica Self Help Group

texts.en:
Maa Ambica Self Help Group is a group consisting of 13 members, all of whom are women. These entrepreneurs are very humble, hardworking and responsible people with good manners and lots of enthusiasm to improve their lives. 

A few years back they all were facing the same kind of situation of poverty, so they planned to start grocery shops where they can provide the basic household consumables to their customers. One of them is Babita, who was selected as their president. 

Babita is a 35-year-old lady living with her husband and her three children who are at their schooling. The lady in the picture sitting fourth from the right in the front row is Babita. Her husband works as a labourer in a factory situated near to her village. She runs a grocery shop to help her husband financially. She sells rice, grains, lentils, edible oil, spices, biscuits, soap, detergent, hair oil, etc. in her shop. She has developed a very good relationship with her customers in the village. She likes the fact that she can cater to the needs of the people in her village. 

She has a plan to make her shop bigger and keep multiple things in her shop to satisfy her customers. She also wants to purchase the items for her shop in bulk directly from the wholesalers, for which she has requested a loan for purchasing items like toothbrushes, toothpaste, soft drinks, wheat flour, grains and other household consumables.

loans.use: to purchase items like toothbrushes, toothpaste, soft drinks, wheat flour, grains and other household consumables for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to produce honey by purchasing beehives.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to produce honey by purchasing beehives.

loans.name: Awori

texts.en:
Awori lives in Malava, in Kakamega County. Kakamega County is located in Western Kenya and is famous for having the only tropical rain forest in the country. Most farmers in Kakamega grow maize, but sugarcane, papaya, bananas, and tea are also popular crops. The variety of crops grown in the region, as well as the abundance of vegetation in the old-growth forest, makes Kakamega particularly attractive for beekeeping. 

Awori is married and has five children. His wife is a retired manager, and he is a farmer. He has been farming for thirty years, and he is currently raising poultry and dairy cattle and growing tomatoes, monkey nuts, bananas, and beans. Awori is interested in beekeeping because it does not require much input and because it will provide him with honey for medicinal use.

This is Awori’s first loan with Honey Care. He plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to invest in his farm. Awori’s hope for the future is to be a wealthy retiree.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to produce honey by purchasing beehives.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to produce honey by purchasing beehives.

loans.name: Pahhoi Group

texts.en:
Hardworking Chichin is the featured borrower member of Pahhoi Group. Chichin is pictured with her hand raised. To live a life financially independent has always been her desire and it is also understood by her family and the group. She is blessed with three children: two boys and one girl.

Chichin is engaged in poultry and also grows vegetables at the backyard. She grows vegetables according to seasonal changes and sells them to women vegetable vendors. She can earn regularly throughout the year because the backyard is vast and looks like a little vegetable farm with various vegetables. She purchases seeds and saplings from Imphal town and plants them. She grows cabbage, cauliflower, peas, potatoes, etc. in the farm and sales are going well. She prefers to grow vegetables because she loves taking care of the vegetables and also it is her hobby.

She also raises chickens at the backyard and says it is easy for her to do both -- selling vegetables and raising chickens -- because she doesn’t go to the town and sit in the market shed to sell them. Vendors come to her house, get the vegetables and poultry, and take them back to the market for selling.

With the Kiva loan, she will purchase more chicks for the poultry and also buy winter vegetable seeds and saplings. She also said that she won’t have to worry about her children's school admission fees for the year, unlike the previous year when she had to sacrifice her business for their education. 

The beginning of the year is the hardest period as new admission fees are mandatory and she also must provide new books and uniforms for the school-going children. The loan is sure to bring forth both financial and educational benefits for the family for which she is grateful. She says, “Thank you, Kiva.”

The rest of the group members are engaged in piggery, vegetable vending, weaving, managing a variety shop, etc.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and also to purchase seeds and saplings for the vegetable garden.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food products and to pay rent for organizing a new business.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 21-year-old, single young man from Qalqilia city. He lives with his family in a small simple house. His father works as a construction worker with a non-stable income. This is the only source of income for the family. Ahmad is a student in a local university where he studies commerce. He would like to finish his studies and find a job to help his family. 

Ahmad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Ahmad will be able to complete his studies and take the BA degree. Ahmad appears in the city.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Farzona

texts.en: Farzona was born in 1991. She is a smart and hardworking woman. Farzona is a student of the first course. She studies at the Pedagogical University of Tajikistan. She is a successful student. She wants to work in a school after graduating university. Farzona wants to teach youth. She is not married. Her parents are poor people. Farzona is asking for a loan of 500 USD to pay for tuition. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Ramatoulaye's Group

texts.fr:
Les deux femmes qui le composent sont très engagées dans le développement de leur organisation,  toutes issues du même quartier. Elles ont un esprit d’entre aide et de solidaire très remarquable.  Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Ramatoulaye (debout à droite), est l’emprunteuse vedette. Elle est membre de son banc villageois depuis sa création. C’est une femme très courageuse est joue un rôle déterminant dans le bon fonctionnement de son banc. Elle est à son neuvième cycle dans le programme des bancs villageois. Elle est âgée de 39 ans, est mariée et mère de 04 enfants : deux filles et deux garçons. Elle s’active toujours dans la vente de chaussure de fabrication locale et de tissus teintées, activité qu’elle pratique depuis plus de cinq ans. De plus elle tient une boutique où elle vend des produits alimentaire dont la gestion est confiée à un de ses frères.

Avec ce prêt elle compte réorganiser sa boutique ouverte y’a un an déjà en achetant en quantité certains produits manquants détergent liquide et en poudre et des paquets de bonbons et biscuits.

Les bénéfices lui permettent en plus d’asseoir ses activités en renforçant son épargne, d’assister son mari dans la gestion quotidienne de la famille.
texts.en:
The two women who make up this group are very committed to the development of their organisation and both come from the same district. They have a remarkable sense of cooperation and mutual support, and both have small trading businesses.

Ramatoulaye (who is standing on the right in the photo) is the main borrower. She has been a member of her Banc Villageois since it was set up. She is a very courageous woman and has a decisive role in the smooth operation of her Banc. She is on her ninth cycle of the Banc Villageois program. She is 39 years old, married and mother to four children: two girls and two boys. She still actively sells shoes that are made locally and dyed fabrics; she has been doing this for more than five years. Furthermore, she has a shop where she sells groceries; she has entrusted the management of this shop to one her brothers.

With this loan she is planning to reorganise her shop, which has been open for a year now, by buying a large quantity of certain products that are missing, such as liquid and powder detergent, as well as packets of candy and biscuits.

The profits will enable her to put more into her business by boosting her savings and to help out her husband with the family's daily outgoings.

loans.use: to reorganize her shop, which has been open for a year now, by buying a large quantity of certain products that are missing such as liquid and powder detergent and packets of candy and biscuits.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is  a married woman from Trinidad, Bohol, and has four children. Alicia has been in business for more than seven years now. This business is the source of her income.

As of now, Alicia needs additional capital for her business. She is asking for a loan to buy more stock, like canned goods, candies, biscuits and snack foods, soda and beverages, cooking ingredients, and others. With this, she will be able to improve her store, thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more stock, like canned goods, candies, biscuits and snack foods, soda and beverages, cooking ingredients, and others

loans.name: Ma. Ruth

texts.en: To make a living, Ma. Ruth operates a general store in her village. For more than seven years in the business, she has earned well for the family and has successfully repaid her previous loan used to purchase goods to sell. She needs to offer more goods in order to gain more income. She took a new loan from GDMPC to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is married with three children. She operates a piggery to make a living. She has been raising pigs for more than two years earning well for the family. To make improvements to the business, she took a new loan from GDMPC to buy additional piglets. She is hopeful to gain more income and use it for business expansion to improve the general living of the family.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets.

loans.name: Induwasini Devi

texts.en: Induwasini Devi is 54 years old, married and the mother of two children. She lives in the town of Uttarjhitkaiya, which is in the Bara district of Nepal. She and her husband have been running a hotel for the last eight years. She wants to expand her small hotel food stall and needs 50,000 Nepalese Rupees to do this. Her food stall has done well, and people now seek it out when they are hungry. That is why she would like to expand her business, improve her standard of living and give her children a good education.

loans.use: to expand a food stall.

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en: Mwanatumu is married and the mother of four children. She describes herself as loyal and God-fearing, and operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been in this business for nine years and has done well because she sells her clothing in a good location to both men and women. Her biggest business challenge is price fluctuations, and she plans to use this Kes 50,000 loan to buy more clothing to sell. Her goal is to be a supplier within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will save enough money to give her family a good life. She plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Awil Mohamoud

texts.en: Awil Mohamoud is 23 years old. He studies at Gollis unversity faculty of Islamic studies. He faces a major problem in his learning. His problem is the lack of a laptop. He came to Kaaba MFI to lend him a laptop and Kaaba will provide him with a laptop that he can pay for in monthly installments.

loans.use: To buy a laptop for education purposes.

loans.name: Chhabindra

texts.en:
Chhabindra is a 42-year-old married man, living in the area of Nayagarh, Odisha, India. He is the father of two sons and a daughter. 

He is very hard-working and an honest person. He owns a small restaurant in which he offers various types of delicious foods. He offers breakfast, lunch, and dinner to the common people. He has been running this restaurant for 15 years, generating reasonable income for his family. He cooks delicious food for the restaurant and the people like to eat at his restaurant. 

The condition of his restaurant is not good, with scratched walls, low seating arrangements, a dark room, and there is no electricity available. The customer has to face these problems and they feel hesitation to come inside the restaurant. He does not want to disappoint his valued customers. 

Chhabindra  wants to establish his restaurant in the form of a redecorated restaurant. He wants to paint the walls, provide electricity, and buy new plastic furniture and new crockery. Therefore, Chhabindra  requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, People's Forum, so that he can maintain his restaurant in good condition and it can be attractive. 

Chhabindra  thanks Kiva and appreciates the warm support from his supporters.

loans.use: To paint the walls, provide electricity, and to buy new plastic furniture and crockery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an automatic sewing machine and to start her own business.

loans.name: Suega

texts.en: Suega is a 34-year-old married woman with 4 children. She makes and sells ice cakes in her community to earn a living. She has 2 years of experience with this business. Suega needs a loan to buy plastic cups, cordial flavors, a cooler, and sugar. She plans to use her profits to buy more ingredients to improve her business and help with family matters. Suega has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy plastic cups, cordial flavors, a cooler, and sugar.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is 22 years old and married with 2 children. She has a small garden where she grows pineapples that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 2 years. Joyce needs a loan to buy fertilizer, pineapple seeds, shovels, and gloves. She has been a member of SBPD since 2013. Joyce will use the profits from her sales to support her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pineapple seeds, shovels, and gloves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Faaseseina

texts.en: Faaseseina is a 41-year-old widow with 7 children. She runs a small business selling meat buns in her community, and she has been doing this for 2 years. Faaseseina has requested a loan to buy flour, cooking oil, a large cooking pot, salt, onions, soy sauce, and meat. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. Faaseseina will use her business profits to help her business and her family.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, a large cooking pot, salt, onions, soy sauce, and meat.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Rosa is an 18-year-old lady with no children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro plants and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Rosa has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, a wheelbarrow, a rake, a bush knife, gloves, and a mist blower. She has been a member of SBPD since 2013. With her profits, Rosa hopes to provide for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, a wheelbarrow, a rake, a bush knife, gloves, and a mist blower.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is 32 years old and married with 2 children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community, and she has been doing this for 2 years. Marie has requested a loan to buy cooking oil, a large cooking pot, flour, sugar, and a new oven. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Marie will provide for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, a large cooking pot, flour, sugar, and a new oven.

loans.name: Pala

texts.en: Pala is a 52-year-old woman with 7 children. She runs a business selling goods in her community. She has 3 years of experience in this business. Pala has requested a loan to buy sugar, salt, flour, rice, soft drinks, snacks, and soap. She plans to use her profits to save for her family's daily needs. She has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, flour, rice, soft drinks, snacks, and soap.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase materials and other inventory to meet clients' orders on time

loans.name: Hazem

texts.en:
Hazem is a 23-year-old single, young man from a small village near Jenin. He lives with his family in a small, simple house. His father works as a taxi driver with a non-stable income. This is the only source of income for the family. Hazem is a student in a local university where he studies marketing. He would like to finish his studies and find a job to help his family.
 
Hazem took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Hazem will be able to complete his studies and earn a BA degree. 

Hazem appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is 55 years old and lives in Tagbilaran City. She is married, with adult children. 

For six years now, Luz has been raising hogs near her house to help her husband, who is a carpenter. 

She is asking for a loan to buy food for her family and hog feed. She is determined to make the best of her business, so she can raise healthy hogs, support her family with nutritious food, and pay the household bills. 

In the future, Luz hopes to have a bigger piggery in order to increase her business profits.

loans.use: to buy food for her family and hog feed.

loans.name: 04-07-11-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Thu operates a food stall/restaurant, selling vegetables. Thu has been involved in this business for 3 years, and the main hardship that she faces is a lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase vegetables to resell. 

Thu is 18 years old and she is married with 1 child. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, a urban area in Thanh Hoa Province, with 1 dependent.

Thu is the group leader of the 04-07-11-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. In 2012, Thu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thu has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profits, Thu hopes to buy a motorbike, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to resell

loans.name: 04-04-04-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Nguyên has a retail business selling dry food. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years, and the main hardship that she faces is a lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase candy, biscuits, sugar, and milk to resell.

Nguyên is 61 years old, and she is married with 2 children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, a urban area in Thanh Hoa Province, with no dependents. Nguyên is the group leader of the 04-04-04-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. 

In 2009, Nguyên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profits, Nguyên hopes to build a new house, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase candy, biscuits, sugar, and milk to resell

loans.name: 3.10.609.01.thiệu Chính Group

texts.en:
Ban is 40 years old, and she is married with two children. Ban lives with two dependents in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Ban works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for more than ten years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In 2010, Ban joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is the leader of a six-member group, the 3.10.609.01.Thiệu Chính solidarity group. Ban is applying for a loan to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in the future. 

In the future, Ban hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Gordove

texts.en:
Gordove earns a living and supports the needs of his children by retailing motor spare parts and accessories, and has been in this business for more than seven years. He is earning well from the business, so he was able to successfully repay his previous loans used for the business. From his returns, he improved the business. 

Recently, he borrowed a new loan from GDMPC Microcredit to purchase additional spare parts and motor accessories to resell. His plan for the future is to expand his business for a better future for his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts and motor accessories to resell.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
To make a living, Emerita owns and operates a piggery in her village. While her husband works on their farm, she has been raising pigs for more than seven years and she earns well from this. She had successfully repaid her previous loan, used to buy feed. 

Emerita needs to improve her business, to gain more income for the family. Recently, she took a new loan from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to purchase more piglets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated, to improve and expand her business. She wants to improve the general living situation of her family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more piglets.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
To make a living, Agnes helps her husband in their manufacturing business, making and selling different types of native furniture in their community. For eight years in running the business, the couple earns well and had successfully repaid her previous loan, used for manufacturing material. 

Agnes took a new loan from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to purchase additional materials, like bamboo and varnish. She wants to offer various pieces of made-to-order furniture and be able to gain more income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials, like bamboo and varnish.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is the wife of a teacher in their community, and for more than ten years has been earning well for the family. Aside from this, she is operating a motorcycle transportation business to aid her husband's income. She even used their vehicle for their personal transportation going to and from school. 

Recently, she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC Microcredit to repair the vehicle used for her transportation and services. 

In the future, Belinda wants to improve the general living situation for her entire family.

loans.use: to repair the vehicle used for her transportation and services.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma tiene 43 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Cayalti, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza de animales cerdos, gallinas y cuyes desde hace más de 10 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, Irma se dedica a esta actividad desde que se caso con la finalidad de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y de esta manera ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor producción de los mismos a un mejor precio, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Irma is 43 and lives with her husband in the district of Cayalti, which is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo on the north coast of Peru and whose people make their living in agriculture, business, and livestock.  

Irma has earned her living for more than 10 years raising pigs, hens, and guinea pigs.  Her business is situated in her home.  She got into this business when she got married so she could help her husband with family expenses.  

She has requested a loan of 3,000 soles to buy balanced feed to fatten up her animals so she can offer her customers a better product at a good price, generating more income for the family.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed to fatten up her animals.

loans.name: Albina

texts.es:
Albina tiene 55 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Lagunas, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a brindar servicio de confección de prendas de vestir desde hace más de un año, es una mujer emprendedora, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de insumos telas, hilos, otros para surtir su negocio y su respectiva venta y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Albina, age 55, lives in the Lagunas district.  Her community works in agriculture, commerce, and with livestock.  It is one hour from the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru.

She has been making clothes for over one year.  She is an enterprising woman.

She has requested a loan for 2,000 soles to buy supplies like fabric, thread, and others in order to stock her business and her sales.  This way she will generate greater income for her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business of making clothes.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita works hard to support her family. She is married and has an Internet cafe business in the Philippines.

Juanita requested a PHP 9,500 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase an additional unit and spare parts for her business.

Juanita has been in this business for six years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional unit and spare parts for her business.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
As a married parent of ten children, Juanita works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from coconut-vending. Juanita is borrowing PHP 22,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional ingredients for her business, like flour, margarine, and sugar.

Juanita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her business, like flour, margarine, and sugar.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 50 years old and married, with four children. With one child still in school, Judith works very hard to provide for her family.

Judith runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more items to sell, like vinegar, shampoo, snack foods, cooking oil, and other groceries.

Judith has been in this business for four years and she sells a variety of items, such as vinegar, shampoo, snack foods, cooking oil, and other groceries. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, like vinegar, shampoo, snack foods, cooking oil, and other groceries.

loans.name: Jurenda

texts.en:
Jurenda is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a computer shop business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 50,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy an additional unit for her business.

Jurenda has been in this business for 11 years. She earns additional income from a general store.

Jurenda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy an additional unit for her business.

loans.name: Gocha

texts.en:
Gocha is a 42-year-old married man from the village of Akhalsheni. He lives with his wife and school-aged son. Gocha's wife is a cook at a private dining-room and monthly generates 350 GEL. Gocha is involved in agricultural activity. He works hard on family-owned agricultural land, growing citrus and vegetables. He always has high quality products, which are sold to local retailers for a good price. 

As he has only seasonal income, Gocha decided to start a taxi business and seek credit among local financial institutions. The start-up program, that is joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 300 USD for purchasing a car to serve local people as a taxi driver. The new business initiative will give Gocha a chance to have financial stability and a monthly income. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a car and start a taxi business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to produce honey by purchasing beehives.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to produce honey by purchasing beehives.

loans.name: Kulupa

texts.ru: Кулупе 60 лет, пенсионерка, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 8 детей. У Кулупы - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Кулупа занимается животноводством, стартовав 18 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Кулупы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 2 лошади, 20 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 14,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кулупа обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом -на покупку лошади для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Кулупа планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Kulupa is 60 years old, a pensioner, married, and with her husband has eight children. Kulupa has a secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, Kulupa raises livestock, having begun 18 years ago with a livestock purchase of 5,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Kulupa currently has on her homestead: two dairy cows, two horses, and 20 sheep. Monthly income amounts to 14,000 som (KGS). With the aim of further developing her homestead, Kulupa turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan - to buy horses for fattening and subsequent resale at the market at a premium.

Kulupa plans to invest income from the loan in further propagation of the quantity of domestic livestock.

loans.use: to buy a horse

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda lives in Kakamega. Kakamega is located in Western Kenya and is famous for the Kakamega Forest, the only tropical rain forest in Kenya. It is a very good location for beekeeping due to the old growth trees in the forest and the concentration of farms in the area, which provide bees with a variety of flora.

Linda is single with three children. To earn a living, Linda works as a farmer. She has been farming for ten years and she currently grows sugar cane, bananas, sweet potatoes and other vegetables. Linda is looking forward to beekeeping as it will provide her with honey for food and medicinal use.

This would be Linda’s first loan through Honey Care. She would like to use the loan proceeds to buy beehives. She plans to use the income generated from her beehives to buy more beehives. Linda’s hope for the future is to be self-employed.

loans.use: to produce honey by purchasing beehives.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to produce honey by purchasing beehives.

loans.name: Baktykan

texts.ru: Бактыкан 45 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Бактыкан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Бактыкан занимается животноводством, стартовав 15 лет назад, с покупки скота на 20,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Бактыкан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова с теленком. Ежемесячный доход составляет 8,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бактыкан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Бактыкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на улучшение семейного благополучия.
texts.en:
Baktykan is 45 years old, married, and with her spouse is raising three children. Baktykan has a secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, Baktykan raises livestock, having begun 15 years ago with a livestock purchase of 20,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Baktykan today has on her homestead: one dairy cow with calf. Monthly income amounts to 8,000 som (KGS). With the aim of further developing her homestead, Baktykan turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan - to buy cows for expanding her livestock count.

Baktykan plans to invest income from the loan to further propagation of the quantity of domestic animals, and plans to save money to improve the family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Luis Ángel

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre soltero de 62 años de edad que trabajaba en su propio negocio de producción y comercialización de embutidos, especialmente chorizos, trabajó durante 15 años, logrando una amplia experiencia y un reconocimiento en el sector por la calidad de sus productos, pero hace algún tiempo la vida le dio un duro golpe con el fallecimiento de su madre con quien vivía, y entró en una gran depresión que hizo que su negocio se cerrara. Actualmente se encuentra en una difícil situación económica ya que está desempleado por su avanzada edad, razón por la que desea reactivar el negocio de los chorizos y aprovechar que aún existen antiguos clientes que le solicitan el producto; para ello solicita el apoyo del crédito, que invertirá en la compra de un asador, una fritadora, mesas, sillas y realizará la adecuación del espacio, con esto podrá reiniciar su labor y comenzar a generar ingresos para su sustento diario.
Luis manifiesta con el apoyo que se le brinda con el crédito podrá cumplir su mayor anhelo que es volver a sentirse útil y productivo para no tener que depender de sus familiares, además es consciente que debe trabajar con esfuerzo y mucha dedicación para recuperar la clientela y poco a poco fortalecer su negocio, lo que le permitirá en un futuro, poder disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luis, age 62, is a single man.  He used to work in his own business of producing and selling cold meats, especially sausages.  He worked for 15 years, gaining vast experience and recognition in the area for the quality of his products.

However, some time ago life dealt him a difficult blow when his mother, with whom he lived, passed away.  He entered into a great depression which caused the closure of his business.  He is now in a difficult financial situation.  He is unemployed because of his advanced age.  That is the reason that he wants to reactivate his sausage business.  He wants to take advantage of old customers that still request his product.

That is why he is requesting the support of the loan.  He will use the loan to buy a grill, a fryer, tables, and chairs.  He will adapt the space.  With this he will be able to restart his work and begin to generate income for his daily support.

Luis says that with the support provided with the loan he will be able to fulfill his greatest desire, which is to once again feel useful and productive without having to depend on his relatives.

Also, he is aware that he needs to work with great effort and dedication to regain his customers and, little by little, strengthen his business.  This will allow him to, in the future, be able to enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a grill, a fryer, tables, and chairs, and to adapt the space.

loans.name: Inom

texts.ru: Ином очень трудолюбивый мужчина. Он добрый  и заботливый отец. Ему 46 лет, он женат и имеет 5 детей. Вот уже около 15- лет  он занимается строительством. Работает мастером  и получает хорошую заработную плату. А также, когда нет больших заказов Ином подрабатывает, у него имеется свой небольшой магазин, где он продаёт продукты питания. Также один из его сыновей работает в России и присылает домой некоторую сумму денежных средств. Всего дохода Иному хватает, чтобы обеспечивать свою семью всем необходимым. Но сейчас Ином хочет сделать хороший ремонт в своём доме, так как дом пришёл в негодное состояние. А всей необходимой суммы для ремонта у него не имеется. Поэтому Ином обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку строительных материалов для ремонта своего дома. Он очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Inom is a very hardworking man. He is a kind and loving father. He is 46 years old. He is married and has five children. For around 15 years already, he has been involved in construction. He works as a foreman and gets a good salary. And when he does not have big orders, Inom still earns money. He has his own small store, where he sells groceries. Also, one of his sons is working in Russia and sends home a certain sum of money. All the income is enough for Inom to provide his family with all the necessities.

But now Inom wants to make good repairs on his home, since the home has come to a state of disrepair. But he does not have all the needed sums for repairs. Therefore, Inom turned to Arvand and wants to receive a loan to buy building materials for home repairs. He very much hopes for a positive result and thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Ravdanbazar

texts.en:
Mr.Ravdanbazar is 55 years old lives with his wife in Ger, in a traditional nomadic yurt in Zavhan province, Mongolia. His wife Byambasuren is 53, retired and stays at home. 
Ravdanbazar has been working at a local company for years and has recently retired. He purchased a second hand car to start his taxi service business in town during the summer of 2013. He has been running his taxi service for few months now and has already become well-known among clients with his reliable and safe service. He is now requesting loan of 500,000 MNT to purchase spare parts and install them on his car to continue his business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and install them on his car to continue his business

loans.name: Sokchea

texts.en:
From a rural area of Prey Chhor, Kampong Cham, Sokchea is a 34-year-old married woman and is an experienced farmer who grows rice on her own farmland. Having been in this business for more than 10 years, she can generate an income of USD 5.00 per day. She usually uses her income to cover her daily costs and allowances for some of her children.

During this harvest season the price of rice price is lower, so Sokchea would like to buy bags of rice to store for the future needs of her family. Due to insufficient capital she is requesting a loan of USD250 from HKL, along standing Kiva partner. She is looking forward to approval of her request to help her improve her family.

loans.use: to buy rice to store for the future needs of her family.

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita is a married woman and a mother of three children from Trinidad, Bohol. She is a farmer and has been in the farming business for more than five years now. Florita wants to improve her farm but lacks the capital to do so.

Florita joined CEVI to gain access to loan services offered by the organization to micro entrepreneurs like her. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm thus augmenting her yield and income. 

In the future, Florita hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Togoldor

texts.en:
Mr.Togoldor is 21 years old. He lives with his mother and two brothers in a rental apartment in the Ih-Toiruu area of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Tolgoldor and his mother have just started their family business of a grocery store, located in a rental place. His older brother works at a local company and his younger brother is a university student. 

Togoldor is a very hard-working and caring son to his mother. He helps her mother and they work as partners in their business. He has been working at various places since he was a university student and he has the skills and knowledge to run their business. 

Togoldor is now requesting a loan of MNT 6,000,000 to purchase a large amount of food inventory to sell at his store for Lunar New Year.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of food inventory to sell at his store for Lunar New Year.

loans.name: Sobirjon

texts.en: Sobirjon was born in 1983. He is married and has three children. He lives with his parents, wife, and children in a rural area. He has been busy with growing agricultural crops for more than four years. Near his house, he grows cabbages, cucumbers, etc. He sells his products in a local market. Sobirjon’s wife and mother help him to manage the business. He is ready to plant, but he does not have money to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds. He is asking for a loan of 4,000 TJS to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: Zainab is a 38-year-old married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be God fearing. She operates a retail business where she sells handbags and shoes. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a marketable place and her customers are mostly ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy stock of shoes and handbags. Her business goal is to be a supplier within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will be comfortable. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of KES 10,000 was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy stock of shoes and handbags.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a 44-year-old divorced woman who lives with her brother's family. She decided to get a divorce because of personal reasons. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She did not want to be a burden on her brother so she started a tailoring service 12 years ago. From this business she earns 2,000 INR per month.

Salma requested a INR 25,000 loan through People's Forum to buy an extra sewing machine and more materials like fabric, thread, needles, etc. for her sewing business.

Salma has a plan to start a tailoring training center so she wants to take a loan for that. In the future, Salma would like to save enough money so she can help and support her brother's family and will able to live independently.

loans.use: to buy an extra sewing machine and more materials like fabric, thread, needles, etc. for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en: Angeline is a married woman. She has 7 children. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail business where she sells mandazi (east african doughnuts) and fish. Her business is located in a fast growing area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy stock of fish. Her business goal is to expand her business and be a wholesaler within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy stock of fish

loans.name: Ahunjon

texts.en: Ahunjon was born in 1957. He is married and has adult children. He has been busy with growing agriculture products since 1983. Ahunjon grows cucumber, onions, tomatoes, etc. He has his own land. Ahunjon has great experience. Ahunjon’s children help him to grow vegetables. Ahunjon wants to make a new planting, but he has insufficient money. He is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Maimoana

texts.en: Maimoana is a 40-year-old woman who is single with 2 children. She runs a business selling food and local goods in her community. She has 2 years of experience with this business. Maimoana has requested a loan to buy sugar, flour, rice, soft drinks, and snacks. She plans to use her profits to save for family needs. She has been a member of SPBD since 2008.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, rice, soft drinks, and snacks.

loans.name: Lesitala

texts.en: Lesitala is a 57-year-old married woman with 5 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. Lesitala has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, a wheelbarrow, a mist blower, a spade, a rake, and a bush knife. She has been a member of SBPD since 2009. With her profits, Lesitala hopes to save for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, a wheelbarrow, a mist blower, a spade, a rake, and a bush knife.

loans.name: Piilua

texts.en: Piilua is 31 years old and married with no children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, bananas, and yams that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 3 years. Piilua needs a loan to buy fertilizer, gloves, a wheelbarrow, a rake, a mist blower, and a bush knife. She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. Piilua will use the profits from her sales to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, gloves, a wheelbarrow, a rake, a mist blower, and a bush knife

loans.name: Mariama's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de femmes dont le nom « Diambars de Doumassou » expression qui signifie vaillant. Ces dernières partagent  des valeurs de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles vivent dans le même quartier, et ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Mariama (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants dont 02 garçons et 04 filles.  Malgré son âge avancé, elle demeure une dame très active et elle tient une cantine au marché central où elle vend des produits de consommation courante huile, pomme de terre, ognon, concentré de tomate, bouillons et divers condiments.

Avec son nouveau crédit, elle compte acheter 05 sacs de pomme de terre et d’ognon, des cartons de bouillons pour la revente au détail.

Avec les bénéfices tirés de cette activité, elle compte accroitre son épargne d’une part et d’autre part améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille sur le plan nutritionnel.
texts.en:
This group is made up of women whose name "Diambars de Doumassou" is an expression which means valiant. These women share the same values of solidarity and mutual support. They live in the same district and all have small trading activities.

Mariama (who is standing on the far right of the photo with her hand raised) is the star borrower of the group. She is married and mother to six children: two boys and four girls. Despite her advanced years, she remains a very active lady and has a stall in the central market where she sells everyday consumer goods such as oil, potatoes, onions, tomato concentrate, stock and various condiments.

With her new loan she is planning tp buy five sacks of potatoes and onions, as wells as cartons of cooking stock which she will resell on a retail basis.

With the profits she makes from this activity, she plans to increase her savings on the one hand and on the other improve her family's living conditions with regard to their nutrition.

loans.use: to buy five sacks of potatoes and onions, as well as cartons of cooking stock for retailing.

loans.name: Teonila Elizabeth

texts.es:
Teonila Elizabeth tiene 47 años de edad, vive junto a familia en el distrito de Cayaltí, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir y costura, su taller se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, es una madre que se esfuerza en la labor que realiza, ha solicitado un préstamo de 800 nuevos soles para la compra de de insumos para su negocio telas, hilos, entre otros para seguir confeccionando prendas en mayor cantidad y de esta manera ofrecerlo a sus clientes, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Teonila Elizabeth is 47 and lives with her family in the district of Cayaltí, which is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo and whose people work in agriculture, business, and livestock.  

She earns her living sewing clothing.  Her shop is situated in her house.  She is a mother who works hard at her job.  She has requested a loan of 800 soles to buy supplies including fabric, thread, etc., so she can keep making lots of clothing to sell to her clients to generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her garment sewing business.

loans.name: Pramila

texts.en:
Pramila is 40 years old, a widow who lives with her two children aged 15 years and 13 years. She has taken care of and brought up her children with great effort and love. Once they were older she had more free time so she began to teach herself different crafts such as sewing, decorating terracotta statues of Lord Jagannath, and other handicrafts. Little by little she created her products and began to sell them to her neighbors and friends. She added in clothing, which added to her income. This has generated income which supports her household finances.

The loan she is seeking will be used to invest in the purchase of supplies and merchandise at wholesale as Samuka (used for decoration) items, wood, fabric, thread, paint, etc. This will allow her to continue to work and offer more variety to her customers. It will also allow her to fill the orders she already has and will increase her sales and income. 

Pramila states that her future plans are to strengthen and grow her business even more with the aim of generating job opportunities for some family members who need a job and thereby improve the quality of life for her whole family.

loans.use: To buy wholesale supplies and merchandise such as Samuka items, wood, fabric, thread, paint, etc.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes to sell. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a fast growing area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy a new sewing machine. She hopes that in the future, she will buy a piece of land. She will use the anticipated profits to open another business.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.en:
Ignacia raises pigs to earn a living. This has been her source of income for a long time now. Her desire is to be of help to her husband, who is a farmer. 

Ignacia is asking for a loan to buy hog feed to keep her hogs healthy. By giving them enough to eat, she can expect a better return on her investment in four months' time. Her income will be used for the family daily's consumption, household bills, and business expansion.  

Ignacia is from Corella, Bohol, and her chilren are all adults.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hogs

loans.name: Aslan

texts.en: Aslan is a 21-year-old married man from the village of Ochkhamuri, Kobuleti District. He has a big family that includes 9 members. His brother is involved in a trading business and generates 370 GEL monthly. His mother gets assistance from the local government, and other family members are involved in agricultural activity. Aslan works hard on family-owned agricultural land, growing maize and nuts. The family also has milk cows and 3 cattle and always has high quality products, which are sold to local retailers for a good price. As the existing income is not enough for 9 family members and Aslan can’t find a state job, he decided to start his own business. He owns a car and decided to start a taxi business. With the requested loan of 1500 GEL, he will install gas equipment and serve locals as a taxi driver. Aslan will take care of his family's increased needs and is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to install gas equipment in his car

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn works hard to support her family. She is single and has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines.

Marilyn requested a PHP 11,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more ready-to-wear to sell.

Marilyn has been in this business for six years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more ready-to-wear to sell.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 45 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Leonila has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional goods to sell in her general store.

Leonila has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 60 years old and single. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like canned goods, snack foods, biscuits, cooking oil, and sugar for her business.

Lilia has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from selling purified drinking water.

Lilia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, snack foods, biscuits, cooking oil, and sugar for her business

loans.name: Ma. Rosa

texts.en:
Ma. Rosa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a retail feed business in the Philippines. Ma. Rosa has been in this business for 18 years now.

Ma. Rosa has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of feeds to sell.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of feeds to sell

loans.name: Macaria

texts.en:
Macaria works hard to support her family. She is married and has a bread vending business in the Philippines. Macaria has been in this business for 2 years now.

Macaria has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her bread production business. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her bread production business

loans.name: Madeline

texts.en:
Madeline is a married woman, with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 51 years old and has four children who are still in school.

Madeline has a used clothing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more used clothing to sell.

Madeline has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Marbini

texts.en:
Marbini is 46 years old and married, with six children.

Marbini works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more stocks to sell, like bread, biscuits, snack foods, shampoo, and detergent soap.

Marbini has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and she earns additional income from farming corn.

Marbini aspires to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell, like bread, biscuits, snack foods, shampoo, and detergent soap.

loans.name: Maria Chuchi

texts.en: Maria Chuchi works hard to support her family.  She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.  Maria Chuchi has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like sticky rice, sugar, coconut, etc. for her food production business.  She has been in this business for 15 years now.  She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like sticky rice, sugar, coconut, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Maria Jean

texts.en: Maria Jean is a hardworking entrepreneur who has purified drinking water business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy more containers of purified drinking water to sell for her business.  Maria Jean has been in this business for 10 years.  She also earns more income from food vending and raising livestock.  Maria Jean has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more containers of purified drinking water to sell

loans.name: Maria Nida

texts.en: Maria Nida is 55 years old and married with four children.  She works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store.  Maria Nida has borrowed and paid back 11 loans from NWTF before this loan.  She has been running the general store for 7 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.  Maria Nida aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en: Marichu is 28 years old and married with three children.  With three children in school, Marichu works very hard to provide for them.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.  Marichu has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, fabric conditioner, shampoo, laundry soap, dried fish, canned goods, etc.  In the future, Marichu would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Kouser

texts.en:
Kouser is a 42-year-old married woman who has been running a milk-selling business with her husband for the past seven years. 

She has two buffalo from which she sells the milk to the people of her locality. She also sells animals on a seasonal basis to generate an extra profit. 

Kouser has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. 

Currently Kouser is in her seventh loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. This will allow her to purchase one more buffalo. Kouser is hopeful that this loan will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Dolores Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Dolores tiene 49 años de edad, originaria de la ciudad de Estelí. Madre soltera de dos hijos ya independientes. Es una mujer profesional, es de oficio administradora de empresas, se dedica a la gestión de cobros de impuestos. Su meta es tener las mejores condiciones en su vivienda. Solicita un crédito para mejorar las condiciones de saneamiento para su casa, con el fin de garantizarse una seguridad de vida. Estima que el crédito le ayudara a tener una vivienda digna e higiénica con una red sanitaria limpia. Su plan futuro es cancelar el crédito y seguir mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Dolores is 49 and from the city of Estelí.  She is the single mother of two children, now independent.  She's a professional woman, a business administrator who works in tax collection.  Her goal is to have better living conditions in her home.  She's seeking a loan to improve her house's sanitation in order to ensure a more secure life for herself.  She feels that the loan will help her have a decent and hygienic house with a clean sanitation system.  Her plan for the future is to pay off the loan and continue improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to improve the sanitation in her house.

loans.name: Leida Beatriz

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito De Colorado se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Leída, tiene 69 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 4 hijos los mismo que  ya son mayores de edad, una de sus hijos  aun vive con ella. Su esposo es chofer, tiene un tanquero y una volqueta.
Doña Leida es una muy buena esposa que realiza el crédito para el negocio del su esposo, el tiene una volqueta y un tanquero y se dedica a la venta de material pétreo y agua,  como por el sector por donde ellos viven no hay agua potable  aprovecha su esposo para venderles a la personas que necesitan de este liquido vital, el también les entrega material pétreo a ciertas constructoras. Su esposo lleva dedicado a este negocio ya por más de 17  años con el cual han sacado adelante a su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar agua y material pétreo. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el inicio y le gusta por la ayuda que les ha dado el banco. Su sueño es comprar otro carro nuevo.
texts.en:
El Grupo De Crédito De Colorado [Colorado Lending Group] meets every two weeks in Colorado in the county Montecristi, known for its rich precolonial culture and for its handcrafts, which are recognized nationally and internationally. It is famous for its Panama hats.
It is here that Leída lives. She is 69 years old; she is married and has 4 adult children from this relationship, one of whom still lives with her. Her husband is a driver; he has a tanker and a dump truck.
Leída is a very good wife who is requesting the loan for her husband’s business. He has a dump truck and a tanker, and he makes his living selling stone materials and water. Since in the area where they live there is no potable water, her husband takes advantage of the opportunity to sell it to people who need this vital liquid. He also delivers stone material to several construction companies. Her husband has been doing this business for more than 17 years, with which he has supported his family.
This loan is to buy water and stone material. She has been in the Grupo De Crédito since it began, and she likes it because of the help that the bank has given them. Her dream is to buy another new car.

loans.use: to buy water and stone material.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a married woman and a mother of two children. She is from San Miguel, Bohol. Maricel earns a living through her retail sales of dry goods and others items. 
Maricel is asking for a loan to buy more goods to sell like slippers, umbrellas, and school supplies. With this she will be able to improve her stocks thus allowing her to sell more and augment her sales and income.

loans.use: o buy more goods to sell like slippers, umbrellas, and school supplies

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a married man. He describes himself to be courageous. He operates a retail business where he sells basins, jugs, cooking pans, plastic containers, and other items. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a competitive place, and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds to buy more inventory. He will use the 80,000 KES loan to buy inventory items such as basins, jugs, cooking pans, plastic containers, and other items. His business goal is to be reliable within five years. He hopes that in the future, his family will be successful. His previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business by buying more inventory.

loans.use: to buy basins, jugs, cooking pans, plastic containers, and other items

loans.name: Trinatha Group

texts.en:
Sarada is the leader of a group that hails from Muniguda village of Rayagada district of Odisha, India. She is a married woman of 46 years. She has a small family comprised of five members, including one daughter aged about 20 years and two sons aged about 22 and 18 years. The member standing second from left with raised hand is Sarada.

Sarada has been running a grocery shop in her locality for the last five years. She looks after the shop. In the morning her husband helps to run the shop. After completion of her housework, she spends the rest of her time in the business. Her husband does seasonal business. He goes to nearby villages and purchases seasonal grains and sells them in the Muniguda market. This will be her third loan from Mahashakti Foundation for the development of her business. Sarada took out her first loan in 2012 with three other members from her locality.

At present her monthly income is about Rs.5,000, but that is not sufficient to lead a better life. So, she wants to take a loan to purchase  rice, oil, sugar, salt, potatoes, onions, washing powder, soap, tea, biscuits, etc. for her grocery shop. This will be the third loan cycle for the group. Sarada's future business plan is to be a wholesaler.

The other three members of the group, Dharitri, Madhabi and Krishnabeni, want a loan for their existing businesses of vegetable vending, a welding shop, and a grocery shop respectively.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, sugar, salt, potatoes, onions, washing powder, soap, tea, biscuits, etc. for her grocery shop

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 36-year-old married man with four children. He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He is a Grade III primary teacher, which is how he earns a living.

David also sells sugarcane to earn an extra income. He started this business to earn income for the better of his family, because he faces a challenge of low and delayed salaries of Primary teachers. He has hopes of becoming self employed and ensuring that all his children attain better education.

He is requesting a loan to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land.

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a housewife and is 36 years old. She looks after her family, including five children. She is a very hardworking and punctual lady. Her husband is the sole earner of the family. He works in laundry related items preparation. He buys the necessary raw materials from the market for the preparation of laundry related items like laundry soaps, detergents, surfs, etc. He works hard and honestly for the better earning to support the family; he is providing better detergents and other necessary cleaning items to the launders as well as retailers.

Rukhsana wants to take loan so that her husband will be able to get more raw items and prepare more and reliable laundry items. In this way, Rukhsana’s husband is able to provide better financial support to the family to maintain their standard of living.

Rukhsana is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy bleach and glycerin for making soap and detergent to sell to retailers.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: Vincent is a 40-year-old married man. He has four children between the ages of 4 and 12. He describes himself to be confident. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, milk, bread, washing soap, and other items. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a conducive environment, and his primary customers are small-scale customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. He will use the 50,000 KES loan to add inventory of milk, bread, washing soap, and other items. His business goal is to be prosperous within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy milk, bread, washing soap, and other items

loans.name: Sinay

texts.en:
To make a living, Sinay owns and operates a rice farm in Prasat Bakong district, Siem Reap province. She has been in this field for nearly 14 years and uses her farming income to supplement her husband's income. He is a construction worker. This couple doesn’t have any children, but they aim to have one soon.

The challenge for Sinay’s family is that they don’t have their own motorcycle for commuting, so they have to pay a taxi for a ride. To help reduce the travelling expenses, Sinay would like to buy a motorcycle to fulfill their daily needs. Due to a lack of funds, she has applied for a loan of 1,000 USD from HKL and Kiva lenders. She expresses her thanks to all lenders for their generosity towards poor individuals like her to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 60-year-old married man from a small village near Nablus city. He lives with his wife and five kids, two sons and three daughters, in a small simple house.
